They are all involved in the purchase and sale of firewood, peppers, lemons and okra. In order to satisfy growing customer requests, the women have decided to be involved in the loan program from Soro Yiriwaso and ask for their second loan.
Diani (the middle woman standing in this photo) sells many types of condiments. She plans to use her loan to purchase 30 buckets of peppers from the farmers at the Médine market. She sells her products in exchange for cash or credit to a customer base largely comprised of women, from both her home as well as the Médine market. She hopes the loan will allow her to earn a monthly income of 25,000 FCFA (~49 USD) that she will reinvest in her activity as well as use to take care of her the needs of her home.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (peppers)

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan is 48 years old and lives with his wife and his two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps out with his job. His older daughter lives separately. One of his other two children is a college student. 

He started his own wooden furniture production business in 2008. He sometimes engraves his work. 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a machine for his wooden furniture service. Jargalsaihan is very experienced in wooden furniture production, and his customers appreciate him as a reliable and punctual man.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his wooden furniture service

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta, de 31 años es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos; después de haber quedado viuda. Alberta se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y dedicación, cultivando sus plantas de café. En tiempos de cosecha y desyerbo siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, así logra avanzar con su labor.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, luego le brindan y una buena obtención y calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situado a una hora de su comunidad. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de café y poder incrementar en sus parcelas, ya que con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras y seguir continuando con su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 09; sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo así como en anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y solidaria. Con 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas injertadas de cacao y café, para poder cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
31-year-old Alberta is a sociable and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her four beloved children who are the driving force behind all her hard work.  Alberta is a widow.

Alberta has been farming since her parents taught her this work at a very early age.  She now has her own farmland which she works with a lot of care and commitment, growing her coffee plants.  At harvest and weeding time she has the support of laborers who help her to make progress in her work.  

What Alberta most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land because that is when she feels that the months of hard work are paying off as she enjoys good yields and good-quality crops.  She has been in this business for 14 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops from her community to the warehouse centers which are located one hour away.  Alberta will use the loan she has requested to buy coffee plants and  expand her plantings.  Over time, she hopes to put together enough money to buy additional land and continue in her work.  This is her ninth loan and she is aware that she has the responsibility of making her loan repayments punctually.  She is prepared to do this as she has with her previous loans.

Alberta is an active and supportive member of her community bank.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy grafted cacao and coffee plants to grow on her land.

loans.use: to buy grafted cacao and coffee plants

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold is 53 years old and lives with his wife, two sons and a daughter in a small private house in Ulaanbaatar. His wife is a chief cook. His two sons and wife will help him with his business, and his daughter is a student at the Radio & Television University of Mongolia. 

From 2009 to 2011 Batbold worked in the ASSAIT cafe as a cook. Because of his and his wife's experience, he has decided to start his own cafe. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to have working capital to purchase culinary equipment. 

The location he has chosen for his business is in front of the university, therefore, he expects solid sales as soon as he is in operation. He is an honest and hardworking man. Batbold's goal is to buy his own work space.

loans.use: To have working capital to purchase culinary equipment

loans.name: Bayraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her two sons go to the secondary school, and her eldest daughter goes to college. 

In 2003, she started her retail meat business in the trading center of Uvurhangai. Currently, she is also wholesaling sheep with her husband. She uses a mini truck to buy sheep from herders of several provinces in Gobi. In the summer, sheep are cheaper than any other time; therefore, she is requesting a loan of 3,300,000 MNT to purchase some sheep. She is a good-natured woman who says, ''Because a retail business's cash turnover is better than wholesaling, my income will increase." She wants to grow and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich is 47 years old and a resident living in Baray district with his spouse and two single children, while the other three are already married and have independent lives. Pich is a hardworking father who always helps his wife in their farming business and takes care of a healthy family and provides their children with a good education. He has been farming rice and fishing for almost 10 years, and he is able to generate $3 per day from the businesses. 

Pich will not use the loan he borrowed for his personal purpose; however, he will use it to supplement his existing capital to support one of his married children in the purchase of a house. Being a good father, Pich always wants to help his children somehow, as well as he can. He hopes that lenders will give him this loan, which will allow them to have a suitable house.

loans.use: to support one of his married children in the purchase of a house.

loans.name: Mouk

texts.en:
Mouk is from a small village adjacent to a river where she and her spouse usually go fishing to generate income. They started this business 10 years ago, and it has earned their family a decent income, so they can provide basic necessities to all of their children and send them to school. If Mouk collects enough fish from her own boat, she retails them in her village, but sometimes she has to buy additional fish from others to sell.

Right now, Mouk would like to improve her fishing business with the purchase of a new boat, which is bigger than her old one. It will cost $1,200. With the remaining funds, she will purchase additional fish to sell. Through the income from the business, Mouk will save for the expansion of the business, as well as for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat and to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 60 years old and married. She has given birth to two grown-up children. She became a widow in the past few years and has been raising her children in a peaceful village in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. Her main source of income is farming rice on her existing plots of land, where she can earn a decent income for daily living needs. She has been in this type of business for more than 30 years with the full support of her children. Currently, all of her children are working in the construction industry to lift their family out of poverty.

Keo is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle so her children can commute to their workplaces. Keo realizes that this loan will surely help her family’s situation. She hopes that someday her rice-farming business will improve so she can better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so her children can commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Doem

texts.en:
Doem is 40 years old and a resident from the Oddar Meanchey province. She is an industrious farmer who pays full attention to a farming business to earn a living. Doem is married to her husband, also her business partner. They have given birth to three children, one of whom is already married and has an independent life. Doem has been farming alongside her spouse for ages.

Doem wants to make improvements to her current business, so she is taking out a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a water pump for carrying enough water to her crop field. With the rest of the funds, she will hire laborers to work on her potato and bean plantations. She hopes to develop her business gradually and ensure a high production each season.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for carrying enough water to her crop field.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children. To earn a living and provide the family with the basic necessities, Im is involved in fishing and selling fish from a small village located in the Kompong Cham province. She usually goes fishing with her husband and acts as his assistant in order to collect fish. She is able to generate an income of 10,000 KHR each day through the fish-selling business while her husband can earn approximately 15,000 KHR each day from his employment as a motor mechanic.

Im would like to have some funds through HKL to add to her own capital to build a room for her daughter. Also, she will renovate her house partially in order to provide comfortable living conditions for her family. She thanks lenders for helping her to obtain the loan to achieve her dream of having a suitable house.

loans.use: to build a room for her daughters and renovate her house partially.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri grows and harvests seasonal crops, including rice, potatoes, beans, peppers, maize and corn, to sell. She is able to be successful at this due to the rich fertile land surrounding her area. She has been doing this business since she was a teenager, when she helped her parents with the family farm. 

Sri is now 30 years old and married. She has two school-age children who need daily allowances. She wants to provide them with a good education and hopes that they will become professionals one day. She understands that education is the key to helping them avoid working manual labor jobs. 

Sri would like additional working capital to pay for the labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to spread on her crops. With the help of the loan, she hopes to have a fruitful harvest and thus increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs incurred in transplanting rice and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to spread on her crops.

loans.name: Mt Magoroto Group

texts.en:
Husna, who is in her late 20s, is married with two school-going children. Since 2007, she has been running a cafe where she sells food and drinks. She is doing well. She works from 12:30 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Husna is requesting a sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more business stock, pay her children's school fees and cover her household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.

Husna is requesting a loan to increase her cafe stock. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Magoroto," which comprises 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is 44 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. He works hard in the construction industry to raise his three children who are currently attending school. Hem always wishes to provide his family with comfortable living conditions through his hard work in the construction field as well as in the rice field, helping his wife manage their farm. Hem has been active in these businesses for seven years.

Recently, Hem and his team are constructing his house, yet Hem doesn’t have enough capital to purchase necessary supplies for the construction. For this reason, he is applying for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase construction supplies and also pay for labor fees. He hopes that in the near future, he and his family will have a suitable house to live in. He is happy because he can help his children with their living needs and be a good father.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies needed for building his own house.

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Bakari, who is in his early 40s, is married with two children who go to school. He has been running a fish business for 15 years now. He works from 6am to 1pm daily and he is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land and built his house, pay school fees for his children, and cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for this loan to buy more fish to resell. His dream is to one day be able to build a nice house and take good care of his family.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mapinduzi" which totals 13 members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Dorn is operating a rice farming business on his own farmland located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He started this business with only a few lots of farmland he received from his ancestors as his heritage. During his time of entrepreneurship, he developed the business with his expertise gradually, and he also purchased additional farmland to increase his rice production. He is fortunate because he has a good business partner in his wife who honestly helps him in maintaining a good growth of their current business.

Dorn is 49 years of age, married, and has three grown up children who are still at school. Also, they are employed as paid laborers working on a local plantation when they are available from their class schedule. At the moment, Dorn would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva in the amount of 400 USD to purchase necessary supplies needed for his rice crops, such as fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that Kiva lenders will not reject his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies needed for his rice crops, such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun, aged 48, is operating a direct selling business from a rented booth in a local market, where she sells a mixture of vegetables and tamarind fruits every day. This has been a primary source of her family income that allows Tun to provide enough food for her two children in a period of being a widowed mother. She has been in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5.00 USD a day. Both of her children quit studying and help their mother earn income to lift the family out of poverty.

In order to help her children in their transportation needs, Tun is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a motorcycle for them to commute to their workplaces every day. This will avoid their paying for transportation fees daily. Tun hopes that someday her business will improve so that she can better provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children to commute to their workplaces every day.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang is at the age of 42 and a responsible mother who currently lives in a peaceful village of Siem Reap province. She has only one child who is in need of daily allowances for school. Eang owns and operates a few pieces of farmland, on which she grows particularly rice to sell each harvesting season. She has been involved in this type of business for almost six years. Her goal in life is to place her only child in a good college after he graduates from high school, so that then he will have a bright future.

At the present, Eang wishes for a loan of 500 USD to add to her capital in order to build a nice kitchen adjacent to her house where she can cook food to serve her family. She also is building a rice barn to store her grain through the year. This precious loan will enable her family to have a suitable living status.

loans.use: to build a nice kitchen and also build a rice barn.

loans.name: Kady's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 13 décembre 2003 le banc villageois regroupe en son sein des femmes qui partagent l’idéal que toute personne doit être utile à la société et particulièrement à sa famille. Ce groupe de 18 femmes est animé d’une solidarité et entre aide mutuelle. Elles vivent toutes dans la même localité et pratiquent le petit commerce.

Madame Kady (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle âgée de 24 ans, mariée et mère d’une fille et d’un garçon respectivement de 03 et 05 ans. Elle est vendeuse de légume dans le marché de la commune. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des gérants de maraichers en gros pour la revente en petit tas ou à l’unité.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 15 kilos d’ognon à 9 000 FCFA pour la revente à 50 FCFA la pièce, 15 kilos de poissons sec à 22 500 FCFA et la revend en morceau de 100 FCFA et un panier d’oseille à 1 500 FCFA pour la revente en tas de 25 FCFA.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created on December 13, 2003, the Banc Villageois brings together women who share the ideal that everyone must be useful to society and, in particular, to his or her family. The group of 18 women is characterized by solidarity and looking out for one another. The women all live in the same town and are involved in small-scale commerce.

Kady (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 24 years old, married, and mother of one daughter and one son, ages three and five years old respectively. She sells vegetabels at the local market. She stocks up in bulk and resells her goods individually or in small quantity.

With her new loan, she will buy 15 kg of onions at 9,000 FCFA to resell at 50 FCFA per item, 15 kg of dried fish at 22,500 FCFA to resell in 100-FCFA portions, and a basket of sorrel at 1,500 FCFA to resell in 25-FCFA bunches.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy onion, dried fish, and sorrel intended for resale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 32 years old and married to a resident from Siem Reap province, where they are raising three dependent children. Chea does farming on a few hectares of farmland to generate income to satisfy his living needs. In addition, Chea purchases rice from local farmers in his area for trading. He is very thankful for his business that allows him to provide daily food, clothing, enough home use products and other allowances. He has been in this business for almost five years. 

Chea wants to improve his household income by dedicating himself to a fishing business. However, he doesn’t have enough capital to purchase a boat and fishing supplies. Because of this, Chea would like to borrow 300 USD from HKL and Kiva to invest in purchasing supplies for fishing activities.

loans.use: to purchase a boat and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri is 67 years of age and focuses on farming as the major business activity of her family. She is very industrious in maintaining her farm work each season to ensure high production. She always dreams of having a comfortable life with a consistent income to support her family. She particularly grows vegetables to sell besides rice. Her main customers are the market venders, local people and passersby. She has been in this business for most of her lifetime. Ri’s husband helps the family with the financial support he earns from his firewood trading business. This couple looks old but they think that even at their age, they are strong enough to handle their businesses successfully. Ri is a mother of six grown-up children: a single child and five married children.

At the moment, Ri is very busy at her rice fields due to a great deal of farm work to be done in this time of the season. As it’s really hard work, Ri needs to rent a tractor to till the land and also hire a few laborers to help transplant her rice. In connection with this, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR to pay for plowing fees and labor costs. With the remaining portion of the loan, Ri will purchase fertilizers needed for her rice crop. Ri believes that, through the help of the loan, she will have an abundant harvest, and she hopes for better yields than the previous years.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, labor costs and to purchase fertilizers needed for her rice crop.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, aged 34, lives in Baray district with her family that is comprised of six members. She is married to a noble man who is a rice cultivator and a father of four children. Three of her children are attending school and are still dependent on her, while her oldest one is employed in the construction industry.  Prak currently works in the same field of business as her husband, and she serves him as a good assistant. She has been doing this for more than 13 years, and she can earn 8,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each day.

Due to insufficient capital to purchase supplies for her rice, Prak decided to take out a loan in the amount of 1,300,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to spread on her rice crop. This will maintain her rice crop in a good condition and protect it from the challenge of pests. She hopes to yield a better income through the loan help.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to spread on her rice crop.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido trabaja de ayudante de construcción.
 
Al ver ella que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo y que su trabajo no es seguro, hace 12 años le dijo  a su esposo que le construyera un pequeño galpón en el cual comenzó a criar pollos, con el paso del tiempo ella ha aumentado su granja y en la actualidad  tiene hasta 400 pollos por temporada, la misma que dura dos meses tiempo en el cual los pollos están listos para la venta, ella entrega a comerciantes que luego los llevan a sus negocios en los diversos mercados de la ciudad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los pollos para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva más de un año en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “August 30” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza perrish in the city of Portoviejo, a place knows as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional festivals in San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its people’s happiness.

Rosa lives here.  She’s 34 years old and has three children, ages 17, 12, and 7.  They all attend school.  Her husband works in construction.

Having noticed that her husband didn’t earn much and that his wages were not steady, she asked him to build her a small chicken coop 12 years ago, and she began raising chickens.  Over time she has expanded her farm and now has 400 chickens this season.  The season lasts two months and the chickens become ready for sale.  She sells them to merchants who later take them to their various businesses in the city.

She will use the money from this new loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for her chickens so that they develop well.  She has been with the bank for more than a year and she enjoys it because of the help she gets from the loans.

Her dream is to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, age 48, is a diligent father who is currently involved in a construction business to generate income for his living. He provides his service with his construction team at the mobile places around Phnom Penh. He has been in this occupation for almost eight years and he makes approximately 4 USD each day. 

Srey is responsible for four children, three of whom are still dependent. The other one has her own employment. 

Srey is hoping to have a motorcycle for his personal use as well as for his household because his family has to pay much for transportation costs daily without it. For this reason, he would like to have a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a motorcycle. He mentioned that this will help him in commuting to the construction site. In the future, he wants to be a successful entrepreneur who owns construction projects and builds his own team to provide this service.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his personal use as well as for his household.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 34 years old and married with four dependent children. 

She is a humble farmer who grows rice as the main income for her in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has been in this occupation for ages, earning approximately 20,000 KHR each day. She usually uses it for food, allowances for her school-age children and other commodity costs. San is proud that her business is going successfully. 

San hopes for an abundant harvest this season, which is why she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase amendments to put in her soil for a better growth of her rice crop. She has been with HKL five times already and all the loans affected every aspect for her business and living conditions. She hopes that Kiva lenders will fund her loan and will continuously offer a constant help to her family.

loans.use: to purchase soil amendments for a better growth of her rice crop.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Rashid, who is in his mid 30s, is married and has three children who are still in school.  

He has been running a genge business, selling fruits and vegetables, for three years now. He is doing great!  He works from 6 a.m. to 9.p.m. daily and he is able to make a small monthly profit. 

He is requesting his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his business stock, cover household expenses and buy a small radio, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. 

He wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Riziki", which totals 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon, age 40, is a farmer with courage living in a small village of Ang Snoul district, a well known agriculture area. 

Chhon has been engaged in farming on her inherited land for over 10 years. She is 40 years old, married, and has three teenage children who are currently at school. Her husband shares responsibility for the family by dedicating himself to a construction business to supply income.

As of now, Chhon is asking for a loan of 200 USD to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer to spread on her rice in order to maintain a high production. She hopes that she will see all her children finish their studies at a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer to spread on her rice in order to maintain a high production.

loans.name: Marío Francisco

texts.es:
Don Marío tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos pero solo dos dependen económicamente de él. Él es panificador y posee una panadería, donde se elabora pan de toda clase como son: pan dulce de diferentes nombres, novias, semitas dulces y simples, pastel de piña, cachitos simples, alemanas como también pan francés. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus familiares que se dedicaban a esta misma actividad. Hoy en día el negocio es familiar ya que sus hijos y esposa  son panificadores en este oficio, ya tienen  mas de 35 años de ejercer esta actividad.  

La materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, los compra en diferentes tiendas de la ciudad que son proveedores de estos materiales que se encuentran a una distancia de su casa de 2 kilómetros aproximadamente. Como también él tiene  proveedores de estos materiales que se los traen desde la ciudad de San Salvador como es molsa, harinas del norte.  
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es para comprar: 25 bolsas de Harina fuerte (espiga) de trigo, 25 bolsas de Harina suave (espiga) de trigo, 5 bolsas de Levadura                                       ,  5 bolsas de Polvo de hornear, un quintal de sal, 3 quintales de azúcar, un fardo de canela, 2 bolsas de royal, 10 cartones de huevos, 5 carretonadas de leña.           
    
Al comprar toda esta materia prima se podrá producir más pan, ya que la demanda que tiene es muy fuerte y con los ingresos que cuanta no alcanza a comprar la materia prima requerida para la producción.  De esta manera, podrá incrementar sus niveles de inventario y se podrá vender mas por que tendrá mas diversificación de pan. Obteniendo mejores niveles de ingresos o ganancias  con los cuales tiene planeado hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.

Los planes a futuro de Marío, según sea la venta y ganancia de la venta de pan dulce y francés, con los ingresos que obtenga, él quiere  hacer un ahorro para poder comprar un horno industrial para el cocimiento del pan ya que hay temporadas que la leña esta bien escasa.
texts.en:
Marío, age 52, is married and has six children.  Only two of them are financially dependent upon him.  He is a baker, and he has a bakery where he makes all types of bread.  He makes sweet breads with different names like “novias”, “semitas”, “dulces y simples”, “pastel de piña”, “cachitos simples” “alemanas”, and also French bread.

He learned this business activity from his family, which devotes itself to the same business.  His is now a family business because his children and his wife are bakers by trade.  They have been practicing this trade for over 35 years.

He buys the ingredients he needs to make his products at different stores in the city.  The providers of these materials can be found approximately two kilometers from his house.  He also has providers who get different types of flour from the mills in the city of El Salvador. 

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy 25 bags of high gluten wheat flour, 25 bags of wheat pastry flour, five bags of yeast, five bags of baking powder, one “quintal” (about 100 pounds) of salt, three quintales of sugar, a pack of cinnamon, two bags of Royal baking powder, ten cartons of eggs, and five truckloads of firewood.

Upon purchasing these raw materials he will be able to produce more bread.  The demand that he has is very strong, and he does not have enough income to buy the raw materials needed for the production.  This way he will be able to increase the level of investment, and he will be able to sell more because he will have a greater variety of bread.  He will be getting greater income with which he plans to make improvements to his house.

Marío’s plans for the future, according to the income he gets from selling sweet bread and French bread, is to save in order to be able to buy an industrial oven to bake bread.  He wants to do this because there are times when firewood is very scarce.

loans.use: to buy supplies for baking bread.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch is 43 years old and happily lives with her family in Kompong Cham province. Duch earns a living by managing one hectare and a half of land for growing rice. She has her husband's help in the maintenance of the rice field to ensure a good output each harvest season. Also, some of her teenage children help in the farm work when they are available from school. 

Duch would like to improve her business and maintain healthy crops, so she is borrowing a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy seeds and farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used for their rice fields. In the next few years, Duch plans to purchase extra land to expand her rice production.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for their rice fields.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Jocktan, who is in his early 40s, is married and has four children, of whom three are in school. 

He has had a carpentry business since 1989. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more carpentry wood and work instruments and a plot for his house and to pay school fees and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more bricks and more carpentry items. His dream is to one day be able to build his own nice house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Trust," which totals 16 members who will hold each others accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bricks and more carpentry items.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum is 38 years old and lives with her father and two nieces in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She operates a medium-sized farm on which she grows rice as a way to support her family. She has been doing this for more than 16 years and is able to make approximately $2 each day. Prum would like to support the education of her two nieces with income from her farm because she wants them to have a good jobs in the future.

Prum dreams of having a motorcycle for personal use because she and her family are experiencing difficulties in getting the transportation they need. For this reason, she would like to ask for a loan in the amount of $1,100 from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle. She hopes this loan will improve their living conditions and satisfy their transportation needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.ru: Бахромджону 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Ее зовут Шахноза и ей 1 год. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 10 лет он занимается услугами таксиста. Он старается улучшить благосостояние семьи, но его доход не позволяет ему достроить новый дом, который он начал строить несколько лет назад. Бахромджон запрашивает займ на сумму  7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы достроить дом. Бахромджон и его семья будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Bahromjon is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. His daughter’s name is Shakhnoza, and she is one year old. In order to support his family, Bahromjon has been working as a taxi driver for over 10 years. He attempts to improve his family’s life conditions, but his income doesn’t allow him to finish the construction of his new house, launched several years ago. Bahromjon is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 TJS, in order to finish the construction works. Bahromjon and his family are counting on the lenders’ kindness, which will allow them to resolve their housing problems.

loans.use: to buy  construction materials such as cement and wood to finish building his new house.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim lives in Ang Snoul district with her spouse and two children. She has two other children who are already settled in marriage and live far away. 

To make a living, Lim runs a small shop from her house, where she sells compact discs (CDs) and video compact discs (VCDs) to local people. Also from there, she refills petrol for passersby. From this current business, Lim is able to earn 3 USD each day to add to her spouse’s income. 

Lim could not satisfy her customers' wants because she had only a few CDs and VCDs to sell. She wants to increase her stock of merchandise to sell in her village, but she has insufficient capital to do it. In regard to this situation, she is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase CDs and VCDs to sell in her store. With another portion of the loan, she will purchase petrol to stock for sale as well. 

She believes that this loan will contribute to improve her current businesses and she hopes for a better income to secure the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and VCDs to sell in her store and to purchase petrol to stock for sale.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Kevina, who is in her early 30s, is married and has one child who is still goes to school.  

She has been running a food shop for five years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requests a seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food shop inventory and to pay school fees and household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to restock the missing items in her food shop. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Ununio," which has 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who goes to school.  

She has been running a grocery business for four years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requests a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy grocery chairs and drinks and to pay school fees and household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to restock the missing drinks in her grocery. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big bar business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Minazini," which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing drinks.

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Nhoek is a 54-year-old widowed woman who is responsible for two children, living in Ang Snoul district, not far away from Phnom Penh. Nhoek is one of the credit association members in her commune, where they help each other in turn as financial solvency. Aside from her responsibilities for her credit association, Nhoek also operates a rice farming business to constantly support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Nhoek’s oldest child is very helpful in providing hard work at the rice field. In addition, he is providing transportation service to local people for extra income.

Nhoek is now taking out a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase a new motorcycle with a trailer attached at the back for her son to provide better service to his customers. This purchase will be a great help for her family as their income will increase through serving transportation service. She appreciates the given loan and thanks to all kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle with a trailer attached at the back for her son to provide better service to his customers.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem is 30 years old and a married woman with five children, some of whom are too young and really need her care. Soem is a farmer working on one hectare of farmland in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. The income from this business is barely enough to cover her daily costs and this encouraged Soem to get involved in a hog-raising business to secure the family out of poverty. Soem has been in these businesses for over 10 years.

Due to the lack of funds to make improvements in the hog-raising business, Soem decided to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase extra piglets for fattening and feed. In the future, Soem wants to have a big farm, where she can raise pigs and poultry in her village.

loans.use: to purchase feed and extra piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon has a very positive outlook and is always looking for ways to improve her standard of living. She is 38 years old and the caring mother of three school-aged children who depend on her income. In addition to running a rice farm, Chhuon also sells recycled materials as a way to earn additional income to support her family. She has been in the two businesses for more than 10 years while he husband has worked at a construction company.

Chhuon is requesting for a loan for $700 to buy more recycled materials. Through this loan, she is convinced that her sales will increase and generate a better yield. She is very grateful for the help she receives from Kiva lenders and promises to pay her loan back in full.

loans.use: to supplement her income by buying recycled materials.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children – four of them single and two married. This photo was taken in front of her house, which is situated in the Baray district, where she operates farm which is the main source of her income. Sa and her spouse work hard as a team to ensure an abundant harvest each season. Together, they can earn about $6 a day and have been doing this business for more than 20 years. 

Sa is requesting a loan for $600 to buy potato plants to grow. She will also use a portion of this loan to pay laborers who will help her transport her rice. In the future, she would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur and improve the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy potato plants for growing and hire laborers.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora Bernarda tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están entre las edades de dos y diez años de edad. Ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras, desde hace dos años. Inicio con pocas gallinas, así fue adquiriendo experiencia; actualmente posee 200 gallinas y pretende poseer más.

Ella adquiere los insumos para sus gallinas en la ciudad más cercana, que esta a una hora y media en autobús o en vehiculo particular, debe viajar bien seguido en busca de los insumos, y sus ingresos económicos lo limitan para comprar en cantidades mayores.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Bernarda a Fundación Campo, es para comprar concentrado, vitaminas, antibióticos en grandes cantidades, comprara 100 pollos más y si le ajusta mejorara la estructura en donde maneja sus gallinas.

Con el préstamo tendrá más liquidez, para manejar su negocio al poseer en grandes cantidades los insumos que necesita y evitara viajar tanto a la ciudad, dedicando más tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Bernarda is 38 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of two and ten years old.  Along with her husband she makes a living by raising laying hens, which she has done for two years.  She began with a few hens, thus gaining experience; now she has 200 hens and hopes to have more.  She acquires the supplies for her hens in the nearest town which is an hour and a half away by bus or her own car.  She must travel often in search of the supplies and her financial income limits her from buying greater quantities.  

The loan that Bernarda is requesting from Fundación Campo is for buying feed, vitamins, and antibiotics in large quantities; buying an additional 100 hens; and to better adjust the structure where she manages her hens.  With the loan she will have more liquidity to manage her business to have large quantities of the supplies she needs and to avoid traveling so much to the city, thus dedicating more time to caring for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and antibiotics in large quantities; to buy an additional 100 hens; and to better adjust the structure where she manages her hens.

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bantagnel a été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Il compte 30 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Ce groupe est caractérisé par un bon climat social. Le nom Bantagnel est emprunté du quartier qui abrite.  Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe.  Elle est âgée de 30 ans, est célibataire et vie avec ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de jus fruit à  base de produits locaux par comme le bissap, jus de pain de singe, gingembre, de tamarin …. Actuellement elle dispose d’une petite machine la permettant de faire des emballages en sachet d’un quart de litre au prix de 100 FCFA l’unité au marché central et dans son quartier. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de trois ans.

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner  en quantité en intrant   pour la préparation des différents jus destinés à  la vente.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle compte en partie développer  son commerce, accompagner ses parents dans la prise en charge des dépenses quotidienne et surtout gagner en autonomie financière.
texts.en:
The group Bantagnel was created on August 13, 2011 when their 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It comprises 30 members living in the same district. This group is characterized by a good social atmosphere. The name Bantagnel is borrowed from the district sheltering it. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Binta (seated at the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 30 years old and unmarried, and she lives with her parents. She is a vendor of fruit drinks made with local products, such as hibiscus flowers, 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree), ginger, tamarind,…. Right now she has a small machine enabling her to package 250-ml quantities of drinks in plastic pouches at a price of 100 francs CFA each. She sells at the central market in her district. She enjoys good experience in this business for having worked at it for over three years.

Her new loan will allow her to do better in stocking up on the ingredients for making different drinks for resale. 

With the profits, she plans to develop her business, to assist her parents in covering day-to-day expenses, and in particular to gain financial autonomy.

loans.use: to stock up on the ingredients for making different drinks for resale

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 46 years of age and a married woman who is responsible for six children. She lives together with her family in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

She is involved in a farming business to meet the needs of her family, especially for daily sustenance and allowances for children. Chheng plants and harvests rice to sell to local traders each season. Chheng dreams of having a suitable house for living because her inherited present house is worn due to long-time use.

Chheng would like to renovate her house but she doesn’t have sufficient capital to do that. In this regard, she is requesting a loan through HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase the necessary construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand and timbers. She will be very thankful if this will be granted to her as a way for improving her family's living conditions. She hopes that her dream will come true soon through the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand and timbers.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim, age 56 years, operates a direct-selling business from her old bike. She uses a kind of bamboo basket, at the back of her vehicle, for loading vegetables, fish and meat. She usually goes through the village, dropping by houses and selling her items to domestic people. She typically generates an average of 10,000 KHR each day. In addition, Yim owns and manages a few pieces of farmland for growing rice in the rainy season. Yim, being a single parent, is responsible for four grown children, three of whom are married already. 

To make more improvements in her current businesses, Yim really needs additional capital to purchase stocks of her merchandise to increase selling, as well as to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop. That is why she is asking for financial assistance from HKL and Kiva. She hopes to obtain the loan, so that she will be able to further develop her businesses and yield a better income to secure the family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of her merchandise to increase selling, as well as to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop.

loans.name: Pil

texts.en:
Pil, 54, has been involved in the farming business for over 10 years in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Pil has tried hard to achieve a satisfied harvest so as to sustain their standard of living. As with other local villagers, Pil grows various kinds of seasonal crops on two hectares of farmland with full support from her husband. Through the years, she recognized the hardship of operating this business. It’s quite hard work. However, Pil has a strong commitment to work out her plans and she dreams of sending some of her children to be educated at a good college someday through her sacrifices. 

Recently, Pil has one of her daughters help generate income for the family by selling eggs in a local market of the province, but she has minimal eggs to supply her customers. In order to help her daughter with capital to purchase eggs to stock for a constant sale, Pil would like to take out a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR from Kiva lenders, through HKL. She hopes that lenders will kindly offer this loan which will enable them to go far in their selling business. She is very thankful to all of you in advance.

loans.use: to help her daughter with capital to purchase eggs to stock

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 34 years of age and a married woman who currently lives in Prey Chor district, where she and her husband operate a rice farming business to make their livelihoods. Touch always thinks of the welfare of her family and she hopes to experience financial stability someday. To add to her main income, Touch devotes a piece of time to a mobile selling business; she sells vegetables, fish and meat through the village with her old bike. She is able to make approximately 10,000 KHR each day from this type of business. 

With the amount she requested, she would like to purchase a cow for farming purposes. This purchase will allow her to keep developing her farming business and avoid paying much for their operating expenses like for plowing fees. She hopes to be a successful entrepreneur and provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for farming purposes.

loans.name: Shikama Group

texts.fr:
Gaudence  fait partie du groupe Shikama et  habite à Cibitoke. C’est une veuve de 50 ans. Elle a 5 enfants âgés de 20 à 32 ans.

Elle est  commerçante de farine depuis  11ans. 

 C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec à moudre pour avoir de la farine, à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait avoir une petite boutique  au marché de Cibitoke dans la localité de Nyeshenza.
texts.en:
Gaudence is part of the group Shikama and lives in Cibitoke. She is 50 years old and a widow, and she has five children, from 20 to 32 years old.

She has been a merchant selling flour for eleven years. 

This is her first loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of dried cassava to mill, so as to produce flour to sell, thus earning more money. 

In the next few years, she would like to have a small shop at the Cibitoke market in the town of Nyeshenza.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of dried cassava to mill for flour to sell

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late thirties, is married and the mother of three children, two boys and one girl. All of her children attend school, while she earns a living running a general store where she sells a wide range of items. She has been in business since 2007 and works from 6:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily to make a fair monthly profit.

She is requesting her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chairs for her store, additional items to sell to her customers and to meet household expenses. She has repaid all of these loans successfully and is requesting a new loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big hardware business.

She will share this loan with her group, which is called  "Karoti" and has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Classic Group

texts.en:
Samwel, who is in his early thirties, is married and the father of one child.  He has had a genge-duka (or retail shop which sells fruits and vegetables) for the last year, and works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily to make a good monthly profit. 

He is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more items to sell to his customers and to pay household expenses. His dream is to one day be able to run a wholesale business.

He will share this loan with his group, which is called "Classic" and has 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est créé le 25 Août 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 32 femmes qui toutes issues du même village, ces dernières sont très déterminées et se vouent un respect mutuel, de même la solidarité entre membre est très présente dans leurs relations. Elles ont comme activité principale le maraîchage et le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (en médaillon en bas à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et  mère de 04 enfants (03 filles et 01 garçon), très active et déterminée dans ses activités, elle fait le maraîchage : culture de patte douce, de gombo, tomate fraîche, piment, … ces produits récoltés sont vendus aux commerçants des marchés environnants. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus de vingt.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  d’acheter en quantité les intrants (engrais, semences et pesticides).

Avec les bénéfices elle compte payer la scolarité de sa fille en partie et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on August 25, 2011 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It comprises 32 members all living in the same village. The group members are very determined and vow mutual respect. In the same way, the solidarity between members is very present in their interactions. The main work of the group members includes market gardening and small-scale commerce.

Ms. Mariama (appearing in a cameo at the bottom right) is the group's featured borrower. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children (3 girls and 1 boy). She is very active and determined in her business. She works in market gardening: sweet potatoes, okra, fresh tomatoes, chili peppers,… Once harvested, the produce is sold to merchants at markets in the area. She enjoys good experience in this business for having worked at it for over twenty years. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase farm inputs (fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides). 

With the profits, she plans in part on paying for her daughter's schooling costs, as well as improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase inputs (fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides)

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 42 años, es un hombre muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa, que compró gracias a sus esfuerzos; en ella reside junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Alberto, es un hombre de lucro, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de café ya que son rentables en sus ventas. Viene trabajando 20 años en sus propias tierras;  en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos y las cosechas son comercializadas en las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada productos que vende. 
Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad a una hora y media de su comunidad, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de café. Con el crédito que obtuvo, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que aquejan sus plantaciones. Este es su crédito número 02; promete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe de las reuniones y activo con sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono, asimismo hará la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en el desyerbo de malezas de sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Alberto, age 42, is a very happy and tenacious man.  He lives in his own house, which he bought thanks to his efforts.  He lives in the house with his four beloved children to whom he wishes to give a better quality of life.

Alberto is a productive man, and he does his work with great care.  His job consists of working the land to cultivate coffee plants, which make his sales profitable.  He has been working his own land for 20 years.  During harvest time he has help from day workers.   This way he gathers the fruit of his harvest more rapidly, and the harvest is sold to gathering centers.  They compensate him very well for each kilogram of product that he sells.

He considers transporting his products from the farm to the gathering centers in the city, which is an hour and a half from his community, to be most difficult.  This is the place where they offer the best prices for his coffee beans.

He will use the loan that he got to hire day workers to help him clear the weeds that afflict his crops.  This is his second loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments punctually.  He will do this because he wishes to have access to another loan later on.

In his communal bank he is a member who participates in the meetings and with his colleagues.  He will use the 2,000 soles to buy natural fertilizer.  He will also hire day workers to help him clear the weeds from his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Ndock's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 13 Décembre 2008. Il est composé de membres habitant la même localité et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Assise à droite de la photo et levant la main, Ndock la vedette est âgée de 60 ans . Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons et 01 fille. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des sachets de jumbo à 1250 frs l'unité de 50 jumbo, les oignons à 500 frs le kg .

elle revend le sachet de jumbo à 1 500 frs et le kg d'oignons est revendu à 650 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés seront utilisés pour l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 13, 2008. It consists of members living in the same region and practicing the same business which is retail shopkeeping.

Sitting to the right of the photo and raising her hand, Ndock is the featured borrowed and is 60 years old. She is married and mother to 4 children of whom 3 are boys and 1 is a girl.

With the loan she received, she is going to buy packages of jumbo at 1,250 frs per 50 jumbo cubes, and onions at 500 frs per kg. 

She resells a package of jumbo for 1,500 frs and a kg of onions for 650 frs.

The profits generated will be used to improve the living conditions of her offspring.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as spice, onions and jumbo cubes.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mrs.Davaa is 22 years old and lives with her husband in a Ger, in Uvs province of Mongolia. She worked at a cell phone repair company until 2012. Now she and her husband are starting to operate new business of their own which will provide mobile phone repair service and sell mobile phones in retail price on stall at shopping center. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy equipments, mobile phones and mobile parts to start her own business. She is a hardworking and careful person. She said, "I cannot make time stopped or come back so I wont waste my time and work wisely"

loans.use: To buy new equipments and tools for newly starting mobile phone repair and sales business

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est constitué de vingt et une femmes qui habitent le même village et leurs activités principales sont l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame Diogo la responsable est âgée de 62 ans, c'est une femme mariée mère de quatre enfants deux filles et deux garçons. Elle est éleveur et a une bonne expérience de plus de 20ans. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou mauve et a levé la main droite.

Elle achète ses sujets ( moutons et bœufs) aux marchés hebdomadaires de Gouye Mbeuth et Thiamène;elle revend dans le village.


Avec son prêt et apport personnel elle souhaite acheter 4 moutons et 5 bœufs pour embouche ovine et bovine; ainsi elle pourra se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente.


Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son mari pour les charges de la famille, renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 21 women who live in the same village and are principally arable and livestock farmers.

Diogo, the group's leaders, is 62 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; 2 girls and 2 boys. She is a livestock farmer with over 20 years' worth of good experience. She is standing on the right of the picture, with her right hand raised, dressed in a purple boubou. She gets her animals (sheep and oxen) at the weekly markets of Gouye Mbeuth and Thiamène, and resells them in the village. 

Using the loan and her own contribution, she would like to buy 4 sheep and 5 oxen for sheep- and cow-fattening; this will enable her to earn a considerable income on resale. She uses her profits to help her husband with the family expenses and builds her savings.

loans.use: to buy oxen and sheep for fattening.

loans.name: María Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es una persona trabajadora y responsable, su esposo adolece de una enfermedad que no le permite trabajar libremente y ayudar a su esposa con los gastos del hogar. Debido a esa situación María trabaja muy fuerte, se dedica a cuidar un niño de una profesora, a lavar y planchar de otras personas que contratan sus servicios, vende comida y elabora la comida en una escuela de la comunidad. 

Para adquirir los productos que necesita tiene que viajar a la ciudad más cercana ubicada a 14 kilómetros de su casa; el acceso es muy difícil, tanto así que solo un autobús llega a ese lugar y cuando quiere salir a realizar sus compras debe levantarse a las 4:00 a.m. a realizar los oficios en su casa para estar lista a las 5:00 a.m. para irse en el autobús.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando María a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca parida; ella y su esposo poseen unos terrenos en donde se alimentara. Con la inversión, ella obtendrá los productos que de la vaca como leche, guaja, crema, para alimentar a su familia, ella desea que su familia viva bien y que sus hijos trabajen y sean responsables.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a hardworking and responsible person. Her husband suffers from a disease that prevents him from working very much and helping his wife with the household expenses. Due to this situation, María works very hard. For a living she is the nanny of a professor's child, washes and irons for other people who contract her services, and prepares and sells food in the community school.

To purchase the products she needs she has to travel to the closest town located 14 kilometers from her house. Access is very difficult, so much so that only a bus arrives to this place and when she wants to go out to make these purchases she has to get up at 4:00 AM to make the offices in her house ready by 5:00 AM to go to the bus.

The loan that María is requesting of Fundación Campo or Country Foundation, is to buy a calving cow. She and her husband have some land where it will feed. With the investment, she will obtain the products from the cow such as milk, cheese, and cream to feed her family. she wants her family to live well and that her children working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy a calving cow.

loans.name: Nene's Group

texts.fr:
le Bv de Dagga  a été le 29 décembre 2009. Il est composé de de femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale. Leur principale activité est le commerce.

Debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, Déguène la vedette est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles et 02 garçons. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter du poisson fumé et sec à Kayar. Elle achète le panier de 50 kgs à 22 500 frs. Elle achète aussi du sucre, du riz en gros pour revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices de la vente, elle va utiliser une partie pour construire un magasin et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et avec l'autre soutenir son mari et ses enfants dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' of Dagga was created on December 29, 2009. It is composed of women with good social cohesion. Their main work involves commerce.

Standing at the far right in the photo, Déguène  is the featured borrower. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six children, of whom four are girls and two are boys. 

With the received loan, she is going to purchase some smoked and dried fish in Kayar. She purchases the 50-kg basket at 22,500 francs each. She also purchases sugar and rice in bulk to resell.

She will use part of the profits  from the sales to build a store and to increase her sales. With the rest, she will support her husband and children in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and smoked and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kadidia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis le 18/12/2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont habitent le même village.Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Madame Kadidia qui est en position debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe.Elle est mariée et âgée de 43 ans.Elle a 05 Filles dont la plus petite est âgée de 05 ans et la plus grande a 20 ans.

Son activité consiste a acheter des vêtements qu'elle va revendre.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de commerce car l'ayant pratiqué pendant 03 années.

Avec son prêt;elle compte s'approvisionner en vêtements pour une valeur de 400 000F pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle.

Avec le bénéfice réalisé,elle compte accroître son épargne,finir la construction de sa maison,et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 18th of December, 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same village. Their are principally retailers.

Kadidia, standing on the far right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is married and 43 years old. She has 5 girls, the youngest of whom is 5 years old and the oldest 20. Her business consists of buying clothes for resale. She has a good experience in this line of work as she has been doing it for 3 years. She plans to use her loan to buy 400 000 francs' worth of clothing, so that she can satisfy her customer demand. She plans to use the profits she makes to build up her savings, finish construction on her house and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary De Jesus

texts.es:
Mary es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado brindar en su hogar una buena calidad de vida, por esto ha tenido varios empleos la gran mayoría de ellos en actividades de comida como restaurantes y ventas de fritos. Después de trabajar durante muchos años como empleada, un día tomó la decisión de abrir su propio negocio, y fue así como montó su propio restaurante donde trabaja arduamente para superar las dificultades de capital que hay en su familia. Para poder seguir creciendo con el restaurante, Mary busca un préstamo que le permita comprar un refrigerador donde pueda guardar algunas comidas y bebidas, y así ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante este negocio donde pueda ofrecer empleo para los más necesitados. Además, sueña con tener el restaurante más reconocido del sector.
texts.en:
Mary is a very hard-working person who always seeks to offer a good quality of life in her home. For that reason, she has held various jobs, the great majority of which were in activities concerning food, such as restaurants and selling fried foods.

After working for many years as an employee, one day Mary made the decision to open her own business. That's how she came to start her own restaurant where she works arduously to overcome her family's difficulties concerning capital. To be able to continue expanding her restaurant, Mary is seeking a loan that would permit her to buy a refrigerator where she could preserve some foods and drinks, and thus offer better products to her customers.

Her dream is to be able to advance this business and offer employment to those who are more in need.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator where she can preserve foods and drinks, and thus, offer better products to her customers.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian es un joven emprendedor que aprendió la actividad de la carpintería desde que estaba muy niño, porque su padre le enseñó. Inició ayudando a su padre y luego se dedicó de lleno al negocio, comprando maquinaria y consiguiendo sus propios clientes. Fabian terminó sus estudios secundarios y desde ahí decidió trabajar en este oficio. Para hacer un proceso a la madera que hace el trabajo de mejor calidad, Fabian requiere un préstamo para comprar una máquina cantiadaora.

De esta manera podrá conseguir más ventas y continuar aportando para que sus padres tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Además, poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de tener un local propio donde pueda trasladar la carpintería y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Fabian is a young entrepreneur who learned carpentry from his father at a very young age. He began helping his father and later fully dedicating himself to the business, buying machinery and gaining his own customers. 

Fabian finished his secondary school studies and decided to work in this field. 

To improve upon his woodworking process to bring about higher quality, Fabian requires a loan to purchase an edge banding machine. This will enable him to increase sales and continue supporting his parents so they can a better quality of life. 

In addition, little by little he will reach his goal of having his own shop where he can relocate his carpentry business and create jobs.

loans.use: to purchase an edge banding machine.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe à été créé le 30/12/2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même quartier.Elles ont pour activité le commerce.

Madame Korka en position debout et à l'extrême gauche sur la photo;est la responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 garçons et 04 filles.

Son activité consiste à la vente de tissus teintés et à la production de pâtes d’arachide.Donc avec le financement reçu,elle compte acheter 20 tissus wax pour une valeur de 150000 francs;02 sacs d'arachide pour une valeur de 35000 francs;20 tissus teintés pour une somme de 140000 francs;10 tissus de qualité simple pour 40000francs et 03 bidons de 20l d'huile de palme pour une valeur de 45000francs.

le bénéfice issu de ces ventes vont la permettre d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,aider son mari pour le ravitaillement mensuel de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of members from the same district. Their work involves commerce. 

Ms. Korka, the first one standing at the far left in the photo, is the group's official. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of  four boys and four girls. 

Her business consists in selling dyed fabrics and making peanut butter. With the financing received, she intends to purchase 20 lengths of 'wax' cloth at 150,000 francs, 2 sacks of peanuts a 35,000 francs, 20 lengths of dyed fabrics at 140,000 francs, 10 lengths of plain cloth at 40,000 francs, and three 20-liter containers of palm oil at 45,000 francs.

The profits from these sales will enable her to make sure her children's schooling costs are covered and to help out her husband with monthly supplies for the family.

loans.use: to purchase dyed fabrics and some peanuts

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes ont intégré le Banc villageois dés sa création  le 13 décembre 2003. Elles sont très rigoureuses et déterminées dans leurs activités respectives. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Debout à l’extrême  droite, madame Diènaba est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 38 ans, est mariée, mère de  04 enfants (01 garçon et 03 filles). Elle est vendeuse d’articles vestimentaires : sac, chaussures, tissus qu’elle achète en gros pour la revente en détail.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs à 3 000 FCFA l’unité, un rouleau de tissu à 70 500 FCFA, 10 paires de chaussures à 2000 FCFA  par paire. Ces articles seront vendus respectivement 6 000 FCFA, 12 500 FCFA les 06 mètres et 3 500 FCFA la paire de chaussure.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille par l’acquisition d’un frigo d’une part et d’autre part assuré la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
These two women joined the 'banc villageois' at its creation on December 13, 2003. They are very rigorous and determined in their respective businesses. Their main work involves commerce. 

Standing at the far right in the photo, Diènaba is the featured borrower. She is 38 years old, married, and the  mother of four children (one boy and three girls). She sells clothing: handbags, shoes, and fabrics that she purchases wholesale in order to sell retail.

This new loan will enable her to purchase 10 handbags at 3,000 francs CFA each, a roll of cloth at 70,500 francs, and 10 pairs of shoes at 2,000 francs a pair. These goods will be sold respectively at 6,000 francs, 12,500 francs for 6 meters, and 3,500 francs a pair of shoes.

With the profits, she plans on improving her family's living conditions by acquiring a refrigerator, as well as by covering her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, cloth, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de vingt deux femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leurs activités principales sont le commerce et la coiffure.


Khady l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 37 ans, elle est assistante au sein du BV; elle est célibataire sans enfant mais s'est occupé de ses neveux qui ont perdu très tôt leur maman. Elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus, elle posséde une boutique au marché du village et capitalise une bonne expérience de 5 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo vêtue d'une robe rouge blanc-blanc, a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses tissus (khartoum, wax, bazin,voile....) à Dakar et Touba pour revendre au détail dans son village.


Avec son prêt elle envisage d'acheter 4 rouleaux de khartoum de 30 m à 7000 F l'un; elle espère se faire beaucoup de revenus pendant la période des fêtes.


Elle constitue son épargne avec ses bénéfices et souhaite renforcer son compte; elle habite chez son frère qui a en charge toutes les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 22 women who live in the same area. They are primarily retailers and hairdressers.

Khady, the featured entrepreneur, is 37 years old and is an assistant in the banc villageois. She is single and has no children, but takes care of her nephews who lost their mother at a very young age. She sells fabrics and owns a small shop at the village market, capitalising on 5 years' worth of experience. She is standing on the right of the picture, wearing a red and white dress, with her left hand raised. She buys her fabrics (Khartoum fabrics, wax cloth, damask, veils, etc.) in Dakar and Touba so that she can resell them retail in her village.

She intends to use her loan  to buy 4 rolls of Khartoum fabric (30 metres at 7000 francs /m). She hopes to earn a large income during the holiday period. She uses her profits to build up her savings and wishes to strengthen her account; she lives with her brother who takes care of all the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Madame Adjowa âgée de 32ans, n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse de mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Son activité se déroule dans une boutique et 02 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de ses taches. Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite de WAGES, elle veut s’acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait se marier et aménager son lieu d’activité.
texts.en: Ms. Adjowa, aged 32, has no children to support. She is a retailer of hair extensions and cosmetics. Her business operates in a store, and two persons help her in carrying out her tasks. With this initial loan she is requesting from WAGES, she wants to purchase some hair extensions and cosmetic products in order to respond better to customer needs. For the future, she would like to get married and fix up her work location.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items to sell

loans.name: Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children (two boys and a girl) who go to school. She has been selling vitenge (women's clothes) for three years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of clothes to resell and pay household expenses and she has paid back all her loans successfully.
