She wants a loan to increase more stock of clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to open a food business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Jamaica," which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Abduvaly

texts.ru: Абдували 40 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 8 лет и 1 год. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Абдували более 21 лет работает в алюминий завод и является одним из успешных работников. Он начал стройку нового дома несколько лет назад, но его доход не позволяет ему достроить дом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5700 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. В будущем у него много планов, он хочет открыть   собственный продовольственный магазин и сотрудничать с нашей организацией. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Abduvaly is 40 years old, married, and raising 2 children 8 and 1 years of age. His wife works as a high school teacher, while Abduvaly has worked at an aluminum plant for over 21 years and is one of its more successful employees. Several years ago, Abduvaly began building a new home, but his limited income does not allow him to finish construction. He is requesting a loan of 5700 somoni to purchase building materials.

Abduvaly has many plans for the future such as opening his own grocery store, and plans to continue working with IMON International. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood and cement for building his new house

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée à un responsable d’une ONG, madame Akossiwa âgée de 32ans a 02 enfants âgés de 05ans et 08 mois. Elle est coiffeuse et en même temps revendeuse de friperie. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 12ans et sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter de la friperie. Avec les profits qu’elle tirera de son commerce, elle voudra commander plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Married to a manager at a non-governmental organization, Ms. Akossiwa is 32 years old and has two children, 5 years old and 8 months old. She is a hairdresser and also a retailer of used clothing. She has been in this domain for twelve years and is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some secondhand clothing. With the profits she will earn from her business, she would like to order more merchandise in order to respond better to customer needs. In the future, she would like to see her family thrive.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Comptable de profession, madame Afiavi est en même temps revendeuse de pagnes et des bazins à domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 03ans et 06 mois et mariée à un maintenancier. Pour renforcer son activité de vente de pagnes et de bazins, elle sollicite un second prêt à WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise. A l’avenir, elle veut avoir une boutique et assumer une bonne éducation à sa famille. Il est à préciser qu’elle est âgée de 31ans et qu’elle exerce son activité il y a 04ans.
texts.en:
An accountant by profession, Ms. Afiavi is also a retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and damask fabrics out of her home and door to door. She is the mother of two children, who are 3 and 6 years old, and she is married to a maintenance worker. 

To bolster her business selling 'pagne' cloth and damask fabrics, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise. For the future, she wants to have a store and to take responsibility for a good education for her family. Note that she is 31 years old and has been in this business for four years.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and damasks to sell

loans.name: Si Mchezo Group

texts.en:
Tabu, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children who still go to school. She has had a cafe business since 2005.  She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and she is able to make a higher monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her business stock and cover her household expenses. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big cafe business with car parking and inn.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Si Mchezo" which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the business stock.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафару 23 года. Он холост и живет с родителями. Его отец работает бухгалтером, а мать домохозяйка. Сафар очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 10 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей индустриальных товаров в  магазине. В последнее время у него мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и он не может придерживать своих клиентов. Сафар должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 14000 сомони для того, чтобы купить разнообразные посуды, термос, чайник и т.п. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Safar is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents. His father is an accountant and his mother takes care of the household. Safar is a very hard-working person and has over 10 years of entrepreneurial experience, selling household goods in his shop. Lately, he's had few customers, being unable to retain his clientele due to stiff competition. In light of this, Safar urgently needs to expand the assortment of his merchandise. He is requesting a loan of 14000 somoni to purchase various dishes, thermoses, kettles etc. He is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to stock up on household products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bouillie à domicile, madame Colette âgée de 46ans est mariée à un conducteur de taxi  et ils ont en charge  04 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école. Ils sont âgés de 25 à 12ans. C’est en 2002 qu’elle a démarré son activité qui lui rapporte le minimum pour s’occuper de la famille. Elle est par moment confrontée au problème de mévente. Avec ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va s’acheter des mais, du mil pour la préparation de la bouillie. Elle voudrait faire prospérer son activité et assurer une éducation de qualité à sa famille.
texts.en: Selling porridge out of her home, Ms. Colette, aged 46, is married to a taxi driver. They have four children in school who are 12 to 25 years old. Ms. Colette started her business in 2002. It barely brings in enough  to take care of her family. For the moment, she is confronted with the problem of a drop in sales. With this loan she is requesting from WAGES, she is going to purchase some corn and millet for making porridge. She would like to make her business profitable and to ensure quality education for her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn and millet for making porridge to sell

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундузу 52 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Все ее дети совершеннолетние. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 18 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается изготовлением закруток. Она покупает свежие овощи и закрывает их в банке. У нее есть постоянные клиенты, т.е. владельцы ресторанов и столовый. Она справляется одна с бизнесом. Ее муж шофер и не в состоянии помочь ей с деньгами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для того овощи для закрутки. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kunduz is 52 years old, married, and has in her care 4 children all of whom have reached the age of majority. Kunduz is a very hard-working person and has over 18 years of entrepreneurial experience. She makes preserves by purchasing fresh vegetables and pickling them. Kunduz has her regular customers such as owners of restaurants and diners. She takes care of her business on her own as her husband works as a driver and is unable to assist her financially. Kunduz is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase vegetables for pickling. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh vegetables for pickling

loans.name: Excelsior De Perches 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Antoine est le coordinateur de son groupe Excelsior des Perches.   Il habite dans la région  PERCHES  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Antoine est un commercant et a dirigé son  commerce de cosmetiques pendant 10 années.

Antoine voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l'achat déodorant, lotion pour le corps, parfum, etc. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Antoine dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.

Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme nourriture, de charbon, vêtements, chaussures, etc.
texts.en:
Antoine is the coordinator of his group Excelsior of Perches. He lives in the region of Perches where the electricity is rare and the water very limited. Antoine is a storekeeper and has been running his cosmetics business for 10 years.

Antoine would like to use this loan to invest in deodorant, body lotion, perfume, etc. He hopes that the loan will help him expand his business. Antoine says that his principal challenge at present is to become a great trader.  

Other members of the group need loans for businesses such as food, coal, clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes, and various other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products such as clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty is a mother of mother of four children. The children are dependents, and are currently in school. She anticipates having all her children achieve a higher education someday. If that happens, it will be a great achievement in her life. 

That is why she pursues her farming business, and tries hard to work out her plans. Ty has been doing this for almost 10 years, and she is 42 years old. Ty’s husband provides horse transportation services to people in their neighborhood, and also goes to a distant area sometimes at the request of his customers. 

Ty’s family lives in an inherited house, which she received from her parents. It is located in Baray district. The house is old, and in disrepair.  She is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to purchase planks of wood and timbers for housing renovation.  She will also pay for hiring a building team to perform the renovation.  

She is sure that the loan will allow her to get her house finished. She hopes for a suitable house to secure the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase planks of wood and timbers for housing renovation.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 39ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés, madame Kossiwa est restauratrice. Son activité se fait dans une boutique et elle est aidée par 05 personnes. Afin de bien répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter du riz, des tomates et de l’huile végétale. Avec les profits, elle veut accroitre l’activité et améliorer le niveau d’étude de la famille.
texts.en: A 39-year-old mother of five children, of whom three are in school, Ms. Kossiwa is a restauranteur. Her business operates in a shop, and she has five persons to assist her. To respond well to customer needs, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some rice, tomatoes, and vegetable oil. With the profits, she wants to increase her business and improve her family's level of education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes, and vegetable oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Omm Group

texts.en:
Omm is a group of six active and energetic women from Kusurla village of M. Rampur Block of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. The Kalahandi district is a most backward district with rural poor people. This group was started in 2010 with the purpose of raising the income level of their families. Gopi is one of them. The lady standing third from the left with the raised hand in the photo is Gopi. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two sons aged 22 and 20. Her sons are attending college at M. rampur. 

Gopi maintains her family by running a vehicle spares parts shop attached with a repair workshop at the road point of her village, which is two km away from Kusurla, with the help of her husband. She has given employment to three youths in the workshop and is paying each 2000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month. She says that the prices of spare parts are changing very frequently and that she has been a victim of the price rise many times due to her frequent replenishment cycle. 

To safeguard her from price fluctuations, Gopi will use the loan to buy spare parts in bulk and store them. She has contacted a spare parts wholesaler to take items of 1.3 lakhs (130,000 INR) in credit with a security deposit of 30,000 INR. This will help her to save the repeated transportation and purchasing costs. Gopi dreams to provide her two sons better technical education like engineering. So she and her husband are working very hard to save money to materialize their cherished dream. 

The other members of the group are Chanchala, Baidehi, Taruni, Mamata and Dulana, who have a book store and Xerox center, daily needs shop, general store, barber center and mobile phone repairing center respectively for development of their family condition.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Neou

texts.en:
Neou lives with her spouse in the Baray district. She has been married for long time, and at age 47, now has a baby.

Neou’s family utterly relies on the income from rice farming and a pig-raising business, which they have been doing for more than ten years. They typically generate income of 3.40 USD each day through their business activities.

To sustain their businesses as well as to stabilize their income, Neou would like to have a loan to supplement her capital.  She will use it to purchase extra piglets and feed. With another potion of the loan, Neou will purchase seeds and fertilizer to ensure good nutrition for the rice crop, and to pay plowing fees. 

She is very thankful for the loan, which will greatly impact the development of her businesses. This investment will benefit her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase extra piglets, feed, seeds, fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is a 40-year-old married woman and a humble villager living in Kampong Chhnang province. Loy and her husband are in the same career as professional school teachers in local schools of the province. They are able generate a decent salary to support their family, especially school fees of their four children. 

Loy is preparing to renovate her present house for a comfortable living but due to the lack of funds, she has applied for additional capital in the amount of 1,500,000 Riel (KHR) to purchase construction supplies. This loan will provide her family with a suitable house to improve their living conditions. She is confident of paying her loan back to Kiva lenders as scheduled so that she can take another loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies needed for housing construction.

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Bakari, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been selling second-hand clothes for two years now. He is doing great and working hard. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

He has requested his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to restock more second-hand clothes to resell. His dream is to one day be an international businessman importing and exporting clothes of different kinds.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Maendeleo, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Doghan

texts.fr: Madame Doghan est mariée à un infirmier et ils ont 03 enfants en charge. Deux sont sur les bancs d’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 2001 des tomates dans un marché de la place et est aidée par 04 personnes. En cette période les tomates deviennent de plus en plus rares et elle sollicite de WAGES un premier  prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut aménager le lieu d’activité tout en améliorant les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Ms. Doghan is married to a healthcare worker, and they have three children to support. Two of the children are in school. To help out her husband in covering household expenses, she has been selling tomatoes at a local market since 2001. She is helped by four persons. At this time, tomatoes are more and more scarce, and she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase merchandise, so as to respond to customer needs. For the future, she wants to fix up her work location while improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et ustensiles de cuisine sur étalage dans un quartier de la place, madame Essé épouse d’un militaire a 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. Ils sont âgés de 12, 08 et 04ans. Elle est âgée de 32ans et a démarré l’activité en 2002. Afin d’augmenter son stock d’ustensiles de cuisine et de pagnes, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit. A l’avenir, elle voudrait louer une boutique afin d’élargir son activité et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: A retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and kitchen utensils in a local district, Ms. Essé is married to a soldier. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The children are 12, 8, and 4 years old. Ms. Essé is 32 years old and started her business in 2002. To increase her stock of kitchen utensils and 'pagne' cloth, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. For the future, she would like to lease a shop in order to expand her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky, aged 40, resides in the Baray district with her spouse and some of her children. She and her spouse are raising their children in a small village; they own a few pieces of farmland for growing and harvesting rice. 

Despite their hardship at the rice fields, for additional income, this couple is also in the furniture trading business.  They seek quality furniture for individual clients, as the need arises. 

Ky is asking for a loan that will surely help increase their income. She is borrowing additional capital of 1,000 USD to be invested in purchasing furniture for the purpose of trade. With a good income, she will be able to continue to educate her children up to college, so that they can become professionals and have a bright future someday.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing furniture for the purpose of trade.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, aged 43, is a farmer living in the Baray district with her husband and two dependent children. Another child lives far away with her new family. 

Sun has been farming for almost 20 years, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell each season. Her customers are local traders and market vendors. Sun always hopes for financial stability, to provide basic necessities for the whole family.

To achieve this, she needs to improve her crop production annually to earn higher profits upon harvest. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy extra farmland. Through this expansion, she hopes to obtain an abundant harvest and keep earning funds for the future education of her children, as well as for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland to increase production.

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid-20s, is married and has two children; one is in school and the other is a baby. She has been selling fruits, juices and water for three years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the sales of fruits, and water, and made more juices. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy a fridge for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big restaurant. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mtazamo" which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her business.

loans.name: Kilongawima Group

texts.en:
Lilian is in her early 30s. She is married with three children who go to school. For eight years, she's been operating two separate businesses, selling clothes and selling bricks, to support her family. Working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, she's able to make a good monthly profit. 

This loan request is Lillian's eighth loan from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Lillian's previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, allowed her to increase her stock of clothes, to produce bricks to sell, to pay for household expenses, and to pay her children's school fees. She would like to use this loan to produce additional bricks to sell. Her dream: to one day be able to expand her business.

Lillian will share this loan with her loan group, Kilongawima, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to make more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Doch

texts.en:
Doch is a 30-year-old rice farmer who lives in Siem Reap province. From her crop-planting business, she is able to generate income of around USD2 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the farming business. Besides this occupation, Doch’s husband is always employed as a construction worker in the marketplace for additional revenue. 

This couple are hardworking people who never waste their time with other activities. They always try as best they can to increase their current income from and they always use their income to help cover their financial expenses as well as assisting their four single children. 

Doch will be using half of the loan funds  to buy more construction materials for her husband and the remaining funds to add to her savings to purchase a second motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials for her husband as well as purchase a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn, 30, is a garment worker in Kampong Chhnang province. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., but sometimes she has to work overtime if the factory requires. From her sewing skills, Vorn is able to make a decent salary to feed her two dependent children. However, Vorn has never forgotten her work at the rice field, especially in the rainy season. 

Vorn’s husband serves his family with the income he generates from his motorcycle transportation business. Since his old motorbike breaks too often, this has the effect of making the family's income unstable.

In connection to this, Vorn would like to have her first loan to help her husband in solving the problem of his transportation business. She is now asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase a new motorcycle, which will be used for his transportation business. She hopes that this loan will be approved, so that they are able to develop their standard of living. In years to come, Vorn will send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle, which will be used for a transportation business.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin is 45 years of age, married and has two children. She lives with her husband and raises their children in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. This family’s main income relies on their farming business. They particularly grow rice on their existing farmland, from which they can generate a total income of 3.50 USD each day. Phin’s oldest child is currently working in a garment industry in Phnom Penh to help the family financially while another is still attending school.

With her requested amount, Phin would like to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This vehicle will help her family in satisfying their transportation needs. Also, they can save a portion of their expenditures that they used to pay for transportation costs in the past. Hopefully, Phin is confident that through her commitment and hard work, she will be able to improve her standard of living gradually.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 42 года, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 16, 18 и 20   лет. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому Матлюба с хозяйством справляется одна. Более 19 лет она работает учительницей в средней школе. У нее маленькая зарплата и это не хватает для достройки дома, которую она начала несколько лет назад. Она должна установить окна и двери, сделать фасадную штукатурку и сделать обшивку потолков. Матлюба запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, окон и дверей для достройки дома. Матлюба и ее дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Matluba is a very hard-working and goal-oriented woman. She is 42 years old, married and  has three dependent children. Her children are 16, 18 and 20 years old. Her husband is a work migrant in the Russian Federation, and so Matluba manages the household on her own. For over 19 years, she has been working as a secondary school children. Her low salary is  insufficient to allow her finish the construction of the house launched several years ago. She needs to install window and doors, plaster the façade and install siding on the ceiling. Matluba is requesting a loan for 5000 TJS in order to buy construction materials, windows and doors needed to finish the construction works. Matluba and her children are counting on the lenders’ kindness, which will allow them to resolve their housing problems.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, cement, and wood in order to finish construction work on her house.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Человек с прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Гулизор.  Ей 43 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Уже несколько лет она занимается скотоводством. Она продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Гулизор хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: There is a person with a beautiful soul who lives in the high Tajik mountains and needs your help, as she has recently had financial problems.  Her name is Gulizor, she is 43 years old, and she is married with five children at home.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  She lives in a climate which is very favorable for the cultivation of agricultural crops as well as livestock.  Gulizor has been engaged in animal husbandry for several years now and she sells her livestock after fattening them up for a few months.  She has many clients in the market and she wants to increase her business, but she doesn't have sufficient funds to do so.  She is asking for a loan of $2,000 USD to buy livestock so she can increase her business.  With the proceeds from this increased income, she plans on paying for her children's education and technology.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Молодой и весьма приятный молодой человек, которого зовут Шамсиддин,  более 5 лет занимается услугами мастера. Он делает ремонт в домах и квартирах. Ему 25 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка.  Шамсиддин окончил институт и по специальности он инженер-электрик. Он кроме ремонта еще устанавливает электричество. Он очень любит свою работу и упорно работает.  Шамсиддин должен развивать свой бизнес и преувеличивать доход. Для этого он должен купить современное оборудование для ремонта для привлечения клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This young and pleasant man, who is called Shamsiddin, has been providing repairing services for more than 5 years. He does repairs at houses and apartments. He is 25 years old, married, and raising a child. 

Shamsiddin graduated from the institute with a degree in electrical engineering. In addition to repairs he still installs electricity. He loves his work very much and works hard. 

Shamsiddin should develop his business to increase his income. For this he should purchase modern equipment for making repairs, in order to attract customers. He requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollars. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his repair service for houses and apartments

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ San Pablo” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentra; venta de pan, minimarket, venta de ropa, mueblería, venta de perfumes, venta de joyas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas en el centro del grupo, viste chaqueta de color negro, blue jeans, su cabello lo usa suelto y largo, es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de minimarket, desde hace 25 años. Comenta que ubica su negocio en un local cerca de su casa, trabaja todos los días, a veces la ayuda su hijo cuando debe realizar trámites personales, su horario es de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras de lácteos, importadoras de bebidas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente cervezas para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Maria es agregar pastelería a su negocio, si con esto generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
Maria vive junto a su esposo, 3 hijos y un pequeño sobrino que esta al cuidado de ella. Sus sueño a nivel laboral es seguir creciendo y agregar más insumos a su negocio, y a nivel familiar que a su familia no le falte nada y que tengan una buena calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Ademas se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This communal bank, named "San Pablo", is made up of 19 entreprenuers who make a living though different fields, among which are: bread sales, a Minimarket, clothing sales, a furniture store, perfume sales, jewelry sales, and services, among others.  All of the members belong to the city of Osorno.  

Maria, a member of the communal bank, can be found in the photo squatting in the center of the group, wearing a black jacket and blue jeans, with her dark brown hair worn loose and long.  She has made a living through Minimarket sales for 25 years.  She says that her business is located in a shop near her house, she works every day, sometimes her son helps her when she has to do personal formalities, and her schedule is according to her availability.  The merchandise and supplies that she needs she buys from dairy distributors and beverage importers at low cost, therefore they are financially suitable.  

With the loan she will buy only beer in order to stock up her store.

One of Maria's goals is to add a bakery to her shop, and with this generate more income for her family.  Maria lives with her husband, three children, and a small nephew who is under her care.  Her work-related dreams are to continue growing and adding supplies to her business, and her dreams for her family are that they do not lack anything and that they have a good quality of life.

She is very grateful and pleased with the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her because it allows her to invest in her business.  Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank since they share different activities and interests, which has also served as a pastime for her.  In respect to the skills taught in the meetings, she has learned to manage her business in a better way.

Osorno is a city located in the southern area of Chile, in the Los Lagos region.  It is an important farming center that is known as "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" (The Country of Milk and Land of Meat) of Chile.  Within its farming acitivity there is an emphasis on the cultivation of wheat and oats, and raising cattle for meat processing and dairy, in addition to the manufacture of farm equipment.  What stands out in Osorno is the only covered soccer stadium in Chile, the  "Rubén Marcos" Municipal Stadium .

loans.use: to buy only beer in order to stock up her business.

loans.name: Brilla El Sol Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Brilla el sol” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de frutas cítricas, venta de ropa, servicios eléctricos, paquetería, venta de chocolates, servicios entre otros.
Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Nycole, tesorera del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primer fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste polera de color negra, usa su cabello tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y útiles de aseo, desde hace tres años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa donde ofrece sus productos a través de internet, donde su clientela compra por este medio y luego los retiran en el domicilio de Nycole, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en diferentes distribuidoras e importadoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará detergente, cloro, suavizante liquido, y ropa variada para su clientela.
Una de las metas de Nycole, es seguir con su rubro y poder comprar un vehículo para desplazarse con su mercadería sin complicaciones hacia su clientela.
Nycole vive junto  a sus padres, una hermana y 2 hijas pequeñas de 4 y un año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener buenos ingresos para darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.
Ella está contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Brilla el sol” and is made up of 21 enterprising people who work in different areas, including selling at fairs, citrus sales, clothing sales, electrical services, parcel shipping, chocolate sales, and other services.  They all live in Talca.

Nycole, the communal bank’s treasurer, and is shown in the photograph standing in the first row, third from the left, wearing a black top.  She has dark hair tied back.

She has been selling clothing and cleaning supplies for the past three years.  She tells us that she works from her home where she offers her products through the internet.  Her customers place their orders this way and then pick them up in her home.  She sets her schedule based on her availability.

She buys the merchandise she needs from various distributors and importers in Santiago, where she can get it at lower cost and therefore more economically.

She will use the money from this loan to buy detergent, bleach, liquid fabric softener, and assorted clothing for her customers.

One of Nycole’s goals is to continue in this area so that she can buy a vehicle so that she can deliver her merchandise to her customers without complications.

Nycole lives with her parents, one of her sisters, and two young daughters, ages 4 and 1.  Her dreams are to have a good income and provide a better quality of life to her family.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo Esperanza that will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  She says that the training has been important for her business and also for her personal development, since she has learned to better organize and distribute her income and investments.  She also says that there is good communication within the communal bank to which she belongs.


Talca is part of the Maule region, located in the country’s central zone.  It makes up the region’s administrative, economic, and cultural center, and is the most important city in Chile’s central valley.  In Chile, there is a curious reference to Talca, “Talco, Paris, and London.”  Some say that it’s a derivation of the original English saying, “Talca looks like London,” because of the fog that frequently covers the city during the winter, just like the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: Comprará detergente, cloro, suavizante liquido, y ropa variada para su clientela.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve de 47ans, madame Akossiwa a 04 enfants en charge. Deux sont encore sont sur les bancs d’école. Elle  est couturière de profession et en même temps revendeuse. En 2008, elle a ouvert son atelier dans lequel elle coud des habits à ses clients. Elle est aidée par 03 personnes. Madame Akossiwa sollicite un second prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter des tissus qu’elle vend. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut assurer un bon niveau d’éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: A widow, Ms. Akossiwa is 47 years old and has four children to support. Two are still in school. Ms. Akossiwa is a dressmaker by trade and is also a retailer. In 2008, she opened her workshop in which she sews clothing for her customers. She is helped by three persons. Ms. Akossiwa is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase some cloth, which she sells. For the future, she wants to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Yokor

texts.fr: Mr Kodjo âgé de 32ans est père de 01 enfant  de 03ans. Il est revendeur de friperie de façon ambulante et il s’approvisionne au marché de Hedzranawoe. Afin de bien répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter de la friperie. A l’avenir, il veut augmenter son stock de marchandise et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Kodjo, aged 32, is the father of one child, who is 3 years old. Mr. Kodjo is a street vendor of secondhand clothing. He gets his supplies from the Hedzranawoe market. To respond well to customer needs, he is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase used clothing. For the future, he wants to increase his stock of merchandise and ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, at the age of 20, manages a farming business from Baray district, where she permanently lives with her husband. She has been working alongside her husband in this type of business for a few years on their inherited farmland. Him said that, though it's such a hard work for young couple like them, they really enjoy working in this field because it's the sole source of their income. Him has a strong commitment to improve their living standard someday through her effort and patience. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 700,000 Riel (KHR) to supplement her savings in order to buy a piece of land, on which she plans to build her own house when she can afford to do so later. This is her first step in developing her family living situation to experience a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land, on which she plans to build her own house when she can afford to do so later.

loans.name: Mek

texts.en:
A responsible father, Mek, 34, always seeks to provide a better living standard for his family. At the same time, Mek dedicates himself to two businesses: one in farming and one in transportation. In the rainy season, Mek spends most of his time working together with his wife in the rice fields in order to maintain healthy crops. Aside from that, he provides transportation services to local people around his community. Like her husband, Mek's wife operates a second business to augment the rice growing; she runs a small pig farm. Together, they have given birth to three children who are all currently attending school.

To keep developing their family-owned businesses, Mek would like to borrow $800 USD. He will use part of it to purchase a motorcycle to sustain his transportation business, and use another portion to purchase 5 bags of feed for fattening their pigs. This precious loan will allow Mek, his wife, and their children to greatly develop their businesses and, therefore, their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business and 5 bags of feed for his wife's pig farm.

loans.name: Mik

texts.en:
Mik, 34, is a noble man who currently resides in a peaceful village with his wife and child. To support their family, Mik and his spouse help each other maintain some rice fields, from which they each earn about $2.00 USD per day. The rice farming income barely covers their daily costs, so Mik is interested in pursuing an additional business such as construction or hog farming. However, he does not have the money to make this possible.

Hoping to provide his family a better standard of living and send his only child to a good school, Mik is borrowing $500 USD. He will purchase piglets for fattening, and with the remaining funds will buy a few sacks of fertilizer for his rice crops. This will help boost his profits, which he will then reinvest in the business to make that good return go even farther. This business improvement will help Mik increase the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and several bags of rice fertilizer.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Thuch is a resident of Baray district with her spouse and four single children. Her oldest child is employed as a sewing staff person, temporarily living in a rented room in Phnom Penh, to help support the family. Thuch is 38 years old and is in the business of raising seasonal crops including rice, potatoes, groundnuts, kinds of beans, maize and sesame according to each season and the market demand. She has been doing this for almost 10 years, earning a proper income of 6.40 USD per day. With this income, Thuch pays for her family's daily sustenance, home utility bills, commodities and allowances for her school-aged children.

Now Thuch has applied for a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase needed supplies for her crops, such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and also to pay for labor costs incurred in working at her rice fields and plantations. She hopes for better yields this coming season because of the positive impact of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for her crops, such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, aged 33, is from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, where she operates a rice farming business to support their family. Her spouse helps her in the maintenance of the rice field besides doing fishing activities. Together, they have three school-aged children. They agreed to continuously educate their children up to college level, which is why they try to earn and save a portion of their income for future education. Mom is a loving mother who carefully pays attention to educating their young children at home when she is available for her daily work. For extra income, Mom is currently running a small grocery store adjacent to their house, which returns her a suitable income to pay for daily food.

In order to increase her stock of merchandise and make a sustainable business, Mom decided to take out a loan in the sum of $1,400  to purchase grocery items, beverages, snack food, personal care products and other miscellaneous household items to sell in her store. She hopes that she can satisfy the needs of her frequent customers and attract more people to buy her goods. She would be very grateful if she can obtain the loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, snack foods, personal care products and other miscellaneous household items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Phat earns a living with a few businesses at the same time: she serves her husband as a good business partner in maintaining their fields, she raises piglets for fattening in her backyard, and she is also expert in making a kind of Khmer cake to sell to both passersby and market vendors. Through her efforts, she can generate an average daily income of 17,600 KHR. Despite her hardships, Phat has a strong determination to experience a better quality of life and ensure a bright future for her child.

Due to the lack of capital to make improvements in her current businesses, Phat is taking out a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase feed to provide good nutrition to her piglets, to pay for the operating costs of the family farm, and to purchase ingredients for making cakes. She believes that she will attain financial stability someday and satisfy the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets, to pay for the operating costs of the family farm, and to purchase ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Thoum

texts.en:
Thoum is a 39-year-old married woman who resides in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has four children, one of whom is married. 

Thoum gives her full attention to agribusiness, including rice farming and pig raising. She is able to earn 30,000 KHR per day to add to her spouse's income. She has been in this occupation for the past 20 years.

Thoum would like to make improvements in the family-owned businesses to increase her household income. She is asking for a loan through HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a cow to maintain the rice fields. She mentions it will help reduce plowing costs each season, and she hopes to increase her income to secure the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
The focused business for Uk’s family is farming, on which they rely for their livelihoods. Uk and her husband have been managing a farming business for over 10 years, primarily growing rice and kinds of beans on their two-hectare farmland. They can generate 12,000 KHR each to cover their daily costs and to support their children’s education. They have three single children who still depend on their income while another is married and lives separately.

Uk is seeking for ways of improving her household income and to upgrade their living standard, so now she would like to start up a pig-raising business which will serve as additional source of her income.  Due to the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase piglets for fattening and feeds for their nutrition. Someday, Uk hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in her village.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for fattening and feeds for their nutrition

loans.name: Munavarshoh

texts.ru: Мунаваршоху 40 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 16 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в продовольственном магазине. Он продает хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Мунаваршох должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки продуктовых товаров. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Munavarshoh is 40 years old, married, and raising four children. He is a very hard working man, and has more than 16 years of experience in running a business. He works with buying and reselling food products at his grocery store. He sells bread, butter, sausages, canned goods, drinks and dairy products. 

Munavarshoh should broaden his assortment fast. He requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollars for the purchase of food products. He places his hopes with you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Holali

texts.fr: Madame Holali âgée de 43ans est couturière de profession. Il est à préciser que Holali est mariée à un commerçant et ils ont 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 11ans et le dernier 05ans. A la fin de son apprentissage, elle a ouvert un atelier ou son activité se fait et en même temps, elle vend des produits de mercerie. C’est justement pour acheter des produits de mercerie qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt. Avec les profits réalisés, elle va accroitre son activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Holali, aged 43, is a dressmaker by trade. To note, she is married to a merchant, and they have two children, both in school. The first child is 11 years old, and the last is 5. 

Upon finishing her apprenticeship, she opened a workshop where her business operates. At the same time, she sells sewing supplies. It is only to purchase some sewing supplies that she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. With the profits earned, she is going to increase her business and improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si, 54, is a married woman who has worked in farming since 2006. She and her husband always assist each other in the farm field. Together, they can earn about $6 each day to pay for their family's needs. Si and her husband are blessed with five children, one whom already married while other four are single. One of their single children is employed as a construction worker, and though his income is low, he shares it with the family to pay for their shared expenses. Recently, Si’s son has been wishing to buy a new motorbike that he can drive to work rather than pay daily travel expenses to get there, but he doesn’t have enough money to make it possible. So Si is applying for a loan. She would like to help her son to purchase a new motorbike so he does not have to put as much of his wages toward getting to and from work.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike so her son can drive to work.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main business sector for people living in the countryside of Cambodia. As with other villagers, Thoeurn, a resident from Kampong Cham province, pursues a rice farming business to serve as the major source of income for her family. She has been growing rice on her inherited farmland since 2001. At her age of 21, Thoeurn is responsible for a young kid who utterly needs her care.

To further improve her farming business, Thoeurn would like to acquire a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to expand her farm plot so as to increase her rice production. Thoeurn is praying that she will have an abundant harvest in years to come and she will be able to meet the needs of her family and send her child to school.

loans.use: to expand her farm plot so as to increase her rice production

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem is a 42-year-old villager of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Sem raises his family with the income generated from rice farming business as well as from a business of purchasing and sourcing hair for local hairdressers. His four children are all at school and really need daily allowances. However, they are very helpful in serving Sem as his motivation in the farming business when they don’t have any schedule at school. Sem is glad because of their support and he works tirelessly to ensure their good future. Sem has been involved in the two businesses for almost 30 years.

Sem aspires to manage good farm work and increase his yield, so he is borrowing a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a cow used for the farming business. Also with the remaining funds, he will purchase hair for the future sale. With a proper manner in his current businesses, Sem is confident that he will achieve good profits and earn money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow used for farming business and to purchase hair for future sale

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma had faced a huge financial problem when her family’s business failed some time ago. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago she began working, sewing uppers in her house. She sews for the shoemaking factory around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is married and provides for 4 children. She requested Rs. 25000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including leather, raxeen, gum for sewing, threads of different colors, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including leather, raxeen, gum for sewing and threads of different colors

loans.name: Carmen Karina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es policía.
 
Ella es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para sus gastos y los de sus hijos, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende artículos de papelería, ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, también ofrece el servicio de internet, trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades ya que ella además de vender en su local también visita a sus clientes ya sea con la intención de vender algo nuevo o también para cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 5 años dedicada al comercio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.

Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The “August 30” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza perrish in the city of Portoviejo, a place knows as being a very commercial zone, also for its traditional festivals in San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its people’s happiness.

Carmen lives here.  She’s 34 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 3.  The older of the two attends school.  Her husband is a policeman.
 
She is a woman who likes to take care of herself and earn her own income to pay for her and her children’s expenses.  She has a shop set up in her home, where she sells paper goods, all types of clothing, shoes, and also offers Internet service.  She works at her activities daily and aside from selling in her shop, she also visits her customers either to sell something new or collect from them, since she also sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She’s been doing this for five years and things are going very well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.  She has been a part of the communal bank for two years and likes to be able to obtain loans quickly.
 
Her dream is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dorng

texts.en:
Dorng lives peacefully with her spouse and four children in a suitable house located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 48 years of age and is engaged in a farming business, primarily growing and harvesting rice to sell in each season. She has been in this type of business for over 20 years and she makes in the neighborhood of 20,000 KHR each day. Her income goes for daily food, electricity bill and allowances for her two school-aged children. Currently two of her children have their employment as sewing staff for a garment factory at Phnom Penh.
 
Dorng is now asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. In the future, Dorng would like to keep making her rice more productive and achieve financial stability. Her first priority is to educate her two school-aged children up to a college level because she wants to see them become professionals in their careers and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 29 years old and is married with a small young kid. She is an industrious woman who pursues the rice farming business and aims to elevate her standard of living someday. She has been doing her business for over 10 years with good support from her husband. Her income goes for her family’s daily’s needs, including commodities costs, food and other allowances. Mom’s husband provides for the family through the income from trading firewood place to place. 

Due to the minimal stock of firewood, Mom is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy firewood to stock for her husband’s business and a future constant sale. She hopes that this will enable them to yield a better profit for the improvement of their living situation.

loans.use: to buy firewood to stock for her husband’s business and a future constant sale.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum, 27 years, is a rice grower who lives in Kampong Chhnang province with her spouse and four young children. She spends most of her time working at the rice field within the rainy season, while she uses the rest of her time to cut bamboo trees into long thin strips for local industries​ and customers, which need them for flooring. Through her effort, Prum is able to make a suitable income of 8,300 KHR to add to her spouse’s income. Prum has been working in these businesses for the past ten years.

Prum is now asking for a loan of 700,000 KHR to purchase bamboo tree stock for shredding to supply the market. The loan will enable her to sustain her business and she hopes to earn more profit to meet the needs of her family. Prum would like to expand her farming business and dreams of having a suitable house in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo tree stock for shredding into thin strips.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, aged 34, is a diligent farmer who satisfactorily lives in Prey Chor district with her spouse and three children, all of whom completely depend on her income and care. In the rainy season, Sok usually works in the rice field from dawn to dusk in order to maintain healthier rice crops. Also, Sok devotes her spare time to going through the village to collect and purchase recycled materials, which she will sell to local industries for extra profit. 

To help bring up and educate their children, Sok’s husband is currently in a carpentry business to generate a major source of income for his family. To have his carpentry work done quickly and effectively, Sok’s husband really needs more tools to make his plans reality and develop his practical performance to achieve his dream of being a successful entrepreneur in his chosen career.

In this regard, Sok would like to take out a loan in the amount of 450 USD to purchase carpentry tools such as a jigsaw and a circular saw to support her husband's business. Sok hopes that this will help their businesses be more productive and that they will be able to provide their children with basic necessities through the raised income.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools such as a jigsaw and a circular saw to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim, 51, is a married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district, where she operates a farming business for her livelihood. She has been a conscientious farmer for over 30 years. She has a simple living with her spouse and two single, grown-up children while her two older children live separately from them. Despite her difficulties in farming, she has the courage to provide her family with comfortable living conditions. Food, home bills, and other commodities are very quickly consumed due to the size of the household.

Due to the lack of a vehicle to serve the transportation needs of the family, Chim and her family members have encountered hardship in commuting to any location. They usually pay for public transportation service to reach their destinations. To reduce expenditures partially, Chim is asking for a loan to supplement her savings in order to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This will enable her to save more money in developing her business as well as for future emergency needs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 24 years old and a married mother who has been blessed with two young kids. She resides in Ang Snoul district, a suburb of Phnom Penh. To help her husband earn an income for the family, May is employed in a local garment factory, receiving a normal payment monthly which she usually uses for daily food and saves for the future of her family-owned business including farming and a pig-raising business. 
 
Right away, May would like to acquire a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins to provide good nutrition and nourish her pigs. This will help her spouse maintain the pig-raising business and will mean the pigs will yield more proceeds upon maturity. Through their tireless work, they hope to lead their family to a better standard of living someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins to provide good nutrition to her pigs.

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.en:
Asliddin is married and has two children, to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 10 years ago he began his own photography business. He has his own photo salon. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. 

He wants to buy a car, as he needs it for his business. Sometimes he goes to clients' homes to photograph them. He is asking for a loan to buy a car. In this way he can provide better service and increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy a car to use for his business

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.ru: Баходиру 52 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами 10 лет назад он начал свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Баходир хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного  средства для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму  5000  сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahodir is 52 years old, married and raising two children. In order to provide his family with all necessary means, he started his business of buying and reselling livestock 10 years ago. He sells the milk to his neighbors and the neighbors are very pleased with the resulting natural milk products. He also sells livestock which he has watched for a few months. He has many customers at the market. 

Bahodir would like to develop his business, but he does not have enough resources to do so. He requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock, in order to develop the business. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Алиджон очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек.  Ему 33 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 12 лет он занимается услугами такси. Его дети с годами все требуют больше блага, дополнительные уроки, компьютер, интернет требует массу денег. Алиджон    должен развивать свой бизнес и преувеличивать доход. Для этого он должен отремонтировать машину и купить новую машину для привлечения клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Alijon is a very hard working and purposeful man. He is 33 years old, married, and raising four children. In order to provide his family with all necessary means, he has been providing a taxi service for more than 12 years. His children have over the years needed more goods, extra tutoring, computers and internet, and this requires a lot of money. 

Alijon needs to develop his business and increase his income. In order to do this, he should repair his car and purchase a new car to attract customers. He requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car and to buy a new car

loans.name: Toutou's Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est composé de vingt  huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leurs activités principales sont le commerce et la coiffure.


Mame Yemou secrétaire du Banc Villageois,l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a en charge ses deux frères qui sont élèves. Elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus,chaussures elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 7 ans; elle fait aussi des tresses à la demande.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo la tête couverte d'un châle blanc, a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète ses tissus (khartoum, wax, bazin,voile....)chaussures,parfums et encens à Dakar et Touba pour revendre au détail dans son village en faisant du porte à porte.


Avec son prêt elle envisage d'acheter 6 rouleaux de tissus de 30 m à 16000 F l'un; des chaussures à 1500 F et 2250 F la paire et espère ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus pendant la rentrée scolaire et la période des fêtes.


Elle constitue son épargne avec ses bénéfices et participe aux dépenses familiales ( santé, nourriture, habillement).
texts.en:
This group is composed of 28 women living in the same neighborhood. They mainly work as vendors and hairdressers.
Mame Yemou, the secretary of the banc villageois and a star borrower, is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She also takes care of her two brothers, still in school. She sells fabric and shoes. She has plenty of experience, having worked in this business for seven years. She also braids hair at the customer’s request. In the photo she is standing on the right,  covered in a white shawl and raising her left hand.

She buys her fabric (khartoum, wax, damask-like bazin, voile), shoes, perfume and incense in Dakar and Touba in order to retail these goods later in her village as a door-to-door vendor. With her loan, she plans to buy six 30-meter rolls of fabric at 16000 West African francs each, and some shoes, at 1,500-2,250 francs a pair. She hopes to  make a good revenue during the beginning of the school year and the holiday period. Her revenues are used to bolster her savings and to help with family expenses (healthcare, food, clothing).

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, perfume and incense for resale.

loans.name: David Jonathan

texts.es:
David tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y un hermano, son una familia unida y trabajadora. Desde hace un año, él se dedica a la crianza de aves (pollos), aprendió el trabajo con un amigo, entre los dos instalaron una granja; pero David se  hizo cargo solo él del negocio y lo ha sabido administrar bien; pues nos comenta que los ingresos que recibe son muy buenos, vende las aves en las ciudades más cercanas. También, se dedica desde hace 8 años al destazo de cerdos y ganado, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre. 

Para adquirir los animales y los insumos que necesita tiene que viajar a la ciudad más cercana ubicada a 12 kilómetros de su casa; cada 8 días viaja a comprar pollos y el alimento para ellos y para los cerdos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar hierro, lamina, cemento, arena, cedazo, bloques; para construir una galera para tener a sus pollos más seguros en la noche, pues por el momento tiene que trasladarlos en la noche al corredor de su casa y tiene que salir durante la noche para vigilarlos y con la construcción de la galera estará mas tranquilo de que sus pollos estarán más seguros.
texts.en:
Davis, 26, is single living with his parents and brother; they are a united, hardworking family.  He’s been raising fowl (chickens) for the last year.  He and a friend started the farm but David has taken it over entirely on his own and has been managing it well because he comments that the profits he earns are good; he sells the fowl in the nearest cities.  For the last 8 years he’s also worked butchering pigs and cattle, an activity he learned from his father.  To acquire the animals and supplies he needs he must travel to the nearest city located 12 kilometers from home; he travels there weekly to buy chicks and feed for them and for the pigs.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy rebar, metal sheeting, cement, sand, sieves and concrete block to build a coop to house his chicks  more securely at night because currently he must move them into his house’s passageway  and go out at night to guard them.  With the construction of the coop he’ll have more peace of mind knowing that his chicks will be more secure.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
In Kampong Siem district of Kompong Cham province, Soeng lives happily with his wife, who appears in the photo next to him, and four single children. Most residents living in this area prefers agribusiness to other businesses, especially growing crops such as rice and kinds of beans. In the same manner, Soeng is in the business of planting rice on their own farmland. He usually works in this business alongside his wife, who is very supportive.

This couple would like to expand their crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, Soeng really needs additional capital to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to keep his rice in a good condition. Soeng is very grateful to generous lenders who offer him constant support in achieving his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to keep his rice in a good condition

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng is 24 years old and married with a small kid, residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Sieng chose to be a crop grower due to the family’s financial constraints and low education. Sieng, however, has a strong determination to struggle over her hardship to achieve a better living condition and provide her child with a further education. Sieng plants and harvests rice and cabbage to sell for her primary source of income. Sieng works in this field along with her spouse to maintain good output in each season.

Sieng is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR to further improve current business. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing cabbage. In the future, Sieng hopes to expand her farming business and to someday experience a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing cabbage.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung, age 62, is an industrious father of six children, currently living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. As a good father, Kung always cares about supporting his family through his farming and fishing activities. Kung looks old, but he is still strong enough to manage his family-owned businesses. With continuous efforts and patience in his business, Kung is able to provide for his family’s basic necessities. At the present, four of his children are already settled for marriage while the rest assist him in the two businesses.

Due to the lack of capital for the purchase of farm supplies to spread on his rice crop, Kung is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for farming. This will enable him to earn sufficient income to gradually improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for farming.

loans.name: Break Through Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her early 20s, is married with a baby.  She has had a cosmetics-selling business for two years now. She is doing great. She works from 8AM to 6PM daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy inventory, to buy a dressing table, and to cover household expenses and she has paid all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to restock cosmetics in her business to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Break Through" with 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock cosmetics in her business.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, aged 56, is widowed mother who has been engaged in farming and trading rice in her village, Ang Snoul, Kandal province. She has been in the businesses for more than 20 years. Every harvest season, Pech usually collects rice from her own farm and also purchases stock from local farmers for both wholesale and retail over a period of the year. She hopes for better yields and proceeds through her hard work so as to support some of her children’s education. She is a mother of five children: two single children and three married children.

Pech is now requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD which will be used to purchase a motorcycle to help one of her sons in providing motorcycle transportation service because his old one was seriously broken and is unsafe to use any longer. Through this purchase, Pech hopes that she could help her son better his living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help one of her sons in providing motorcycle transportation service.

loans.name: Wang'ae Group

texts.en:
Shamira, who is in his early 30s, is married with one child. He has been selling vitenge (fabric), shanga (beads) and sarongs for two years now.  He works from 8am to 5pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more vitenge (fabric), sarongs and shanga (beads), paid household expenses and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock for his business to resell.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own nice house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Wang'ae" which totals 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of vitenge (fabric), shanga (beads) and sarongs for his business.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсуну 43 года, женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 6 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в лавке, который находится возле его дома. Многие его клиенты его соседи и он старается обеспечить их  свежими продуктами.  Турсун должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы расширить круг клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tursun is 43 years old, married and raising one child. He is a very hard working man, and has more than 6 years of experience in doing business. He works with buying and reselling food products in a store, which is situated near his home. Many of his customers are his neighbors and he tries to provide them with fresh products. 

Tursun needs to expand his assortment fast, in order to expand his customer base. He requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purpose of purchasing bread, butter, sausages, canned goods and drinks. He places his hopes with you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Duvan Alberto

texts.es:
Duvan es un joven emprendedor que aprovecho los conocimientos que adquirió de su padre para iniciar su propio negocio de producción de leche. Con unos ahorros compró su primera vaca lechera hace un tiempo y poco a poco con gran esfuerzo ha venido saliendo adelante y comprando más vacas para poder aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar sus ventas. La gran ventaja que tiene es que sus clientes le demandan cada vez más producción de la que puede responder, es por esto que ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera para aumentar su capacidad de producción y así aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida a sus padres.
