texts.en: Duvan is a young entrepreneur who applied the skills he’d learned from his father to start his own dairy business.  He used some savings to buy his first dairy cow some time ago and gradually with much effort has been getting ahead and buying more cows to increase production and sales.  The big advantage he has is that customers demand more product than he’s able to supply every day so now that he has the opportunity to do so he’s looking for a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase his production capacity and thus increase sales.  His dream is to improve his parents’ quality of life and to have a large business someday that creates jobs and

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kijembe Group

texts.en:
Nurudin,who is in his early 40s, is married with six children of which three are still in school and the remaining are young. He has had a food shop business for four years now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

He requests a 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build two houses, to buy a plot for building another house, to buy goats, boats, a radio, & a TV, and to pay household expenses &  school fees, He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to open a new food shop in another place. His dream is to one day be able to enroll his children in a good school.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kijembe" which totals 12 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new food shop.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Neema,who is in her late 30s,is married with three children, two of whom are still in school and another is a baby. She has had a fish selling business for twelve years now and she has a plan to start new business of selling charcoal. She is doing well. She works from 5AM to 6PM daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more fish, repair her work place, and pay household expenses and school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to start selling charcoal.  Her dream is to one be able to build her own nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wakorintho" which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling charcoal.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado sacar su familia adelante a pesar de las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar, tiene un negocio de corte y venta de madera el cual aprendió hace muchos años y gracias a la experiencia ahora es reconocido por la buena calidad de su trabajo. Debido a las grandes dificultades económicas que mantiene, y los largos procesos que debe tramitar para poder talar los árboles, Oscar encuentra grandes dificultades en su negocio para salir adelante, sin embargo siempre trabaja con cada vez más empuje y poco a poco su esposa y su hijo han podido gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Oscar requiere un préstamo para comprar una motosierra y así poder entregar la herramienta a un empleo que va a generar, para poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder tener su propio cultivo de árboles para talar y ya ha empezado con un pequeño cultivo de pinos. Además, aspira a poder tener mejores oportunidades económicas en su familia y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar’s a very hardworking person who has managed to support his family despite the great adversities life has presented him.  To generate income needed for his household, he has a business cutting and selling lumber that he learned years ago and thanks to his experience he’s now well-known for the good quality of his work.  Due to the great economic difficulties he has and the long processes he must carry out in order to fell trees, Oscar faces great difficulties in his business in order to move forward.  However, he works harder every day and gradually his wife and son have been able to enjoy a better quality of life.  

Oscar needs a loan to buy a chainsaw to have the needed work tool for an employment position he plans to open in order to respond to customer orders.  His dream is to own his own tree farm to harvest and he’s already started it with a small crop of pine trees.  He also hopes to have better economic opportunities for his family and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Aster Hankam 5 Group

texts.en: Pulse (mobile phone minutes) is a necessary for every person. Elis uses this opportunity as her business in her home environment. She makes it easy for customers to make several payments when ordering or buying phone service (such as prepaid cards) from Elis. The customer must be have a steady income, thereby reducing the risk of delinquent payment. Elis lives in Jakarta and have two children, Faisah and Cut Egan. Her dream is to see her children become an army.

loans.use: to buy spare mobile phone parts, phones, vouchers, and accessories

loans.name: Tisiya

texts.en:
Tisiya is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Tisiya was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Tisiya is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum. and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Displaced from her home in the Democratic Republic of the Congo when she was just a small girl, Tisiya grew up in the Kyangwali refugee camp in Uganda, where she endured unspeakably poor sanitary conditions, battled malnutrition, and witnessed extreme human suffering. Instead of resigning herself to a life of misfortune, she saw in Kyangwali the opportunity to do tremendous good.

Tisiya has always believed that education is the key to success and in the refugee camp started study groups to help other village students with their studies.  As a solution to the shortage of textbooks for the students, Tisiya formed discussion groups for each class level and selected group leaders for each based on their academic aptitude (to assist weaker students) and their age. On weekends they gathered in larger groups, and Tisia often taught these classes. 

In her hostel in the refugee camp, Tisiya acted as the academic prefect and head girl, overseeing approximately 100 fellow students. She also managed a small hostel library to ensure that the 80+ students who lived in the hostel benefited from the few books provided to them.  She also served as a counselor at her secondary school to help and encourage students to overcome hardships they faced in school. 

Tisiya is passionate about helping African culture to “update” itself so as to “move with the fast changing world," while maintaining pride in its rich and varied culture and traditions. When Tisiya’s grandfather passed away in her refugee camp, she realized that younger people were losing essential information about Africa’s history as elders in her community continued to pass away.  She created a group in the refugee camp called the Voyager Team with other students who share a passion to learn more about Africa. Tisiya thinks it is important to learn about traditional African history and pass it on to generations to come. “We are getting first-hand information that builds us and we share it with other youth. By realizing that ancient Africans did great things, youth are able to believe in themselves and accept that that they can do even greater since the world has much more opportunities through modern technology,” Tisiya explains.

In 2007, Tisiya passed primary school with a First, becoming the first girl to get the First in the history of the Kyangwali refuge settlement in Uganda’s national examination.

Tisiya is passionate about leading positive change in her community. She wants to be a leader and face issues of instability and poverty, so that there can be peaceful communities.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Debora Ernestina

texts.es:
Debora es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene un negocio de servicio de comida con el cual genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos. Debido a que es madre soltera cabeza de hogar, ha tenido que padecer grandes dificultades económicas, pero con su esfuerzo ha venido superándolas poco a poco y continuar ofreciendo a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. En su negocio, desde hace un tiempo ha venido perdiendo clientela porque no ha podido ofrecer el servicio a domicilio, y para poder recuperar esta clientela, Debora busca un préstamo para comprar una moto y así poder ofrecer el servicio a domicilio para recuperar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar. 

De esta manera podrá tener unas ventas con las cuales seguir superando sus dificultades económicas y sacar sus 3 hijos adelante. Su sueño es tener un gran negocio con el cual salir adelante y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar.
texts.en:
Debora’s a very hardworking person who has a food business that generates income to support her home where she lives with her three children.  Because she’s a single mother head of household, she’s suffered through great economic difficulties but with effort has overcome them little by little and continued to provide her children with a good quality of life.  

For some time now, she’s been losing customers because of her inability to provide delivery service and in order to recapture that clientele, Debora is looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to provide home delivery service and recuperate her sales and improve her home’s quality of life.  IN this way, she will be able to have sales to continue overcoming her economic difficulties and move her three children forward.  Her dream is to have great business with which to get ahead and provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to provide delivery service.

loans.name: Jose Abad

texts.es:
Jose trabaja en la calle vendiendo productos de uso personal desde hace 12 años, cuando decidió dejar la actividad de la agricultura por motivos ajenos a su voluntad. Debido a que sus padres se dedicaban a la actividad de la agricultura, Jose aprendió desde muy temprano esta actividad y durante un tiempo la desarrolló para generar los ingresos para su hogar, pero por enfrentamientos de violencia se vio en la obligación de dejar las tierras donde vivía y buscar en la ciudad nuevas oportunidades económicas. Fue así como comenzó con el negocio con el cual lleva 12 años y gracias al cual su familia puede gozar de unos ingresos para subsistir. Gracias a que sus ventas vienen aumentando, Jose busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que buscan para aumentar así sus ingresos.

De esta manera irá poco a poco superando las grandes dificultades de capital que tiene y también las adversidades como la lluvia, el tráfico de carros y otras adversidades que evitan vender más en su negocio. Su sueño es ubicarse dentro de un local donde pueda generar empleo para sus sobrinos que son muy pobres y no tienen dinero para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
José has been working for 12 years selling personal use items in the street ever since he stopped working in agriculture for reasons beyond his control.  Because his parents worked in agriculture he learned it from a very young age and for a time was the activity he carried out to earn household income but due to the outbreaks of violence he was forced to leave the land he lived on and look for new economic opportunities in the city.  This is how he started the business he’s now had for 12 years and thanks to which his family can have the income needed to subsist.  Thanks to increasing sales, José is looking for a loan to buy personal use items his customers are looking for in order to increase his income.

In this way he’ll gradually overcome the great difficulties he has with capital and also adversities like rain, vehicular traffic and other adversities that keep him from selling more in his business.  His dream is to set up inside a locale where he can generate income for his nephews who are very poor and don’t have money to pay for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Kapampa Group

texts.en:
Pendo, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, two of whom are in school and the other is a baby. She has had a butcher shop since 2005.  She works from 6am to 8:30pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

Her request is for her 5th loan from Tujujenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy meat, repair her house, pay school fees, connect electricity in her house, and build a cesspit tank and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more stock of meat to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to open another butcher shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kapampa" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to resell.

loans.name: Rahinatu

texts.en:
Rahinatu is a 19-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Rahinatu was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Rahinatu is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Rahinatu comes from Salanga, Ghana and is one of a family of six.

Rahinatu is passionate about the value of education and making a difference in her community. Noticing the high occurrence of teen pregnancy in her community, Rahinatu sought to educate peers on the implications of pregnancy and the value of education. With the help of the Ghana education service, she spoke at a forum encouraging girls to stay in school and avoid pregnancy. 

Rahinatu’s leadership capabilities are evidenced by the numerous leadership roles she assumed at school in Ghana, where she was girls’ prefect and a member of the Debating club, HIV/AIDS club, and the Maths and Science club. Academically, Rahinatu has also excelled greatly, winning the Presidential Award as the best female in the northern region for the 2011/2012 school year. She also won the regional debate competition. 

Rahinatu plans to become a gynecologist in order to look after the unique needs of women and their health. She decided on this particular career path after seeing how understaffed a particular hospital was when it comes to helping women in labur.

Rahinatu’s vision for Africa lies in access to education: in twenty years’ time, she wants to make sure that all African children have access to education.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Rellikson

texts.en:
Rellikson is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Rellikson was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Rellikson is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Rellikson hails from rural Kenya. His particular village has only two poorly built primary schools, with few instructors and limited teaching materials.  Noticing the extremely low academic performance amongt the village children, Rellikson took it upon himself to do something about the situation. He launched a tutoring program, dedicating his weekends to mentor students in his district and volunteering as a teacher two days a week for the past three years. As a result of Rellikson’s tremendous efforts, the academic performance of these students increased tremendously and some were even admitted to provincial schools. Rellikson continues to support students academically by writing an INSHA book (composition and essay in Kiswahili) – a guide book for primary school students to improve their writing skills. 

Rellikson’s passion for community service was also evidenced by his dogged determination to address the problem of water-borne diseases facing his village. A proactive and pragmatic leader, Rellikson realized that the high rate of water-borne diseases in his village was largely due to the lack of toilets. Rellikson sought to address this problem by digging pit latrines and encouraging others in his village to do so. He has since recorded a dramatic reduction in the number of deaths from cholera, typhoid, and dysentery in his village – a remarkable feat from the efforts of a single young boy.

Academically, Rellikson has achieved extraordinary results. He was the first student in his district to join Alliance High School, one of the best high schools in Kenya, and holds as many as twenty academic certificates. Rellikson’s natural ability to lead others in his community was formally recognized by the numerous leadership positions he held at his school, including class prefect, chapel praise and worship leader, and dorm prayer coordinator. He was also a Sunday school teacher in his community church, and he was invited to be a motivational speaker and teacher at his primary school. 

Rellikson is very interested in the field of medicine.  He hopes to impact Africa by seeking practical solutions to address the problems of poor health services and widespread diseases on the continent.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Ukeme

texts.en:
Ukeme is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Ukeme was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Ukeme is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Ukeme comes from Ikpot Ekpene, Nigeria.

Despite his young age, Ukeme has an innate ability to lead others and is passionate about positively impacting his community. Recognizing the need for a decent road in his community, Ukeme single-handedly spear-headed a project for the construction of a new road despite having had no formal training or expertise therein. In his spare time, he filled empty bags of cement with sand and would lay them in major holes on the road. He then added timber during the rainy season and constructed a gutter to encourage water flow. 

Despite initial skepticism from his community, Ukeme was able to get other members of the community to assist him in constructing the road. After some time, Ukeme and his fellow community members had managed to successfully construct a road fit for use by vehicles.

Ukeme is also a budding entrepreneur. During school, he established and maintained his own restaurant business. He sold sachets of water to earn money to start up the restaurant business, and he made contacts with traders so he could obtain food items. In Nigeria, Ukeme would sell food items very early in the morning and on Saturdays so his business would not interfere with his academics. The business started as a small store beside his house where he sold small food items, and in time it grew to the point where he could rent a space near a school campus for his business.

As Ukeme’s restaurant became more successful, his family became involved in the preparation of food items and he even now has two additional employees who work at his restaurant. The revenue from Ukeme’s business contributed to the payment of his school fees and also provides money for a separate youth organizations that Ukeme runs. 

Ukeme aspires to impact Africa by establishing Africa’s first continental health organization, similar to the WHO, but with a unique focus on medical development in Africa. Through this organization, Ukeme wants to reduce the high mortality rates throughout the continent and also reduce the high number of maternal deaths.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Chidubem

texts.en:
Chidubem is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Chidubem was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Chidubem is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Chidubem comes from Abuja, Nigeria and is one of a family of six.

At school in Suleja, Nigeria, Chidubem’s natural ability to lead others was recognized by his extensive involvement in a number of clubs and societies as well as the numerous leadership positions he held. He served on the Student Editorial Board and was the service secretary of the Fellowship of Christian Students, the secretary of the Jets Club, the general secretary of the Technicians and Scientists Club, and an active member of the Junior Engineers club. Chidubem was also the Head Boy of his school. Though it was challenging to balance his role as Head Boy with his academics and numerous other activities, Chidubem was able to organize his time efficiently -- a skill which he views as crucial to a good leader.

Chidubem is also a good student and a gifted artist. He was awarded first prize for Best Graphics junior category for his painting titled “Kick AIDS out of Nigeria."

Chidubem has a deep passion for Africa and wants to bring about positive change to the continent by focusing on improving transportation. He hopes to establish a corporation that will provide an effective transportation system with continent-wide coverage.  He is passionate about economic stability and wants work to close the wealth disparity gap in most African countries.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es:
Ivannia vive en la provincia de Cartago, Costa Rica, y trabaja en una fábrica de ropa. Ella necesita comprar una computadora la cual usará junto con su  hijo,  ya que él es estudiante de secundaria y la meta de Ivannia es aprender computación para su propia superación, solicita para esto un crédito por setecientos mil colones (¢700.000).
Ella se siente contenta de contar con  este proyecto  de crédito de fácil acceso, con el cual alcanzará sus metas.
texts.en:
Ivannia lives in the province of Cartago, Costa Rica and works in a clothing factory.  She needs to buy a computer for her son to use as he is a student in high school.  Ivannia's goal is to learn how to use the computer on her own.  She is requesting a 700,000 colon loan to do so.

Ivannia feels happy with this easily accessed loan, which she will use to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy computers to start an intensive computer course.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is a 19-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders.
 
Chantal was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Chantal is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Chantal is an orphan and comes from Rubavu, Rwanda. 

Despite the hardships she has endured having no parents and coming from difficult living conditions, Chantal strives to achieve the best in everything that she does and is dedicated to creating a better future for herself and children in similar situations. Passionate about helping other orphans, Chantal wants to work as hard as she can so that she will be in a position to help as many orphans as possible and “make them not worry about their loss.”

Chantal is an extremely motivated and persistent young woman and has demonstrated a steel resolve when it comes to achieving her goals. When her father passed away last year, Chantal struggled to find financial support for her school fees. Determined not to let her difficult circumstances prevent her from receiving a good education, through persistence and hard work in school, Chantal was able to procure sponsorship from a foundation.

Chantal is also a strong student and showed great resilience after switching from a Francophone to Anglophone systems of education. Despite the challenges she faced, she was still able to perform well, receiving multiple academic awards and retaining a position as one of the top students at her secondary school. She also earned the highest scores in both primary and secondary national exams. 

Chantal’s determination and positive influence on others were recognized when she was selected as the head of all students in her sector. She explains that she used this position to motivate her peers to become sharp and bright by participating in discussions and gain more knowledge. She was also class captain of Kiswahili club and president of the student’s association. 

In the next 20 years, Chantal hopes to become a doctor specializing in women’s diseases. She also hopes to be a leader and role model to women by “giving them advice, encouraging them to dream high, and not be discouraged by what they have faced."

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Bakary

texts.en:
Bakary is a 16-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Bakary was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Bakary is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Bakary comes from Rufisque in western Senegal and is one of a family of four.

A young leader passionate about serving his community, Bakary spearheaded a community-wide project to build public toilets after noticing that the widespread poor sanitation resulted in serious health diseases. Bakary mobilized fellow community members to help him build proper toilets. He also helped build a bridge so people crossing the river would not have to wade across.

Bakary loves African literature and learning about the cultures, habits, and challenges of other Africans. It is through literature that he derives his inspiration from the incredible stories of leaders like Thomas Sankara and Nelson Mandela, role models which have been influential on Bakary’s leadership journey.

His teachers in Senegal describe him as very passionate about Africa with genuine curiosity and humility. One said of him, “He identifies many community needs and proposes ways to better the school and his community.”
Another issue close to Bakary’s heart is that of raising awareness about AIDS and malaria. In Senegal, Bakary co-founded a club to raise awareness about AIDS and malaria in the village of Bango. As part of this effort, the club distributed much-needed mosquito netting and provided HIV testing. As credit to his ability to take initiative, he was nominated by the religious leader of his community to lead the youth in a community cleaning campaign. A testament to his strong leadership capabilities, Bakary was also elected as prefect of his junior high school. 

Bakary also has a natural flair for language. He won first prize in three Scrabble competitions before forming the Scrabble club at his school. He also won first prize for a writing competition.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Mame Oulimata

texts.en:
Mame is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Mame was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Mame is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Mame comes from Dakar, Senegal and is one of a family of five.

A young leader committed to serving her community, Mame is passionate about the environment and has participated in many cleaning campaigns organized by the youth in her area. 

She also has a keen interest in public health and wants to become a doctor and create an NGO like the Red Cross that will specifically target Africa and provide efficient healthcare. She loves to travel and explore new places as well as engage in enriching cross-cultural conversations.

She successfully advocated as a youth representative in the village council to grant the youth increased access to public facilities.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Thato

texts.en:
Thato is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Thato was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Thato is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Thato comes from a family of three and grew up in Johannesburg, South Africa. 

Thato is a compassionate and caring young woman with a strong desire to help others in her community. At school in Johannesburg, Thato noticed the high number of students at her school from impoverished backgrounds who came to school without any food, and she sought to find a way to support her peers without revealing anyone's socioeconomic status. Thato launched a feeding scheme together with her Life Orientation teacher. This program included planting seeds for vegetables that could be grown on a sustainable basis. Thato ran the project by raising money for equipment, seeds, and other required resources. She also managed to get sponsors and volunteers to help maintain the garden.

Thato’s track record of involvement in community outreach is extensive. Over and above the food garden, she also started a career guidance club at her school for students to get counseling on careers and about attending university. She also volunteers at the local social center that helps people on welfare in Soweto township.

Academically, Thato has always been a top student, taking the award for best learner for the last two consecutive years. She also received top achievers awards and a mathematics award. 

Thato’s strong abilities as a leader have been formally recognized in several platforms: she participated in a provincial dialogue at Constitutional Hill, the Girls and Boys Education Movement, and the Self-Awareness Leadership Campaign at her school. She was also selected as one of 100 youth in Johannesburg to represent her school on the Johannesburg Student Council.

Passionate about the environment and its conservation, Thato also started and ran an environmental awareness campaign at her school.  She hopes to become a leader in the environmental sector, impacting the continent by protecting and conserving its natural resources.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap-making supplies.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar tiene una legumbrería donde ofrece todo tipo de verduras a sus clientes. Ya tiene varios años de experiencia en la actividad y la gran ventaja con la que cuenta es que no hay competencia muy cercana, lo que le permite ir poco a poco creciendo con su negocio y mejorar los ingresos para su hogar. Buscando superar la gran dificultad de capital que tiene en su negocio, Luis busca un préstamo para comprar verduras y aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá vender las verduras que sus clientes están constantemente preguntando, y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos mejorarán considerablemente. Su sueño es ver crecer este negocio constantemente y ver como sus 4 hijos salen adelante con una buena educación.
texts.en: Luis is married and has four children.  To generate household income he has a vegetable shop where he offers his customers all types of vegetables.  He has several years’ experience in this activity and the great advantage he has is that there is no nearby competition which makes it possible for him to gradually grow with the business and improve household income.  Seeking to overcome the difficulty his business has with capital, Luis is looking for a loan to buy vegetables and increase the variety of products he has in stock.  In this way he will be able to buy the vegetables his customers are constantly asking for and at the same time increase his income considerably.  His dream is to see the business grow constantly and to see how his four children move forward with a good education.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables.

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es:
Jorge trabajó durante muchos años de manera ambulante y luego tuvo una tienda durante unos 3 años; de esta manera se iba generando los ingresos que requería en su hogar y podía mantener los gastos de su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 2, 7 y 11 años de edad. Actualmente tiene una casa donde ofrece el servicio de hospedaje y gracias a este ha podido mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por esto siempre trabaja fuertemente para poderlo sacar adelante y seguir progresando en su hogar. Jorge busca un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas en su hotel y hacer 2 habitaciones más.

De esta manera podrá aumentar su capacidad y así mejorar sus ventas, permitiéndole tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida para su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
texts.en: Jorge worked from place to place for many years and then had a store for three years.  He generated income his household needed this way and was able to cover expenses for his wife and three children who are 2, 7 and 11 years old.  He currently has a boarding house and thanks to this he’s improved his income and his family’s quality of life.  He always works hard to move it ahead and continue making progress at home.  Jorge seeks a loan to do some physical improvements to his hotel and to build two more rooms.  In this way he will increase capacity and improve sales leading to improved income and quality of life for his wife and three children.

loans.use: to do some improvements to the hotel and to build two more rooms.

loans.name: Rosario Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosario es socia activa del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, forma parte de este grupo hace un año, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosario tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 15 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una academia de costura y  trabaja, su segundo hijo trabaja, le ayuda económicamente y estudia en un colegio a distancia y su ultimo hijo trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora como pintor en taller de estucos (cielos rasos), la casa es propia construida en unión conyugal.

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, como pasa en casa cría animal como cuyes y gallinas, también se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla lo que aprendió por habilidad desde que se caso.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas, alimento para animales y paja toquilla para la realización de sus sombreros.

Su meta es agrandar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario is an active member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores del Futuro” (Entrepreneurs of the Future). She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its cold climate and its warm-hearted people who have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Rosario is 43 years old, married, and has three children (ages 23, 21, and 15). Her oldest child, a daughter, works and is a student at a sewing academy. The middle child, a son, works and helps out financially, but he also attends a high school that is some distance away. Her youngest son works in order to pay his personal expenses. Rosario’s husband works as a painter at a workshop that produces stucco (for plastering roofs). They own their home which they built themselves.

Rosario is devoted to performing the household chores, but she also spends time at home raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also makes woven straw hats, a skill she learned after she got married. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and straw for making woven hats.

Her goal is to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and straw for making woven hats.

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es:
Beatriz es una persona soltera y para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar tiene una venta de productos de uso personal, la cual inició hace un tiempo y gracias a la ha podido generar sus ingresos. Pese a que no cuenta con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante y superar sus dificultades, y gracias a que sus ventas vienen mejorando, Beatriz busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a las ventas con sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a ser la principal vendedora de productos de uso personal en su sector, y así mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Beatriz is single and in order to cover household expenses sells personal use products, a business she started some time ago and thanks to which she’s able to generate her income.  Despite not having much capital, her effort has allowed her to continue moving forward and overcome her difficulties.  Thanks to her increasing sales, Beatriz is looking for a loan to buy personal use products to respond to customer demand. Her dream is to become her zone’s main seller of personal use products to improve her income and her quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy personal use items to respond to customer demand.

loans.name: José  Mauricio

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, debido a que era el mayor de sus hermanos tenia que ayudarle a su papá con el trabajo. A la edad de 19 años, se caso y siempre continuo trabajando junto a su padre, cuando nacieron sus hijos empezó a trabajar en lo propio. 

Para adquirir los insumos agrícolas tiene que viajar a la ciudad, ubicada a 15 kilómetros de su casa; luego paga transporte para llevárselos a su casa, de ahí los traslada en carreta al lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a un kilómetro de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y para pago de mano de obra para su cultivo de maíz. Con la inversión, espera mejorar la producción de maíz y su nivel de vida, que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
José, 42, is married and has four children.  He’s been doing agricultural work since he was little because he was the oldest brother and had to help his father with the work.  At the age of 19 he got married and continued working alongside his father but when his children were born he started to work for himself.  

In order to buy his farm supplies, he has to travel to the city which is 15 kilometers from home and then he has to pay transport costs to bring them home.  From home he takes them by cart to the place where he has his crops which is a kilometer from his house.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs for his corn crop.  He hopes the investment will improve corn production and his standard of living and that his children are able to attend university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal mujeres de fortaleza esta conformado por 8 integrantes todas mujeres de la misma comunidad. Son mujeres madres de familia con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas pertenecen al municipio de malpaisillo localidad de la ciudad de león, Malpaisillo es un lugar lindo con gente trabajadora, humilde del campo las  cuales disfrutan de una vida calma, tranquila. la rutina diario de trabajo de Dinora Corina que es la cordinadora del banco   es levantarse a la 4:00: am hasta que se oculta el sol día a día  para trabajar en su negocios. Su actividades económicas   consisten el la venta de leche y cuajada, actividad muy propia del municipio ya que son productores de leche, porque tienen sus vacas, becerros. Ella decidio   formar el banco comunal para optar al crédito de dicha formar para salir adelante con sus pequeño negocio. El banco comunal Mujeres de Fortaleza agradece mucho la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida. Con el financiamiento comprara más leche y cuajada para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y vecinos de su municipio. 
Un saludos a todos los prestamista kiva y viva “León Nicaragua”
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres de Fortaleza" (Women of Strength) consists of 8 members, all women from the same community. They are mothers of families and have (together) 15 dependent children. They belong to the Malpaisillo township, part of the city of León. Malpaisillo is a pretty place, with hard-working, humble people from the countryside who enjoy a calm, peaceful life. The daily work routine of Dinora Corina, the coordinator of the bank, is to get up at 4 am and work until the sun goes down, day after day, to work in her business. The business activities consist of selling milk and milk curds, an activity that is very typical of this township, since she is a producer of milk because she has her cows and calves. She decided to form a communal bank so they could opt for this credit in order to advance with their little businesses. The communal bank Mujeres de Fortaleza is very thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of living. With the financing, she will buy more milk and milk curds to satisfy the demands of her customers and neighbors in her township.

A salute to all the Kiva lenders, and "Vive, León, Nicaragua."

loans.use: to buy milk and milk curds to sell

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Santa Lucia esta conformado por 8 integrantes todas son mujeres entre las edades de 25 a 60 anos, todas pertenecen al municipio del Sauce que esta el parte norte de Nicaragua, estas mujeres son madres solteras con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. El sauce es un lugar muy acogedor, de personas muy sencillas con una vista y paisajes muy hermosos sus riachuelos, sus ojos de aguas limpias y cristalinas, sus arboles sus sipres. También el Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, que es la mayor actividad de la zona. todas se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante con sus negocios y obtener mejores ingresos. Petrona del Socorro es la cordinadora del banco y su actividad es  vender de forma ambulante cuajada, leche. La rutina de de Petrona del Socorro  es de aproximadamente de 10 horas diaria en condiciones muy duras ya que camina bajo el intenso sol del día a día. Y  ella tiene que cargar con sus pequeño hijo porque no tienen a quien confiárselos. Ella esta  solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en la compra y venta  de leche y sus derivados. Agradecen el apoyo y financiamiento que los prestamista kiva le brindan a los personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Santa Lucía Communal Bank is made up of eight members, all women between the ages of 25 and 60.  They all live in the town of El Sauce, in the north of Nicaragua.  These women are single mothers with children in their care.  El Sauce is a very welcoming place of modest people and with a view and very pretty landscapes: with streams, clean and crystalline springs, trees, cypress trees.

El Sauce is also known for being a milk-producing region because it's the major activity in the area, they all support each other mutually to get ahead with their business and earn more income.  Petrona del Socorro is the coordinator of the bank and travels from neighborhood to neighborhood selling milk curd.  Petrona del Socorro's routine is very hard, approximately 10 hours a day in very difficult conditions because she walks in the intense sun every day.  She carries her small son her because they don't have anyone to take care of them.

Petrona del Socorro is requesting the loan to invest in buying and selling milk and dairy products.

She and the other group members are grateful for the support and financing that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy and sell milk and dairy products

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA EUFRONIA, es una persona de 56 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente en su propia casa junto a su esposo y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus nietos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son la papa, haba, y arveja. La producción de estos cultivos especialmente la papa los realiza en dos épocas de la gestión en sus propios terrenos las mismas que se hallan situadas en las comunidades de 15 de Octubre y Chuina Pampa del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Eufronia y su esposo manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas como ser semilla y abono de gallinaza que le permitirán obtener mejores rendimientos especialmente en la papa y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señora Eufronia is a person of 56 years of age. She is married. She attended primary school. Now she lives in her own house together with her husband, and she has three economic dependents in her care; they are her grandchildren. She works in agricultural production. The products she grows are potatoes, beans, and peas. She plants these crops, especially the potatoes, twice a year on her own plots of land, which are located in the communities of 15 de Octubre and Chuina Pampa in the borough of Tiraque, approximately 65 km from the city of Cochabamba. Señora Eufronia and her husband demonstrate that they are hard-working and responsible people who want to better themselves and increase their agricultural production, and for that purpose they see the need to apply for investment capital for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seeds and poultry manure, which will permit them to obtain better yields, especially of potatoes, and in this way they will obtain better income, which is going to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and poultry manure

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Nicole vit avec son conjoint conducteur et leurs 06 enfants à Lomé. Quatre des 6 sont scolarisés et elle est âgée de 42ans. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du ménage, elle commence par vendre depuis 10ans des produits d’alimentation générale et des pagnes à domicile. Afin d’étendre son activité et assurer les besoins des enfants, elle sollicite son cinquième crédit de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise (produits d’alimentation générale et des pagnes) pour vendre et tirer des profits.
texts.en: Nicole lives with her husband, a driver, and their six children in Lomé. Four of the six are in school. Nicole is 42 years old. To help out her husband in covering household expenses, she has been selling grocery items and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) out of her home for ten years. To expand her business and to ensure her children's needs are met, she is requesting her fifth loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise (grocery items and 'pagne' cloth) to sell and earn profits.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar is 26 years old and works hard to support his family. Married to a housewife, he has been busy selling building materials in a shop for the past two years. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money.

Muzaffar is requesting a loan to buy more building materials to sell, and in the future hopes to improve his business in order to improve his family's quality of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to sell.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Энергичный и весьма приятный молодой человек, которого зовут Фирдавс, более 3 года занимается услугами такси. Ему 31 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. С детства он мечтал стать шофером и сегодня он реализует свою детскую мечту, но его доход не позволяет ему обновить машину и таким путем расширить бизнес, так как его машина старая и поэтому у него мало клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  10000  сомони для покупки новой машины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This energetic and quite attractive young man, named Firdavs, has been involved in providing a taxi service for over three years.  He is 31 years old, married and raising two children.  He had dreamed of becoming a driver since childhood and lives his childhood dream today, but his income does not allow him to update his car and expand his business.  Because his car is old, he does not have many clients.  Firdavs is requesting the loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase a new car.  He relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Baraka, who is in his mid 30's, is a married father of four children, only two of whom are old enough to attend school. He has been running his charcoal business since 2006. Working from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily, he is able to make a very good monthly profit.

Now requesting his 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell, Baraka used his previous loans, all since repaid, to build a house, buy a TV, a radio, a plot of land, and a computer, and to meet household expenses. His dream is to one day improve his business by buying even more sacks of charcoal.

Baraka will share this loan with his loan group "Mtaji wa Masikini" which has a total of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловару 32 года, он женат на прекрасной женщине, которая работает медсестрой и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 1 года опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в продовольственном магазине. Он продает конфеты, печенья, напитки, мясные изделия, муку, масло т т.п. Он хочет расширить ассортимент, но не имеет средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilovar is 32 years, married to a beautiful woman, who works as a nurse, and raising one child.  He is a very hardworking person and has over one year of experience in business.  He is involved in buying and selling food products at a food market.  He sells candy, cookies, beverages, meat products, flour, butter, etc.  Dilovar wants to expand his product selection, but does not have the means for this.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bread, butter, sausage, canned goods, beverages and dairy products.  He relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase bread, butter, sausage, canned goods, beverages and dairy products

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат 60 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 14  лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее  2 коровы. Она продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Мархамат хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Marhamat is 60 years old, married and raising four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 14 years.  She has two cows.  She sells livestock after taking care of it for several months.  She has many clients at a market.  Marhamat wants to develop her business, but does not have enough means for this.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy livestock in order to develop her business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to develop her business

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila de 46 años de edad, es una mujer laboriosa; vive en su propia casa que compró  junto a  su pareja Jesús  de 46 años; tienen a su único hijo Félix de 15 años, quien es el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad que con tanta voluntad y entrega a la que se dedica Cirila y su esposo, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. 
Cirila, se dedica a labrar sus tierras en donde cultiva plantas de café; ella sabe que depende del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de café, dependerá la calidad y el precio que obtenga en las ventas de sus granos.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y con muy buena obtención. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar los pesados sacos de sus cosechas hasta los centros de acopio; lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos ubicada a una hora de su comunidad.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo, invertirá en la contrata jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como en la poda y el deshierbo de malezas. Este es su crédito número 02; agradece a los financieros por la confianza que le brindan; asimismo agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por el apoyo moral que le brindan y así seguirá con sus planes de trabajo.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará abono, asimismo contratará a peones para que le apoyen.
texts.en:
Cirila, 46, is an industrious woman.  She lives in her own house, which she bought with her partner, Jesús, 46.  They have an only child, Félix, 15, who is the main motivation of all her efforts.  The work that Cirila and her husband have done with so much will and dedication has helped her a lot to make progress in her life.

Cirila makes a living working her land, where she grows coffee plants.  She knows that the quality and the price she gets for the sale of her beans will depend on the care she gives her coffee crops.  What she likes most about her job is taking care of her plants, and she's very happy when she sees them big and with very good results.

She has been doing this work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy bags of her harvests to the distribution centers located an hour from her community, where she receives better prices for her beans.

With the loan she received she's going to hire day laborers to help her with the maintenance of her plants as well as with the pruning and weeding.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help her.

This is her second loan.  She's grateful to the lenders for their trust.  She's also grateful to the members of her communal bank for their moral support, and this way she'll continue with her work plans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers

loans.name: Dieng

texts.en:
Dieng is 51 years old and a married mother of three children. Two of her children are employed to help the family financially. The main income of the family completely depends on a business operated by Dieng in a local market in Phnom Penh. She sells breakfast and lunch. This helps her generate a decent income to support her family financially. Dieng still needs to improve and expand her food store and thereby attract more customers to buy her food.

Dieng would like to ask for a loan through HKL to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used to transport items back and forth to the marketplaces as well as to satisfy her household transportation needs. Deing appreciates receiving this loan to better her living conditions. She will pay her loan back in full and punctually. In the future, Dieng hopes to make her business more profitable and continuously support the education of her last-born child.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport items back and forth to the marketplaces as well as to satisfy her household transportation needs.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny works as a security guard for a private company in Phnom Penh to earn a living for his family. He has been in this occupation since 2009. Ny is now 23 years old and married to a woman who is involved in the garment industry. This couple does not have any children yet but they plan to have one when they have a consistent income in the near future. 

In addition to his main career, Ny would like to provide transportation service to the public. However, he doesn’t have sufficient capital to purchase a motorcycle. For this reason, Ny is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business. Ny hopes to achieve good profits for the overall welfare of his family with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Ichozat

texts.ru: Ичозат трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 44 года. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет одну несовершеннолетнюю девочку. Она имеет более чем 10 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается  переработкой сухофруктов. Ичозат покупает свежие фрукты, сушит их и потом продает на местном рынке. Ее дочь помогает ей в переработке сухофруктов. Ичозат старается, чтобы ее дочь не почувствовала, что растет без отца. Она хочет развевать бизнес, но не имеет средства для этого. Ичозат запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ichozat is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  She is 44 years old, a widow and raising one adolescent daughter.  Ichozat has over ten years of experience in business.  She is involved in processing dried fruits.  Ichozat buys fresh fruits, dries them and then sells them at a local market.  Her daughter helps her with processing dried fruits.  Ichozat tries to provide well for her daughter, so that she does not feel like she is growing up without a father.  She wants to develop her business, but does not have means to do so.  Ichozat is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to purchase dried fruits.  She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is 20 years old and a responsible mother of a young child. She currently resides in the Kompong Cham province. She operates a few plots of farm as the primary source of her income. Her husband always devotes his time to her in order to yield a better rice production every harvest season. She has been in this business since she was a child. She earns approximately 6,000 KHR per day. 

Choeun dreams of having a better life and achieving financial stability. That is why she is seeking ways to support her family. Choeun plans to invest her generated income into a grocery-selling business. However, she needs additional capital to make this possible. For this reason, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to purchase grocery items such as spices, snack foods, sweets, powders, shampoos, beverages and other miscellaneous household items for selling in her store. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her new business in order to provide her family with a better quality of life, especially her lovely child. She will send her to a good school to get a higher education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as spices, snack foods, sweets, powders, shampoos, beverages and other miscellaneous household items for selling in her store.

loans.name: Senam Group

texts.en:
The 'Senam' group comprises two women who sell fish and maize (corn) oil in Teshie. They buy these items from a central market and sell them to customers in the community.

Senam sells fish and maize (corn) oil in large quantities. Her customers are based in Teshie. She supplies the items to her customers and collects full payment in two days' time. She is 38 years old and married to a driver; they have three children. 

This is her second loan with ID-Ghana. She is requesting 500 GHS. She was given 300 GHS in the first loan cycle and completed payment on Aug. 15, 2012. She has reinvested the profits so her business can grow quickly.

They need 700 GHS to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy fish and maize (corn) oil in large quantities to sell to customers.

loans.name: Habiza

texts.ru: Хабиза очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 15 лет назад она начала свой бизнес с изготовлением и реализации лепешки. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. В течении дня она производит 200-260 штук лепешки по стоимости 1 сомони за штук. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони  для покупки муки для изготовления лепешки. Она ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ей поможем обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами!
texts.en: Habiza is a very hardworking and honest woman.  She is 40 years old and raising four children.  To provide the family with all of the necessities, she started her own business of preparing and selling flatbread 15 years ago.  Her efficiency helps her to be successful in the business.  Habiza makes 200-260 flatbread per day at a cost of one somoni each.  Her oldest daughter helps her with running the business.  Habiza is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase flour for making flatbread.  She relies on your kindness.  Let's help her to provide her family with all of the necessities!

loans.use: to purchase flour for making flatbread

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 33 años de edad; vive con su pareja y su hija en la casa que compró gracias al empeño de su trabajo cotidiano. Daniel, es un hombre de lucro; se dedica a la venta de comestibles (arroz, verduras, pollo, carne, conservas, etc.); esta labor ejerce en su propio hogar hace 05 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Daniel comenta que para obtener su negocio tuvo muchas dificultades, ya que no tenia ingreso económico; pero al pasar del tiempo con las ventas de su cosecha de café, logro incrementar su tienda y sobre todo desde que empezó a contar con los préstamos que MFP y los financieros brinda; ahora s hace conocedor de su actividad, atendiendo con amabilidad a sus clientes. Ahora con el préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles para su tienda, ya que es su trabajo principal donde le genera buenos ingresos. Este es su crédito número 03 y una vez mas agradece el apoyo de los financieros, quienes confían de su capacidad de pago. En su banco comunal, le agrada trabajar con socios solidarios y cabales.
Con el préstamo de 2,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de saco de arroz, pollo, verduras. Entre lo necesario para su tienda.
texts.en:
Daniel, 33, lives with his partner and daughter in the house he bought thanks to his determination in his everyday job. 

Daniel is a profit-oriented man. He makes a living selling foodstuffs (rice, vegetables, chicken, meat, canned food, and other things). He has worked in this field for 5 years and always has the help of his wife. 

Daniel says that in order to get his business, he had many difficulties because he did not have any income. However, over time, selling his coffee plants and, above all, the loans that MFP and its donors offered , he was able to grow his store. 

Currently he is an expert in his business, attending amicably to his clientele. 

With the loan he obtained, he will invest it in the inventory for his store because it is his primary source of revenue. 

This is his third loan and once again he is thankful for the support of financiers who believe in his ability of repayment. At his communal bank, he enjoys working with such supportive and fine colleagues. 

With the loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, he will stock up on sacks of rice, chicken, and vegetables, among other necessary items for his store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, chicken, vegetables, and other things for his store.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Demetria de 31 años, es una mujer amable, sencilla y sobre todo laboriosa: vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo Aurelio de 32 años; en ella reside con su querido hijo Jack de 11 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Hace 02 años, Demetria abrió una tienda de comestibles y es una de las más concurridas por la gente de su comunidad; gracias a su amabilidad de atención al cliente, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano.
Le gusta su trabajo, ya que gracias a la visita que tiene de sus vecinos, tiene siempre un ingreso económico. Demetria invertirá su préstamo en la compra de provisiones necesarias para su puesto de ventas. Este es su crédito número 02, agradece por la confianza que le brindan, ya que así seguirá con su negocio; por otra parte se siente alegre de formar parte de su banco comunal, ya que trabaja con socios dinámicos y comprometidos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de un saco de arroz, bebidas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Demetria, 31, is a pleasant, modest, and above all industrious woman.  She lives in the house she bought with her husband Aurelio, 32.  She lives there with her beloved son Jack, 11, whom she wants to give a better future.

Two years ago Demetria opened a grocery store, and it's one of the busiest in her community.  Thanks to her kind customer service she is preferred by her customers, who don't hesitate to begin their shopping very early in the day.  She likes her job because thanks to visits from her neighbors she always has an income.

Demetria will invest her loan in buying the provisions she needs for her store.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll stock up with a sack of rice and beverages, among other things.

This is her second loan.  She's grateful for the trust given her because that way she'll continue with her business.  She's also happy to be part of her communal bank because she works with dynamic and committed members.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, beverages, and other products

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is 37 years old and a married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She aspires to the development of her farming business because she wants to offer a good standard of living to her family. She cultivates rice on a few pieces of farmland she received as her inheritance from her ancestors. She is thankful for her business that allows her to manage daily commodities and food allowances which are quickly consumed. She is married to her a noble man who is currently engaged in construction business. Together, they have given birth to a small kid.

Chim’s husband would like to work in the neighboring country in order to raise more income and upgrade their quality of life. He realized that he could get a higher payment if he goes and works there. Due to the shortage of funds, Chim is requesting a loan in the amount of 350 USD, which will be used by her husband to pay for a passport and other documents & fees. They hope to secure the overall welfare of the family and someday experience financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and other documents & fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 4 liters of rice, 4 liters of coconut milk, fish and meat

loans.name: Agostin

texts.en:
Agustin is 46 years old and married with three children, all of whom attend public school. He lives in northern Albania. His family members, unlike some other residents in the same location, are happy living here. Agustin is known by locals for his hard work, personable nature and excellent skills at what he does for a living. 

Agustin loves his job and has been successful at it. Yet, at times, he feels frustrated that he doesn’t have the building materials and other necessary tools to do the job. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy building materials and most importantly a concrete mixer.

Being the only financial provider at home makes Agustin a proud father. At the same time, he is solely responsible for the family's living conditions and nutrition. Agustin promises that he will pay back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a concrete mixer and other building materials for his business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр  - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием винограда и клубники.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания винограда на небольшой территории.
Александр приобрел саженцы винограда, капельное орошение для полива и мотоблок для вспашки земли, тем самым облегчая ручной труд.
В планах на будущие:  покупка трактора с навесным оборудованием для обработки и вспашки земельного участка, а также установка теплицы для винограда и клубники.
В личных планах: завершение строительства частного дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока и системы капельного орошения.
texts.en: Alexander is a farmer. Since 2010, he has been growing grapes and strawberries. To deal with household chores, he helps his wife. His work began with growing grapes on a small amount of territory. Alexander purchased grapes, drip irrigation for irrigation and a motorized cultivator for tilling the land, thereby making it easier for manual labor. His plans for the future: buying tractors with mounted equipment for processing and plowing the land, as well as the installation of greenhouses for grapes and strawberries. His personal plans: completion of the construction of his private house. He needs your help to finance the motorized equipment and a drip irrigation system.

loans.use: To purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Responsable y activo, así es el señor Dionisio de 43 años de edad; gracias a su empeño cotidiano obtuvo su propia casa, donde habita con su esposa Irene de 40 años y con sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro, mas adelante. Dionisio es un hombre de lucro; se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para “niños, jóvenes y adultos”. Esta labor lo ejerce en su comunidad hace 6 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa; gracias a su amabilidad y dinamismo, los pobladores de su comunidad siempre acuden a su puesto venta, esperando comprar sus prendas. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es ser admirado por la gente de su pueblo, ya que es un hombre que le gusta salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se interponen en su camino; comenta que desde que empezó a obtener créditos en MFP, le ha ido muy bien en su trabajo, ya que no le falta mercadería en su puesto de ventas, es por ello que ahora con el préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para continuar con su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 09; una vez más agradece por la confianza que le brindan, ya que gracias a los financieros logra seguir con su trabajo. Por otro lado agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por darles la confianza de trabajar con socios íntegros. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de  prendas de vestir para incrementar en su puesto.
texts.en:
43 year-old Dionisio is an active and responsible man. Thanks to his daily working he obtained his own home, where he lives with his Irene, 40, and his three dear children, for whom he hopes to provide a good future. Dionisio is a man motivated by profit. He works selling garments for "children, young adults, and adults." He has plied this trade in his community for six years and he can always count on the help of his wife, too. Thanks to his kindness and strong presence, other members of the community always come to him in hopes of purchasing their clothes. What he likes most about his work is being admired by people in his town, seeing as he is a man who likes to strive ahead despite the difficulties that he meets on his path. He adds that every since he began getting credits through MFP, things have gone very well for him because he never lacks inventory in his shop. This is his ninth loan, and once again he is grateful for the confidence this brings him, as the finances will allow him to continue with his work. Moreover he would like to thank the members of his community bank for putting their trust in working with its members.
With the 2,000 nuevos soles he will restock his invenotry with new garments.

loans.use: to purchase more garments.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
The Al-njom group consists of five women  who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group took out a loan of 155,000 YER.

Aisha is 42 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is married and has adult children. Aisha is a housewife and has a small house. She requires a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a TV. She hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her house

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 48 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his wife Natia. The family sows greens in the open ground and sells them in an open market in Kutaisi, a neighboring town.  In addition, Hamlet owns a milk cow and produces cheese products. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is what Hamlet earns working as an artisan in the village.  Hamlet requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programs extend to the country rural poor business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions.  These families do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Hamlet will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and construct it. Hamlet will sow different kinds of greens and tomatoes to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Hamlet awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Dar-Alhaid Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dar-Alhaid which comprises of five ladies. They applied for a loan of 190,000 Yemen rials (YER).
 
Sabah lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is 39 years old, is married and has three children. She has worked in embroidery for many years. She is so professional in this field that her goods are required in the market. She started her business with a small amount of capital.

Sabah is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy embroidery threads. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand to other towns to supply embroidered ladies' fabrics.
