She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the support she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to continue selling merchandise in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: A

texts.en: A is 40 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, A is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland to expand her farming business. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house in order to provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.name: Vicenta Dolores

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad, la mayor estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo comerciante.

Ella con la intención de ayudar a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta  de adornos y cerámicas,  viaja cada ocho días con todos sus productos a varias ciudades de la sierra lugares donde tiene muchos clientes a quienes entrega sus productos, lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta clase de negocio y es así como ha sacado adelante a su familia. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para que su esposo venda. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede  ayudar a su esposo.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en su casa para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer communal bank gets together every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. This place is well-known both in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; one can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals using the traditional customs.

This is where Vicenta lives. She is a 37-year-old married mother of two, ages 20 and 15. The oldest is attending the university while the youngest is still in school. Vicenta's husband is a small business owner.

With the intention of helping her husband, she is requesting this loan to use it in his business. He buys and sells home decor and ceramics for a living. Every week, he travels to various mountain towns, where he has many customers, to sell his products. He has been in business for over 20 years, and thus, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He buys his products from artisans in the area.

Vicenta will use this loan to purchase various types of handicrafts so that her husband can sell them. She has been with the bank for 4 years, and she likes it because she is able to help out her husband with these loans.

Her dream is to open up a shop in her home to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Virginia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  de 7 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, mientras ella  recorre la ciudad el esposo se desplaza a otras ciudades donde vende su mercadería, venden a  crédito a sus clientes  y cobran cada ocho o quince días. Su mercadería  la van a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días y a veces hasta por semana cuando tienen muchas ventas, llevan más de 10 años dedicados al comercio y les va bastante bien, esta es la forma que ellos tienen de ganarse la vida honradamente.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 5  años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un pequeño almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Lucha” (Women of Struggle) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Virginia, 25, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 7 and 5 years old; both attend school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She and her husband sell all types of clothes door to door.  While she goes throughout their city, her husband heads out to other cities to sell their merchandise.  They sell on credit and collect payments weekly or biweekly.  They go to Guayaquil to buy merchandise every two weeks or sometimes even once a week when their sales are good.  They’ve been merchants for ten years and they do quite well; this is how they earn their livelihood honorably.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than five years and likes it because of the support she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to have a small store downtown.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Gema Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3  y 2 años de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo el cual se dedica al comercio, él vende accesorios para carros para lo cual se desplaza por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, él lleva más de 6 años con este tipo de negocio y a pesar de todo le va bien.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar accesorios y refacciones para carros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ayudarle a su esposo.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive donde unos familiares del marido.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Lucha” (Women of Struggle) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Gema, 19, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 3 and 2 years old. Her husband is a merchant.

She’s taking out this loan to help her husband who is a merchant.  He sells accessories for cars from place to place throughout the city.  He’s been in this type of business more than six years and despite everything does well.

The loan will be used to buy accessories and spare parts for cars.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because the loans make it possible for her to help her husband.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because they currently live with some of her husband’s relatives.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Sector Los Olivos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector los Olivos está conformado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes son familia y vecinos, viven por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador de la ciudad ya que desde allí se observa gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas amables como nuestras socias quienes dan cada día hacen su mejor esfuerzo en sus trabajos para sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen viva la llama de su cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nancy, este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Sector los Olivos, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 9, 8, 5, 3 y 1 año de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios en una constructora, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad construida en unión conyugal.

Doña Nancy labora hace 3 años en una guardería, ahí labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a viernes, en su casa cría cerdos, cuyes y patos a los que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.

En la foto esta en Señor con camiseta azul que es pariente de una de las socias pero él no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sector Los Olivos” consists of nine members (eight women and one man) who are either relatives or neighbors. They live in a community that is in the parish of Turi in the city of Cuenca. This parish is known as the balcony of the city since it provides one with the vantage point of seeing a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people who live here engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. These friendly people, including the members of this group, strive to give their best efforts in their work each so that their families can get ahead. They have also maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Nancy, who is receiving her fourth loan from the “Sector Los Olivos” Communal Bank. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children (ages 9, 8, 5, 3, and 1). Her three oldest children attend a school in town. Her husband works as a driver for a construction company. They own their house and built it themselves.

Doña Nancy works at a nursery school Monday through Friday from 7 A.M. to 3 P.M. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and ducks at home and then sells the animals in her community. Nancy also engages in farming and the products she harvests are designated for household consumption. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to complete her house since it currently lacks a few finishing touches.

In the photo, the gentleman wearing a blue and black shirt is a relative of one of the members, so he is not part of this group.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth Alejandrina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos dos mayores de edad y tres de 16, 15 y 9 años, los tres menores estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. Ella a pesar de su edad está estudiando  el último año del colegio. 

Doña Elizabeth y su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden artículos para el hogar como ollas, platos, cucharas y ropa de todo tipo, ella vende por su localidad y el esposo se desplaza a campos cercanos ofreciendo sus productos ya que es en esos lugares donde tiene sus mejores clientes, ellos dejan a crédito y cobran cada quince días, llevan más de 14 años dedicados a esta profesión la cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ollas, cucharas, planchas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio y los créditos le permiten ayudar a su esposo. 

Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Lucha” (Women of Struggle) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Elizabeth, 42, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children, two adults and three who are 16, 15 and 9 years old.  The three younger ones attend school; two go to secondary and the youngest is in elementary school.  All her children still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  Despite her age, she’s completing the last year of high school.

Elizabeth and her husband are merchants.  They sell household items like pots, dishes, spoons and all types of clothes.  She sells around her neighborhood and her husband heads out to the nearby countryside to sell their products since that’s where their best customers are.  They sell on credit and collect payments biweekly.  They’ve been in this profession that makes it possible for them to get ahead more than 14 years.

This loan will be used to buy pots, spoons, irons and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because she started her business with the first loan and she’s able to help her husband with the loans.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy pots, spoons, irons and clothes.

loans.name: Savas

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Savas is a 49-year-old mother of five children. Three of her children are living with her. Two of them attend school and the other is a paid worker. 

For her children's sake, Savas has been producing Khmer noodles for resale for six years. The current business earns her about 12,000 KHR a day, of which she manages to save about 6,000 KHR for future needs. Lack of working capital to support the current operations is her main challenge.

Savas is in her second-cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely paid back the first loan, which has enabled her to have enough material to support her business. 

She is now applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy rice to produce Khmer noodles and a portion of it will also be used to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income in order to expand her current business, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce Khmer noodles and to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak is a 37-year-old married mother who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse and has been blessed with two children who are currently enrolling to go to school. Hak pursues a rice farming business to produce the major income for the family. She aspires to achieve financial stability in life and to educate her two children up to a good college. Her dreams inspire her to work hard and have patience in everything she does. Her spouse works as a construction worker to earn more revenue to feed the family as well. 

At the moment, Hak would like to obtain a loan, which she will use to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers to put on her rice crops. She believes that this loan would help her maintain and improve her farming business. As she is operating the business, she hopes to gradually develop it towards achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers to put on her rice crops.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is 54 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs and poultry for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $9 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Phorn is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase fodder to feed her pigs. In addition, a part of this money is used for purchasing fertilizer and seeds to use for farming. This money will help improve her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to raise more pigs and build a new house as soon as possible. Moreover, she wants her daughter to be a fashion designer.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to feed her pigs and to purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Nancy Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela, actualmente está en su octavo mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  de adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas y por lo general pasan comprando algo todos los días, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados y luego les da el acabado necesario para que estén listos para la venta.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su  negocio.
texts.en:
The “Para el Futuro De la Mujer” meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

Nancy lives here.  She’s 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 9 and 6.  Both attend school.  She is in her eighth month of pregnancy.  Her husband is an artist.

She became a merchant in order to help herself and her husband.  She buys and sells decorations and ceramics and has a shop on a main road, where many people pass and buy things from her daily.  She sells all types of arts and crafts and works from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  She’s been doing this for eight years and buys her merchandise from local artists within the zone.  She buys partially completed crafts and then puts the finishing touches on them to get them ready to sell.
 
She needs this loan in order to buy more artifacts of all types to stock her business.  She’s been with the communal bank for two years and she likes that the loans help her business.

Her dream is to continue ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy arts and crafts.

loans.name: Angela Monserrate

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional,  se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

Aquí vive la señora Ángela. tiene 42 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que le dan dentro del grupo.

Ella para ayudar a sus padres y también para generar sus propios ingresos hace siete años decidió poner un negocio y es así como surtió una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco, le gusta tener de todo para que sus clientes no busque en otro lugar lo que ella puede ofrecer, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00,  le encanta su negocio ya que allí se entretiene y se gana el sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 4 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer communal bank gets together every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. This place is well-known both in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; one can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals using the traditional customs.

This is where Angela lives. She is a 42-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She has been with the bank for four years, and she likes it because of how easy it is to obtain a loan, and because of the help that she gets within her group.

In order to help out her parents and to generate her own income, she decided to launch her own business seven years ago, setting up a small general store in her house. In this store, she sells a little bit of everything so that her customers do not have to shop anywhere else to find what they are looking for. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She loves her business because she amuses herself with it and because it is how she earns a living day by day.

She will use this loan in order to stock up on products for her store. She is going to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, cold meats, and other products. She has been with the bank for over four years, and she likes it because she has made friends within the group.

Her goal is to continue with her business and help it grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, cold meats, and other goods.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Cumbre Group

texts.es:
La señora Olga Marina es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó el sexto años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios de casa como al comercio, lleva 9 años de experiencia de ser comerciante iniciando su negocio con poco capital y la ayuda de su esposo. 

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de ropa de diferentes clases: chumpas, sudaderos, playeras, camisas, lencería, bufandas, suéteres para damas y otros más. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y surtido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, tienda de consumo diario, venta de helados y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Olga Marina, 31, is married.  She completed sixth grade.  She has three children two of which are attending school.  She does housework and is a merchant.  She has nine years’ experience as a merchant having started her business with little capital and with her husband’s help.

She organizes a group to request a loan to buy different kinds of clothes: sweaters, sweatshirts, t-shirts, shirts, lingerie, scarves, women’s sweaters and others.  She hopes in future to have a large, well-stocked business.  

The other group members are merchants, grocers, ice-cream merchants and raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Auxiliadora es casada, trabaja junto a su esposo en la finca que esta ubicada a 6 Kilometros de la Ciudad, ahi vive con sus hijos y su esposo, los cuales le ayudan con las labores del campo.  Esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de sembrar yuca, lo cual le permite obtener ingresos para el sustento familiar y ademas para la alimentacion de la familia.  Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar y establecer mejor su finca, ya que es el patrimonio de su familia y con el cual pueden seguir trabajando para subsistir.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is married.  She works alongside her husband in the farm located six kilometers from the city.  She lives there with her children and husband who help her with the work in the fields.  She’s requesting her first loan to plant cassava root that will make it possible for her to earn income to support her family and also for their own consumption.  Her greatest dream is to consolidate and better establish her farm which is her family’s only asset so that they can continue working it to subsist.

loans.use: to plant cassava root.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret lives in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He is 46 years old and married. He has four children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To support the family, he has been farming paddy rice on one hectare of farmland for ten years and growing corn on three hectares of farmland. He is able to earn about KHR 23,000 per day and save about KH 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his business.

Saret has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles already. He fully repaid back the past loans which have helped him to better support his children’s education and feed the family with sufficient food. Now he is requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR 4,000,000. With this loan, he is going to buy seeds and pesticides for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on a plowing fee for his field. He expects to grow his cash-crop on time so he can save some money for expanding his business: buying a mini-tractor, cows and an additional plot of farmland. In this way, he can upgrade his lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides for his farmland and to pay a plowing fee for his field.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Yovina, who is in her early 40's, is married with four children who go to school. She has had a clothes-selling business (vitenge (fabric) and kanga (sarongs)) for four years now. She is doing great. She works from 9am to 2pm daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy vitenge (fabric), kanga (sarongs), to cover school fees and household expenses, and she has paid back all of her loans successfully. She would like a loan to buy more vitenge (fabric), kanga (sarongs),water, and juices to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Bega kwa Bega" which totals 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vitenge (fabric), kanga (sarongs),water, and juices to resell.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахрому 49 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 5  детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 21 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается пчеловодством и продает мед на местном рынке. Он один справляется с бизнесом. Бахром очень любит свою работу и старается заработать достаточные деньги для обеспечения семьи. Он хочет расширить оборотный капитал и для этого он запрашивает займ для покупки меда для продажи. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условия пчеловодства. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahrom is 49 years old, married, and he is raising five children.  

He is a very hardworking man who has more than 21 years of experience in his business.  He works as a beekeeper and sells honey at the local market.

Bahrom manages his business alone.  He loves his job and tries to make enough money to provide for his family.  

As he would like to expand his working capital, he is requesting a loan to buy some honey for resale.  

He plans to use his earnings to upgrade his beekeeping business.  He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy honey to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años la cual inicio con dos pequeños estantes de madera y poco a poco empezó a comprar productos y mejorar las condiciones enverjado todo en forma de L,  le puso hierro y maya. 

Ella con el primer crédito pago una deuda que tenía porque sirvió de fiadora y la persona  quedó mal. Con este crédito comprara vitrinas para que se mire mejor los productos.
texts.en:
María’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had a grocery store for the last four years that she started with just two small wood shelves and gradually started buying products and improving its conditions enclosing it with metal grilles in an L shape; she installed iron grilles and mesh.  

She used her first loan to pay off a loan she had because she had been the cosigner and the other person defaulted.  She will use this loan to buy display cases so her products will look better

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Santa Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Fe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Darling Fabiola de 21 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes desde hace 3 años la cual inicio vendiendo pequeñas cosas.

La otras integrantes son Rene quien tiene un mini cyber desde hace 4 años y Susana quien vende productos AVON
texts.en:
The Santa Fe group has three enterprising, hardworking members.   One of them is Darling Fabiola, 21, who has been selling clothes and perfume for the last three years; she started out selling small things.

The other members are René who has had a cybercafé for the last four years and Susana who sells AVON products.

loans.use: to buy assorted new clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buena Vista está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Meyling del Socorro quien se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada desde ropa, zapatos y prendas desde hace 7 años.
Las otras integrantes son Brenda quien vende cosméticos y ropa; y María quien vende granos básicos y ropa.
texts.en:
The Buena Vista group is comprised of three hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Mayling del Socorro who has been selling assorted merchandise like clothes, shoes and articles for the last seven years.  

The other group members are Brenda who sells cosmetics and clothes and María who sells basic grains and clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and gold and silver items.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 18, 9 y 7 años de edad, las dos mayores ya están comprometidas y los menores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella para valerse por sí misma y con esto ayudar con  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  de adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas que a diario compran en su local, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, sus hijos le ayudan en sus ventas y pintando las cerámicas ya que las compran a artesanos de la zona pero sin pintar para luego ellos le dan el terminado adecuado para venderlos muy bien. Lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos y pinturas para darles el terminado a sus objetos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio hace muchos años. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Para el Futuro De la Mujer communal bank gets together every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi. This place is well-known both in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; one can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the locals using the traditional customs.

This is where Mariana lives. She is a 37-year-old married mother of four, ages 22, 18, 9, and 7. The two eldest are engaged to be married while the two youngest are in school. Mariana's husband is a public employee.

In order to earn a living and to help with the household expenses, Mariana is a small business owner; she buys and sells home decor and ceramics. She has a business space on a main street where many people frequent and buy her products daily. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Her children help her with sales and with painting the ceramics because she buys the unfinished products from local artisans, and she and her children then finish them up in order to sell them. She has been in this business for 15 years and has been prosperous.

Mariana will use this loan to purchase different types of handicrafts and paint to give them the finishing touches. She has been with the bank since its beginnings, and she likes it because she was able to launch her business with one of their loans many years ago.

Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts and paint.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marlon Antonio es soltero, trabaja en la finca junto a su familia, se dedica a la Agricultura desde que era pequeño, le gusta aprovechar la tierra y sembrar para el consumo familiar y para vender, percibe otro Ingreso como Zapatero aparte de dedicarse al campo, en este momento solicita financiamiento para cultivar yuca y asi tener la oportunidad de tener ingresos extras para su familia.
texts.en: Marlon Antonio is single and works on the farm with his family. He's worked in agriculture ever since he was a child. He likes to make good use of the land and plant for his family's consumption and also for selling. He has another source of income as a shoemaker, apart from farming. He currently requests a loan in order to sow yucca and therefore have the opportunity to obtain additional earnings for his family.

loans.use: to sow yucca.

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 69 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 11 hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, mientras ella vende en su casa frutas como naranjas y guineos, el esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado central,  ellos muy de mañanita salen al mercado de mayoristas a comprar productos para la venta  y  después de esto ella le ayuda a su marido a instalar su puesto en el mercado para luego ir a su local que está ubicado en su casa donde vende sus frutas.  Su esposo lleva más de 35 años con este negocio y ella recién hace 5 años puso su negocito en el cual se gana algo por su cuenta.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio y el de su marido. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres bien surtida.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Mujeres De Lucha meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza, in the city of Portoviejo. The place is known for being a shopping area, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people. 

It's in this place where Teresa lives, who is 69 years old and has a a common-law relationship. From this relationship she has 11 children, all of them adults, one of them still living with her. Her husband is a businessman.

She and her husband are engaged in commerce, while she is selling fruits such as oranges and bananas at her home, her husband is selling fruits and vegetables in the central market. Very early in the morning, they go to the wholesale market to buy products to sale and after that she helps her husband to set up his stall in the market. Then, she goes to her working place which is located at her home, where she sells fruits. Her husband has more than 35 years with this business. She just started her small business five years ago, so she can earn something on her own.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables for her business and her husband's. She has been in the Communal Bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercedes Violeta

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora Mercedes, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, todos sus hijos aun vive con ella con sus respectivas familias. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00,  lo que más vende son los centros de mesa y adornos para el hogar.  Lleva 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados y ella luego ella los pinta y da el toque final para que estén listos para la venta.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido ir agrandando y surtiendo más su local. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” (The Water Basin) communal bank meets in La Pila in Montecristi Canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for being a place rich in tradition.  A great variety of crafts that are made by the inhabitants following traditional customs can be found here.  

Mercedes, 51, is married and has four children who are all adults now; all still live with her with their respective families.  Her husband is a driver.

She sells decorations and ceramics.  She has a locale at home where she sells all types of crafts every day from 8am until 5pm.  What she sells most are table center pieces and home decorations.  She’s been doing this for 11 years and has done very well.  She buys her products semi-finished from local artisans and then she paints them and gives them the final touches so that they’ll be ready to be put on sale.

This loan is to buy all types and styles of crafts to stock her business.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because the loans have made it possible for her to gradually enlarge and better-stock her store.  Her dream is to continue growing with her business.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
El grupo las originales lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellos es Horacio de 50 años quien se dedica a la producción de calzado artesanal. El empezó trabajando en los talleres luego con la liquidación puso un pequeño taller en 1990 en cual ha ido invirtiendo y mejorando. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales cuero, cuerina, pega…etc.

Las otras integrantes son Darling quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace más de 3 años cuando en la calle una promotora de esta empresa le dijo que se afiliara; y Dayluvy quien tiene una venta desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The “Las Originales” (The Original Ones) group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Horacio, 50, who manufactures artisanal footwear.  He started as an employee in workshops and then used his severance pay to start a small workshop in 1990 that he’s been investing in and improving.  He will use the loan to buy materials like leather, faux leather, glue, etc.

The other members are Darling who has been selling cosmetics for more than three years when she met one of the firm’s promoters in the street and she told her to join and Dayluvy who has been in sales for two years.

loans.use: to buy leather, faux leather and glue.

loans.name: Yosinjon

texts.ru: Юсуфджону 39 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 21 лет назад он начал свой бизнес с изготовлением лепешки. Он производит 260-380 лепешки в день. Его жена и сын помогают ему в изготовлении лепешки. Он 3 цикл кредитуется в нашей организации и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони  для покупки муки для изготовления лепешки. С полученного дохода он планирует отремонтировать свой цех. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем держать свой стимул среди бизнесменов.
texts.en:
Yosinjon is 39 years old, married, and raising one son.  In order to support his family and provide them with all the necessities, he started his own bakery business 21 years ago.  He now produces between 260 and 380 round cakes per day.  His wife and son help him with his baking business.

This is Yosinjon's third loan cycle with our organization, and he has a good credit history.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni for the purchase of flour to bake round cakes.  He plans to use his earnings to renovate his shop.

Yosinjon is relying on your kindness.  Let's help him to boost his business!

loans.use: to buy flour for baking.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Mayra ingreso a la banco comunal por invitación de su hermana y ahora se encuentra en el segundo crédito, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y  aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Mayra tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 5 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado en un puesto de venta de mariscos, la casa en la que viven es de propiedad conyugal. 

Doña Mayra cuida de su hogar  y como pasa en casa puede dedicarse a la crianza de animales como: borregos, gallinas, cuyes y cerdos,  también siembra hortalizas en sus terrenos las mismas que luego las vende. Ella aprendió de su mamá a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla, todas estas actividades le permiten ayudar a la solvencia económica de su hogar.
  
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es  tener un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad para vender sus hortalizas.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra joined the Communal Bank after receiving an invitation from her sister and is now receiving her second loan. She lives in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its cold climate and its warm-hearted people who have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Mayra is 24 years old, married, and has a five-year-old daughter. Her husband is employed at a seafood stand. They own the house in which they live.

Doña Mayra takes care of their home and also spends time raising animals such as sheep, chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She also plants vegetables on her land and then sells them later. Mayra learned from her mother how to make woven straw hats. All of these business activities enable her to contribute toward the household expenses. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, compost, and feed for her animals.

Mayra’s goal is to have her own vending stall at the city market where she can sell her vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and animal feed.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina es profesora desde hace mas de 8 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres. Con esta solicitud desea realizar la compra de un solar en el cual pretende en el futuro hacer su casa es por eso que seguira trabajando con financiamientos para cumplir este sueño. Como persona desea seguir trabajando y esforzandose para alcanzar otras metas, ofrecerle a su hijo estabilidad y comodidad. Desea tener una casa con buenas condiciones y comodidades y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Adelina has been a teacher for more than 8 years.  She’s a single mother; she has a four-year-old son.  She gets support from her parents.  She wants to use this loan request to buy a vacant lot to build her house on in the future.  She plans to continue working with loans to make this dream reality.  As a person, she wants to continue working and striving to reach other goals and to offer stability and comfort to her son.  She wants to have a house that’s comfortable and in good condition in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a vacant lot.

loans.name: Nelly Magaly

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora Nelly, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella para salir adelante y con sus ganancias ayudar a su esposo se dedica al comercio,    vende ropa de todos tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, de tres a cuatro veces por semana visita a sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, la mercadería la va a comprar una vez al mes a la ciudad de Guayaquil o  cada vez que necesite, lleva 5 años con este negocio  el mismo que  lo empezó con el primer  crédito que recibió del banco y poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando con los créditos posteriores.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace más de 5 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "La Pila," meets every two weeks in La Pila, Montecristi Canton. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich cultural tradition where one can find a variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following traditional customs.

Nelly is 38 years old, married and has two children who are 10 and 3 years old.  The older one is in elementary school.  Her husband is a driver.

To get ahead and help her husband with their earnings, she is a vendor, selling all kinds of clothing door to door.  Three to four times a week she visits clients, leaving items on credit and collecting weekly.  She buys merchandise once a month in the city of Guayaquil or whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for 5 years, at the same time that she started with her first loan from the bank. She has gradually been increasing her credit with subsequent loans.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, shirts, and other apparel.  She has been a founding member of the communal bank for over five years and likes it because she started her business with the first loan.
 
Nelly's dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo Juan de 37 años, en la casa que compraron juntos gracias a su trabajo. Los productos que con tanto voluntad y entrega ha logrado cultivar Feliciana y Juan, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Esta actividad lo efectúan hace 14 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que le ayuden en la cosecha y desyerbo de sus plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas. Gracias a estas plantas ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que en la venta de su cosecha los centros de acopio le pagan buenas ganancias por la buena obtención que tiene.
 Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos; sin embargo su dificultad es transportar sus sacos pesados desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ya que se ubica a una hora desde su parcela. Ella seguirá con su trabajo normalmente pero lo que prioriza es terminar la construcción de su vivienda, ya que lo esta elaborando a base de material noble. Este es su crédito número 04, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles más sus ganancias realizará la compra de ladrillos y cemento.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 38, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband Juan, 37, in the house they bought together thanks to their work. The products which Feliciana and Juan have been able to cultivate with much will and enthusiasm have helped them very much in making progress in their lives.

They have been doing cultivation for 14 years and they always rely on the support of laborers who help them with the harvest and weeding of the cacao, coffee and citrus fruit plants.

Thanks to these plants, she has been able to improve her quality of life, since in selling her crops to the distribution centers she makes good earnings because of her good collection.

What she most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them large and leafy. However, her challenge is transporting the heavy sacks from the farm to the distribution centers since they are located an hour from her plot of land.

She will continue to work normally but her priority is to finish the construction of her home, since she is building it from quality construction materials.

This is her fourth loan. She knows she has to make all her payments punctually and she is willing to do so. In her community bank, she is a very supportive and responsible partner. With the loan of 1,500 nuevos soles plus her earnings she will be able to buy bricks and cement.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Esterling Yasari

texts.es: La Sra.Esterling se desempeña como Profesora En Escuela Horacio Aguilar con mas de 10 años de impartir clases, su esposo es conductor y le la apoya incondicionalmente con los gastos del hogar y gestiones crediticias, tienen un hijo el cual pretenden sacarlo adelante. Con el actual financiamiento, cumplira una de sus metas, cambiarle el techo a su vivienda ya que con el invierno tendria poblemas.  Seguira trabajando con financiamientos para mejorar la calidad de vida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Esterling works as a teacher in Escuela Horacio Aguilar and has been giving classes for more than 10 years. Her husband is a driver and supports her unconditionally both with household expenses and in managing their credit. They have a son they are trying to help get ahead. With the current funding, she will meet one of her goals, that of replacing the roof on her dwelling because if they did not,  they would have problems in the winter.

Esterling will continue working with loans in order to improve her quality of life and to get ahead, along with her family.

loans.use: to replace the roof on her home.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario, de 34 años de edad, esta casado con Avelina de 28 años y fruto de ellos, tienen cuatro hijos; juntos residen en su propia casa a base de madera. Hilario, cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, cacao, piña y frutales; esta labor lleva realizando hace 21 años. En tiempos de cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Para él su trabajo es muy importante, ya que las ganancias de sus cosechas le ayudan a solventar con los gastos de su hogar.
Con el crédito obtenido comprará cemento para lograr culminar su casa a base material noble; sin embargo comenta que no dejará la agricultura, por lo que gracias a ello van mejorando su calidad de vida; asimismo agradece a los financieros, por el apoyo que le brindan, ya que su préstamo logrará mejora su vivienda. Este es su crédito número 07, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su hogar, a la vez agradece a los financistas por su confianza. En su banco comunal es un hombre que aporta ideas para el progreso de su grupo comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de ladrillo para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Hilario is 34 years old and is married to Avelina, who is 28 years old.  They have four children together and live in their own home made of wood. Hilario has 2 hectares of land planted with coffee plants, cacao, pineapple and fruit trees.  He has been doing this work for 21 years. At harvest time he always has the support of laborers, so that there can be more rapid progress in the extraction and selection of his product. For him, his work is very important, since profits from his crops will help pay the cost of his home.

With the requested loan, he will buy cement to build his house with a quality base.  But he says that he will not leave agriculture, so that he can improve  their quality of life.  He is also thankful for the lenders and the support they provide because his loan will help him improve his home.

This is his 7th loan and knows that the money will be very useful in the progress of his home.  At the same time he thanks the lenders financiers for their confidence. In his communal bank, he is the man who brings ideas to help progress his community group.

With the 1,000 soles he will purchase brick for construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Ana Jacoba

texts.es: Ana Jacoba, mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es conserje en un colegio de Masaya. Ella invertirá el crédito en mejoras de vivienda, ya que necesita cambiar el techo de su hogar.
texts.en: Ana Jacoba is a hardworking woman who is a custodian in a school in Masaya. She will invest her loan in improvements on her home because she needs to replace the roof.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets.

loans.name: Granito De Mostaza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Esther es la que esta levantando la mano, ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja cuidando a un anciano ella trabaja en un casa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia siempre ha trabajado cuidando niños y ancianos a ella le gusta este trabajo por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar a los estudios de colegio de su hijo.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque llego un poco mas tarde porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de herramientas, negocio de transporte y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Little Mustard Seed) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Esther, who has her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old, single, and has one child. Esther works by taking care of elderly people in their home. Her work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has always worked by caring for children and elderly people. Esther enjoys the work since it has enabled her to help her children move forward. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to pay for her son’s high school studies.

The member who is pictured in the smaller photo arrived much later because he received permission for work reasons.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling handicrafts, selling tools, providing transportation, and managing a restaurant.

Esther is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to pay for her son's high school studies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 33 años de edad, 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales y venta de fajas ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada día ,la socia trabaja de forma independiente y a pedido a quienes le solicitan como amistades y clientes en general, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería de productos naturales para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Fuente de Vida. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

The member is 33 years old, has three children and has a life-partner. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling natural products and selling belts. She enjoys her work which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day. She works independently and takes orders when asked to by friends and clients in general. She is a trustworthy and diligent person being that this is the way she supports her family.

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise of natural products for her business. 

She is grateful for the granted credit and she promises to complete her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business working independently and through orders

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA,el banco esta situado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamente de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años ,02 hijos y es conviviente,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros,la socia vende de forma independiente a sus amistades y clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como perfumes para su negocio.

La socia se siente contenta por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) communal bank located in Cusco District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s 32-years-old and has two children.  She has a live-in spouse.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling beauty products like creams, perfume and cologne, among others.  She sells independently among her friends and customers who request it.  She’s a responsible, enterprising person who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy merchandise like perfume for her business.  She is happy about the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like perfume.

loans.name: Fabiola Isabel

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Fabiola, casada y madre de 1 niño, se dedica  al cambio de moneda en la modalidad de compra y venta de moneda nacional y extrangera, en un stand que está ubicado en un centro comercial de la ciudad y que funciona como casa de cambio de moneda.
Fabiola solicita el préstamo  para inyectar efectivo en su negocio de compra y venta de moneda extranjera y nacional, por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento y crecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle procurarle una mejor educación a su hijo el cual aun es pequeño. Fabiola pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Fabiola is married and the mother of one child.  She works in currency exchange; she buys and sells foreign currency in a stand located in a shopping center in the city that functions as a currency exchange house.  Fabiola requests the loan to inject cash into her business buying and selling foreign and national currency which is why she’s very grateful to Kiva for helping her to strengthen and expand her activity to be able to provide her son who is still small with a better education.  Fabiola belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to invest cash into her currency exchange business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 39 años de edad, 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatillas, la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que más le solicitan ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, cada cierto tiempo a la socia le mandan su mercaderia desde la ciudad de Tacna para que luego la socia lo distribuya a sus clientes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas para mujer.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.   She belongs to the “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) communal bank located in Cusco District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s 39-years-old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling slippers.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  Every so often merchandise is sent to her from the city of Tacna and then she sells it to her customers.  She’s a responsible, enterprising person who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy women’s slippers.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her scheduled installment payments.

loans.use: to buy women's slippers.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI ,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de carne ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco ,ella trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 05:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de carne de res para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Comuzone 1" communal bank. She is continuing with her meat-selling business. She has been in this business for some time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. 

She sells in one of the markets in the city of Cuzco, and works from 6:00am to 5:00pm approximately.

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, as this is how she is helping her family get ahead in life.

She is requesting the loan to buy beef for her business.

She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted, and promises to pay her scheduled installments.

loans.use: To buy beef for her business.

loans.name: Ivonne Liseth

texts.es: Doña Ivonne a sus 45 años de edad vende productos de repostería como pasteles y churros en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de la capital, su esposo le ayuda a hacerlos y a venderlos, juntos  procrearon 3 hijos que estudian y trabajan quienes desean que sus hijos se superen y tenga una buena calidad de vida. Ivonne está optando en trabajar con préstamos financiados a corto y largo plazo para salir adelante con su familia e ir cambiando la infraestructura de su casa con el pasar del tiempo; desea el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como arena, bloques, piedrines, cemento, hierro para poder construir un cuarto en su vivienda y así tener mejores condiciones para su familia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Ivonne, 45, sells bakery goods such as cakes and fritters from her home, located in a neighborhood in the capital. Her husband helps her make them and sell them. Together they have three children who study and work. They want their children to succeed and have a good quality of life.

Ivonne has chosen to work with short and long term loans in order to get ahead with her family and begin upgrading the infrastructure of her house over time. She wants the loan to purchase construction materials, such as sand, slabs, gravel, cement and iron in order to build a room on her house and thus have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to puchase sand, slabs, gravel, cement, iron and wire.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato de 47 años, es un hombre divorciado, vive en su propia casa y siempre esta al pendiente de sus 06 queridos hijos. Honorato, es un hombre responsable y trabajador; se dedica al cultivo de plantas de cacao, café y piña; cultivos que después de cosecharlos los lleva a los puntos de acopio situados en su localidad y en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en ir al encuentro para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas. Lleva  15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir las plagas que se apoderan de los frutos de cada plantación;  pero aun así él continua con su trabajo. Con el crédito obtenido comprará plantas de piña, ya que son muy rentables en sus ventas. Este es su crédito número 04, por ello agradece a los financistas por apoyarle con el progreso de su trabajo, esperando una vez mas contar con el mismo apoyo y  por ello se compromete trabajar en equipo junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de plantas de piña.
texts.en:
Honorato, 47, is divorced.  He lives in his own house and is always watching over his beloved six children.  Honorato is a responsible, hardworking man.  He grows cocoa bean plants, coffee and pineapples.  Once he harvests these crops he takes them to the local gathering centers where he already has various buyers who buy his products because they are aware of the quality of his goods and they don’t hesitate to meet him and buy all his products.  What he likes best about his work is planting and making his land fertile and productive.  He’s been doing this for 15 years and considers the greatest difficulty to be the pests that take hold of the fruit each season but even so he continues with his work.

He will use the loan obtained to buy pineapple plants because they are very profitable when sold.  This is his fourth loan and he’s grateful to lenders for supporting him with his work’s progress.  He hopes once again to be able to rely on the same level of support and commits to work as a team with his other communal bank members.  He will use the 1,000 new soles to buy pineapple plants.

loans.use: to buy pineapple plants.

loans.name: Huasco

texts.es:
Margarita de 32 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Fredy de 34 años y sus 02 queridos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Margarita trabaja junto a su pareja con mucho esmero, sembrando plantas de café, cacao y piña.; esta labor lo realiza hace 12 años. En los tiempos de cosecha siempre cuentan con el apoyo de jornaleros, para que de esa manera agilicen su cosecha. Después son comercializadas en los centros de acopio, quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo sus frutos y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados a media hora de caminata hasta encontrar una movilidad. 
Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras y seguir cultivando sus plantas; pero por ahora prioriza el acabado de su vivienda. Este es su crédito número 09, y en esta oportunidad espera contar una vez mas con el apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos va mejorando su condición de vida. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de cemento y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Margarita, 32, is a cheerful, hardworking woman living in her own house with her spouse, Fredy, 34 and their two beloved children who are the reasons behind all her efforts.  Margarita works alongside her spouse with much dedication planting coffee, cocoa bean and pineapple plants.  She’s been doing this work for 12 years.  During harvest season they always hire day laborers to help bring in the harvest more quickly and easily.  It’s then sold in the local gathering centers which pay good per kilogram prices.  What she likes best about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruits of her hard work.  What she considers to be most difficult is transporting the crops to the gathering centers; it’s a half-hour walk to the nearest means of transportation.

In time, she hopes to save enough money to buy new land and continue growing plants but for now her priority is finishing her house.  This is her ninth loan and on this occasion she hopes to once again have support from lenders because thanks to them she’s gradually improving her living conditions.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy cement and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Cindy Yohaira

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Cindy, casada y madre de 2 niños en edad escolar, se dedica  a la compra y venta de moneda nacional y extranjera en su stand que funciona como  casa de cambio en un centro comercial de la ciudad.
Cindy está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su actividad  e inyectar efectivo en su casa de cambio, por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento y crecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle procurarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Cindy pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Señora Cindy is married and has two school-aged children.  She makes a living by buying and selling national and foreign curency at her stand that functions as a currency exchange business in a mall in the city.  Cindy is requesting this loan to reinvest and to inject capital into her business.  This is why Cindy is very thankful to Kiva for helping her strengthen and grow her business and for letting her secure a better education for her children.  Cindy belongs to the communal bank, "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to inject capital into her currency exchange business.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng is aged 51 years and resides in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has five children. To earn a living, Eng has been involved in farming rice on a one-hectare plot of farmland. She has been doing this for twenty years, and also raises three pigs to earn extra income. Eng can earn about 21,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Lack of working capital for supporting her current business is her main challenge.

Eng has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She has successfully used the past loan to maintain her buisness on time and sustain her living condition. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, Eng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland, and also use a portion of it to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her business to improve progressively.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 48 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Pov has been involved in growing rice, and fattening pigs and poultry for more than twenty years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $9 daily. Pov is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase cattle, fertilizer and seeds to use for farming. This purchase will help her rice grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, fertilizer and seeds to use for farming

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Srey Mom is 40 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up pigs for more than ten years. She earns approximately 10 USD per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about 5 USD daily. All of her children are employed. They earn about 16 USD each day. Srey Mom is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to purchase more pigs and fodder for feeding them. By doing so, she will earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her piggery and build a fence around her house. Moreover, she wants her daughter to be a fashion designer.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and fodder

loans.name: Thanin's Group

texts.en:
Thanin is 32 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have struggled to feed her children. For the past ten years, they have been farming rice. Her husband also contributes to the family's income by working as a policeman. The current business earns her approximately 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield is still the main challenge for her. 

Thanin has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The other member of her group just joined VisionFund this cycle. Thanin completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her rice paddy. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. Thanin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Serb's Group

texts.en:
Serb is a 25-year-old mother of two children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer on a three-hectare farm to support her family. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low crop yield caused by the drought is the main challenge for her rice-field. 

Serb’s group consists of three female members who have been with VisionFund for six cycles. She completely repaid the past loans, which have improved her family living’s conditions gradually. Now leading her group with VisionFund, Serb will use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy piglets to raise in order to help the family generate more income. She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to increase so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Augusta Renee

texts.es: La socia es la señora Augusta, ella continua con su negocio de bar, pero también esta incursionando en el negocio de casa de cambio de moneda extranjera, actividad que alterna a la del bar para incrementar sus ingresos económicos Augusta está realizando este último trabajo hace poco tiempo y desea que este crezca, para ello  Augusta en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su casa de cambio de moneda e invertir dinero en efectivo, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a hacer crecer y fortalecer esta nueva actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Augusta pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Augusta continues to manage a bar, but she also added a foreign currency exchange business that she operates from her home. She divides her time between both businesses in order to increase her earnings. Augusta started this new business recently and now wants it to grow. For this reason, she is taking this opportunity to request a loan as a way of adding capital to her currency exchange business by supplying cash.

Augusta is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her grow and strengthen her new business. She promises to complete her payments on time. Augusta is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to supply cash for her currency exchange business.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is 50 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children. To cover the daily food expenses for her family, Thoeurn has been engaged in selling grocery items, while her husband grows cassava on two and a half hectares of farmland. Involved in these businesses for ten years, she and her husband are able to earn approximately 30,000KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs.
