Thoeurn has never taken a loan with VisionFund before. Now, she leads a group of two female members (her fellow group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles). Both of them are requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Thoeurn will use her loan portion, along with her savings, to buy a mini-tractor for supporting her husband's business. She hopes this purchase will help her husband to reduce the tranportation fee for shipping cassava to the market, so she can use that money to pay more attention to improving her living conditions instead.

loans.use: To buy a mini-tractor

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara is 33 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening pigs for more than four years while earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $7 per day. Dara is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase more pigs and fodder for feeding. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her piggery and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and fodder for feeding

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Silvia, ella continua con su actividad como supervisora y en publicidad para una empresa de comercializadora de productos de limpieza. Silvia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para pagar la educación de sus hijos, ella invierte todo su trabajo en ellos, para que tengan un mejor futuro, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudara con el porvenir de su familia, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia continues to work as a supervisor in the marketing department of a company that sells cleaning products. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to pay for her children’s education. All of her efforts are invested into her children so that they can have a better future.

Silvia is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her provide for her family’s future. She promises to complete her payments on time. Silvia is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el ciclo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de sombreros, venta de chuño y papa, tejido de manta y macramé, tejido de ajuares de bebe, confección y venta de busos, venta de ropa interior.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera de grupo que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, ella cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, hace varios años, ya que le ayudaba en el negocio anteriormente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa interior) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Patricia ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrellas will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Central Focal de Villa Exaltación. It has eight members and is headed by a board where Juana is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are: selling hats, selling freeze-dried potatoes and potatoes, woven blankets and macramé, knitted outfits for babies, making and selling pullover jackets, and selling underwear.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Juana is a member. She indicates that she became a member of Pro Mujer, joining though the invitation of a fellow member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling underwear. She has had this business for some years that she learned from her aunt whom she used to help in her business before.

The loan that she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy underwear) that she will buy from distributors and later sell on foot at the markets in the city of El Alto. This work allows her to earn money to support her family as much as possible as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she like the discussions about health. 

Patricia is not in the photograph as she had a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy underwear from distributors to sell later in her work as a traveling salesperson in the city markets

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI ,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende lo que son collares,pulseras,aretes hechos en plata,el socio viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Juliaca y al Pais de Bolivia para comprar su mercaderia para de esta forma el socio pueda distribuir su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan como tienda de turismo,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el credito para comprar collares de plata para un pedido que le hicieron uno de sus clientes.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Comuzonei Communal Bank. He continues with his business selling handicrafts. He sells necklaces, bracelets and earrings made of silver. 

The member travels ever so often to the city of Juliaca and to the country of Bolivia to purchase his merchandise so that he can distribute it to customers who request it, such as stores that cater to tourists. 

The member is a responsible and hardworking person since this is the way that he helps his family get ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase silver necklaces to fill an order that one of his clients placed with him.  

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments within the established time table.

loans.use: to purchase silver necklaces to fill an order placed with him by one of his customers.

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Mgeni, who is in his early 40s, is married and has three children who are still going to school. He has been running a business of selling fruits and vegetables since 1989. He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily and has been able to make a fair profit.

This will be his 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to renovate the place where he sells his fruits and vegetables; it looks attractive. He bought more fruits and vegetables, looked after his family's welfare and has paid back all his loans successfully. Mgeni wants a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell. His dream is to one day be able to go up-country and bring rice and beans to sell at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna is a 25-years-old married father of two children. His family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham Province. To make a living, he has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for several years and can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Drought is the main challenge for his paddy-field.

Vanna has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund this cycle only. Vanna fully repaid back the past loan which helped him relieve his family’s burden. Now he is leading his group of two to seek a loan of 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes to plant his rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to upgrade his living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, aged 36, is a diligent farmer who lives with her spouse and some of her children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Sun and her husband work together in a farming and hog-raising business to ensure a better standard of living for their children. Together, they have been in these fields for almost 20 years and have an abundant harvest every season. They are responsible for five children – the oldest one is married, and another child is employed in a phone repair shop in Phnom Penh. 

Sun is now applying for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more piglets and feeds for nourishing them. Her ambition is to own a big pig farm in her village so she can supply pig meat to her area. She hopes to attain her dreams someday as she continuously strives to work harder.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and feed

loans.name: Ratana's Group

texts.en:
Ratana, 23,  is married with one son who is too young for school.  She lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland and supplements her family’s income by raising pigs. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The main challenge for her paddy business is the drought.

This is the first micro loan for Ratana’s group of two female members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Ratana, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay labor fees. She hopes to have a fruitful rice harvest and fatten her pigs to sell for a good price and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Pasaquiquim Group

texts.es:
El señor Roberto esta casado, tiene 55 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales no están estudiando por falta de recursos, se dedica al comercio a la atención a un tienda de artículos de consumo en general, inicio este negocio, vendiendo en la orillas de los caminos a los que pasaban, y hasta el momento tiene ne su casa como local y lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuenta con ela apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios dometicos.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un rpestamoq con el que comprara: Aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, lacteos, etc; espera en el futuro tambien instalar un punto de venta para venta de medicamentos, ya wque hace falta en la comunidad donde vive, Las demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crizna de anmales y al comecio.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto is married, is 55 years old, has a 4th grade education and has three children who are not in school due to lack of resources. He is in business and owns a general goods store.  He started this business selling to passerby on the side of the road.  He has 18 years of experience, but at the moment, his home is also his store.  He counts on the support of his wife who is devoted to domestic chores.  

He is organizing a group to apply for this loan with which he will purchase: carbonated water, juices, candy, dairy products, etc.  In the future, he also plans to install an area in which to sell medications, since it is lacking in the community he lives in.  The other members of the group are engaged in raising animals and business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la señora María, casada y madre de  niña en edad escolar, se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella realiza esta actividad en su domicilio y lo comercializa en los diferentes lugares donde le soliciten como en centros de trabajo, empresas o donde requieran de su servicio.
María está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su actividad  y comprar insumos como carnes, verduras y granos, para la elaboración de la comida;  por ello La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento y crecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle dar una mejor educación a su hija. María pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member María, is married and mother of a school-age daughter. She works selling food. She makes the food at home and sells it in different places where they ask for it such as work centers, businesses or where they need the service.

María is asking for a loan in order to fund her business in order to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, and grains, so she can make her meals. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her in strengthening and expanding her business and for permitting her to give a better education to her daughter. María belongs to the communal bank Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and grains to use in the preparation of meals in her home-based food business for later sale in work centers and businesses

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng is a 37-year-old mother of six children, five of whom are living with her. Some of them are still in school; some work for others; and a remaining one is helping with the family business. The main source of the family's income is rice farming on a one-hectare area of farmland. Kheng has been doing this for five years. In addition to farming, she also works for someone else to earn additional income. She is able to earn around 28,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her rice paddy business. 

Kheng has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two cycles. The other member of her group has just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Kheng successfully repaid the past loans, which have improved her family's living conditions. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business to provide a good lifestyle for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and renovate her house

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, age 24, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two sons and earns a living through farming rice on one and one half hectares of farmland. She has been involved in this business for several years and is able to earn about 18,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs. Her main challenge is her declining yield due to the drought.

Sokhom’s group consists of two members. The other member is male and both of them are second-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has succeeded in paying back the past loans and has overcome her family's burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Sokhom will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and pay gasoline fees. She hopes to grow more rice to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn is 45 years old. She is married and lives with six children in Takeo province, Cambodia. For more than ten years, Chanthorn has been selling Khmer noodles, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about 5 USD daily. Three of her children are employed and earn about 9 USD per day. 

Chanthorn is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service as his present motorbike is old. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, Chanthorn would like to build a new house and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 31 años, es un hombre muy alegre, convive con Yeny de 23 años y fruto de ese gran amor concibieron 02 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa que compraron gracias a sus esfuerzos cotidianos. Roberto, siempre esta pendiente  en sus tierras; él ha logrado que su parcela sea muy productiva; tiene cultivos de coca, café y cacao; estas están bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos en los centros de acopio, ya que es ahí donde le remuneran buenas ganancias. Esta labor viene trabajando 08 años y cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar el café, ya que es el fruto que le da más ingresos y la cosecha es mensualmente y considera que lo más dificultoso es no poder transportar sus productos, ya que las cargas son pesadas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar su propia moto carguero que así le facilitara en el transporte de sus productos; pero su prioridad es seguir cultivando sus plantas de café. Este es su crédito número 03, por lo cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contento.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café.
texts.en:
Roberto is 31 years old and is a very happy man. He lives with Yeny who is 23 years old. The fruit of this great love is their 2 children. They live in their own house which they bought thanks to their daily hard work.

Roberto is always out working the land. He has managed to convert his land into the most productive in the area. It has crops of coca, coffee and cocoa which are well cared-for and he always receives a good price for the sale of his products in the collection centres, where they pay well. He has been working this way for 8 years and has the support of all of his family. What he likes most about his work is growing coffee, since it is the fruit which earns him the highest income and he harvests it monthly. The most difficult part is when he is unable to transport his products, since the cargos are very heavy.  With time he hopes to be able to buy a freight motorbike which will allow him to transport his products, but his priority is to continue growing his coffee plants.

This is his third credit, for which he promises to meet all of his monthly repayments, since he does not want to create problems for his communal bank with which he is very happy. He will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Toer's Group

texts.en:
Toer lives in a rural area of the Ek Phom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He is 43 years old and single. To make a living, he has been rice farming on one-hectare of farmland for twenty years, and also complements this income by selling sugarcane juice. He is able to earn about 43,000KHR per day and manages to save around 10,000KHR. Drought is the main challenge for his paddy-field.

Toer’s group consists of two members, who have both been with VisionFund for one cycle. He has paid back the entire past loan with success and it has helped him to expand his business gradually. Now he and his group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy a sugarcane-juice squeezer, cans, and straws. He hopes to earn more income from his business, so he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sugarcane-juice squeezer

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov is 22 years old. She is married and lives with one kid in Takeo province, Cambodia. For more than two years, she has been selling vegetables, earning approximately 10 USD per day. Her husband, who appears in this picture, helps her run the business. 

Srey Pov is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport her vegetables to sell. Her loan will help improve her family’s finances. In the future, Srey Pov would like to expand her business and send her kid to a good school. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport vegetables to sell

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is a responsible housewife who devotes her time to taking care of the family and helping her spouse manage their rice farm. She is now 25 years old and the mother of a young kid who just enrolled in school last year. Uk needs to earn more income to support her child's present and future education. For his reason, Uk has begun to diversify into other forms of agriculture like fishing, to stabilize her finances and ensure a bright future for her child. In spite of hardships and difficulties, Uk has a strong determination to improve their standard of living. 

Now, Uk needs to acquire more capital to purchase a piece of land to increase her rice production. She believes that she can improve the business and yield a better income as she continues to struggle with her hardships.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to increase her rice production.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que mas le solicitan ,la socia elabora segundos como arroz con pollo,saltado,sopas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de venta de flores,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz y aceite para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. She continues with her business of selling food. She sells on foot to the customers who request it. She makes seconds such as rice with chicken, stir-fry, and soup among others. The business is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day to her business. At the same time, she continues selling flowers, as this is the way that she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as rice and oil for her business.

She is grateful for the loan approval and she promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and oil for her food business

loans.name: Gjystina

texts.en:
Gjystina is 39 years old with five children, all of whom are going to school. They live in northern Albania and Gjystina’s activity for the last seven years has been livestock. She has been selling milk to local dairy farms and baby calves to locals ever since. She has been able to build a good and steady clientele that has helped her earn an income for her family.

Gjystina has plans to educate all of her children, but before that happens, she needs to increase the size of her house. The house they live in is too small and all of them, parents and children, sleep in the one room-house. She is requesting a Kiva loan and the lenders appreciation of this matter.

Kiva lenders' contribution will be a tremendous help to her and her family and she is very grateful.

Note that Gjystina applied for another loan in the past and repaid it.

loans.use: To add one more room to their current one-room house

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Thol is 44 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Thol is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase pigs and fodder for breeding. By doing so, she could earn extra income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fodder

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao, at her age of 46, is a married mother who has been residing with her family in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has two grown-up children who both are settled into marriage and have independent lives. Sao is very passionate about supporting her family through her farming business. She owns and manages a few hectares of farmland where she grows seasonal crops, primarily planting rice, potatoes and types of bean to sell. She is glad and thankful that her husband helps her in a suitable manner to enhance their farming practices and increase their output each harvest season. She typically earns in the vicinity of 20,000 KHR per day. 

With the 1,000,000 KHR loan she requested, Sao will be able to purchase potatoes for planting and pay for domestic laborers to prepare the land. She is convinced that she will have a fruitful harvest and thereby increase her household income through the loan help. Sao is confident about repaying back her loan as it is the first time she is getting a loan from HKL.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for planting and pay for domestic laborers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam, age 36, is a responsible and hard-working woman who has been running a farming business with more than 20 years of experience. Her husband has recently become engaged in a motorcycle transportation business in Phnom Penh. Soam grows mostly rice on her own farmland, generating an average of 10,000 HKR each day. This couple was married 15 years ago, but they don’t have a child yet. They would be glad if they would have a child like other villagers. 

To further expand her farming business and enjoy a plentiful harvest each season, Soam is looking for financial assistance through HKL, a long-lasting Kiva partner, to purchase extra pieces of land for farming. She is very grateful and appreciative of the constant support she has from all of you.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, a 55-year-old single parent, works very hard for a chance to experience a better living standard. She manages a farming business in s small village in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Four of her children always help her in the business in order to maintain good crop production and one of her children has an independent life.

Due to the lack of animals to maintain her rice field, Im usually pays to rent a tractor to till her land every season, which affects her cash flow. Therefore,  she is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a couple of cows for farming purpose. She hopes for the further development of her farming business in order to experience a measure of prosperity some day.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato, es un hombre trabajador, tiene 59 años de edad; él junto a su esposa Donatilda de 50 años y sus 05 hijos, viven en su propia casa, ya que logro comprarla gracias a su empeño de cada día. Hace 34 años, el señor Fortunato se ha dedicado al agro; el tiene su parcela con plantas de café; en sus tiempos de desyerbo cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos pero en las cosechas contrata a jornaleros para que puedan extraer los frutos de manera rápida; sus sacos de cosecha son comercializados en los centros de acopio, ubicadas a una hora de su comunidad. Para él su trabajo es una actividad que siempre le ha dedicado mayor tiempo, sin embargo la dificultad es trasladar los sacos pesados hasta su punto de ventas. Con el préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas de café. Este es su crédito número 08, se siente contento por la confianza que le brindan los financieros, ya que así seguirá con su trabajo. Asimismo le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque trabaja con socios dinámicos y sobre todo responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a hard working man. He is 59 years old. He lives with his wife Donatilda, who 50 years old, and their five children, living in their own home that he was able to buy thanks to his daily efforts. Fortunato has been working in agriculture for 34 years. He has a parcel of land with coffee plants. During weeding time he has the help of his children but during harvest he hires laborers so they can harvest rapidly. The harvested sacks are sold in the collection centers located an hour from his community.

For him, his work is an activity that he has always dedicated a lot of time, although it is difficult to transport the heavy bags to their point of sales. 

With the requested loan he will buy fertilizer for maintaining his coffee plants. This is his eighth loan. He is happy because of the confidence offered by the lenders as he can continue with his work. He also likes being part of his communal bank because he works with energetic members who are above all trustworthy. 

He will buy fertilizer with the 1,000 soles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
A Khom is 58 years old and is a mother with five children, three of whom help with the family business. She lives in a rural area of the Bakan district located in Pursat province, Cambodia. To provide for their family's daily needs, Khom and her husband grow paddy rice as their primary source of income. To better feed her household, the couple also catch fishes and eels to sell for extra income. Khom has run these businesses for about 30 years, and her efforts earn her about 24,000 KHR per day.

Khom is requesting her first loan with the Kiva partner has VisionFund along with her loan group co-member. She and her partner are requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR each. As a group leader, Khom will use her portion of this group loan to buy materials for her fishing business such as materials (line, pole, and hook), fish trap, and cast net. Via her use of this loan portion, Khom hopes to catch more fish and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies such as line, poles, hooks, traps, and nets

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, aged 41, lives in Pursat province’s Bakan district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, one of whom is assisting her in the family’s business. Two oher children, both females, are working in Thailand as paid workers like their father. Channy has been making her living through rice farming for many years, enabling her to earn approximately 19,000 KHR per day. Sometimes she experiences drought and floods, which destroy her crops. The unexpected climate change has caused a big challenge for her business. 

This is the first loan for Channy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the help of this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her rice-farm and cover the passport fees for er children who are going to work at a factory in Thailand to earn more income to help the family. Her only hope for the future is to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I , el socio continua dedicandose a ejercer su carrera de contador, el socio cuenta con una oficina donde el trabaja de forma independiente asesorando a clientes que necesiten sus servicios,el socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su carrera el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo , el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para los estudios de su hija y para algunos gastos personales.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Felix belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE I.  He still works as an accountant.  He has an office where he works independently, helping clients who need his services.  He has being doing this work for quite some time and his business is doing well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day. Felix is responsible and hardworking, as this is how he helps his family get ahead.  

Felix is requesting a loan to pay for his daughter's education and to cover some personal expenses.  He is thankful for the loan he has received and promises to make his payments as agreed

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is aged 21 years and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been working in a rubber field for a fee for three years. The current business earns her about 8,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Mom’s group consists of five members, two of whom have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. Mom completely repaid the loan which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Mom, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy household supplies such as plates, clothes and other materials for consumption in the family. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have sufficient household supplies for consumption and also hopes to fulfill her dream to run a new business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy household supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de peluqueria,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un pequeño local donde realiza su trabajo como cortes de cabello,teñido,manicure entre otros,la socia trabaja desde las 09:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de una secadora y tintes para el cabello.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the communal bank “Comuzone I.”  She continues with her hair salon business.  She has spent a good amount time in this business which is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She has a small location where she carries out her work like cutting hair, dyeing hair and giving manicures among other things.  She works from approximately 9:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.  She is a responsible and hardworking person and being this way she has moved forward with her family.

Vilma is applying for the loan in order to purchase a hair dryer and hair dyes. 

She feels very grateful for the loan given to her and is committed to complying with her established installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and hair dyes.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Rorn is a 36-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and too young for school. To support the family, she has worked in a rubber field for a fee for several years. She can earn about 6,000 KHR per day and save about 2,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Rorn’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and this is the second microloan for Rorn’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loan which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase and grow her rice successfully so as to improve her family’s standard of living and so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chhy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chhy is a 57-year-old mother of five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice on 3.5 hectares of farmland for ten years and selling grocery items to help the family generate income. She is able to earn approximately 10,000KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Lacking of water supply is the main challenge for her rice paddy-field.

Chhy has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has fully paid back the past loans while the other members of this group are just with VisionFund this cycle. The past loans have helped her better support her family’s living. Now she is leading her group of three to seek a loan. Chhy will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items for resale. With this loan she hopes to grow her rice more healthfully and timely so as to make her family's living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Wilmer de 27 años de edad, es casado, su esposa trabaja para el Ejercito de Nicaragua, tienen 2 hijos, uno de 3 años de edad que aun no estudia y otro que esta estudiando la secundaria. La casa que habitan es propia, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad para la Alcaldia desde hace 3 años, es hombre muy trabajador que con esfuerzos y creditos ha construido su vivienda para brindarle a su familia un lugar seguro donde vivir. Solicita este nuevo credito para mejoras de vivienda, para reforzar un muro de retencion en la parte trasera de su patio  que le servira para evitar que la casa deteriore y tambien para reparacion de un sumidero que le dejaron mal construido.
texts.en: Wilmer is 27 years old and married.  His wife works for the Nicaraguan Army. They have 2 children, one is 3 years old and does not attend school yet and the other is in secondary school.  They own the home where they live.  Wilmer has worked as a security guard for the local government for 3 years.  He is a very hardworking man.  With effort and loans he has built his home to provide his family with a safe place to live.  He is requesting this new loan to make improvements to his home, to reinforce a retention wall in the back part of his patio.  This will prevent the house from deteriorating.  He will also repair a drain that was poorly constructed.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Chocruz Sijense Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta es madre viuda, tiene 22 años de edad. no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se de4difca al comercio a la venta de frutas y verduras, inicio este negocio, vendiendo aguacates, y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, frutas y verduras, y mejorar la cantidad de su venta, en el futuro espera tener otro punto de venta y así mejorar sus ingresos. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales, y a la confección de prendas.
texts.en:
Marta is a widowed mother and is 22 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to study. She has three children, one of them is studying. She is engaged in the sale of fruits and vegetables. She started this business selling avocados, and she has six years of experience now. 

She organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy merchandise, fruits and vegetables, and improve the amount of sale. For the future, she hopes to have another point of sale and thus improve her income. The other members are engaged to animal breeding and clothes tailoring.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Kristjana

texts.en:
Kristjana is 29 years old and married with three children; the oldest child is five and the youngest twins are two and a half years old. They live in a main city in the southeastern Albania where Kristjana and her husband (in the picture) established a construction business two years ago.
 
Both of them have excellent skills at this trade and are somewhat busy because of the growing needs for building/renovating houses in their city. The lack of building materials and necessary tools causes frustration at times and Kristjana is now requesting a loan to purchase those. Having little kids, it has made it almost impossible for them to save money to invest in the business, they said. The purchasing and using of new tools will help them do more work that eventually will result in more income for their family.

Kristjana is appreciative to all lenders and wants to thank them all in advance. Kindly note that this is the second loan; the previous one has been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy building materials and neccessary tools for their construction business

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадасу 49 лет. Он вдова и на воспитании имеет 1 сына. Более 2 года она занимается реализации косточек абрикоса. Она покупает косточки и дома чистит их в специальном аппарате и продает на местном рынке. В ведении бизнеса ей помогают сын и невестка. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  7000 сомони для покупки косточки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukadas is 49 years old. She is widowed with one son. She has been selling apricot kernels for more than two years. She buys the kernels, peels them in a special device at home and sells them at a local market. Her son and daughter-in-law help her in her business.
Mukadas has requested a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy apricot kernels. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy apricot kernels to sell

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
Hou, 33, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and are too young for school.

Hou has been rice farming on one hectare of farmland for five years growing various kinds of vegetables, such as cabbages, chilies and cucumbers to supplement the family's income. The current business earns her about 30000 KHR per day and manages to save about 15000 KHR each day for future needs.

Hou’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She fully repaid the past loan, which helped her have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Hou is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so she will gain more income to fulfill her dream of buying a decent motor for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chanty's Group

texts.en:
Chanty, 49, lives in a rural area of Sampov Meas district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and some of whom are still in school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on a four-hectare area of farmland--a business she has been in for almost thirty years. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice paddy business.
 
Chanty has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has completely repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihoods. Now leading her group of six members to apply for a loan, Chanty will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to  buy gasoline for water pumping. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthfully and also wants to raise pigs in order to help the family generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Savoeurn, 52, lives in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children, one of whom is dependent on her. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on one-hectare of farmland. Engaging in this business for twenty-eight years, Savoeurn is able to earn about 23,000KHR per day and manages to save approximately 16,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Crop yield being destroyed by drought is the main challenge for her business.

Savoeurn’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her family’s condition. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy three piglets for raising in order to earn additional income for the family. Savooeurn hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice fruitfully so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in one of the district of Battambang province, Savon grows red corn to make money supporting her family. She is married and aged 23 years with three dependent children, whom are all school-aged. Her husband also helps at the corn field. Their business struggles when crops produce low yield as a result of insects and natural disasters.

Savon's group is new to VisionFund. Savon was appointed to be a leader and she is leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 800,000 each. With her portion, she will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her corn plantation hoping that the crops will produce higher yield so that she can sell them for good money and hence set aside some saving for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her corn field

loans.name: Telab Group

texts.en:
"Telab" is a good group, and it's called that because its members are very united and both are good friends.

Eunice is a very responsible lady who is 33 years old. She's married and has four children aged 8, 11 and 14 years. She has twins among her kids. She has been selling fish in the markets for 5 years now, and the loan will help her to buy a lot of fish to sell. This is her 5th loan with ID-Ghana and she needs 600 Ghana Cedis.

Eunice has a very important goal, which is to improve herself and eventually sell many more things, so that in the future she can own her own cold store.
Eunice says that her fellow member is very nice. She has known her for a very long time and what's more, they're both very good at making their repayments.

Together they need a total amount of 1500 Ghana Cedis.

loans.use: To buy more fish so that she can sell to customers.

loans.name: Pranvera

texts.en:
Pranvera is forty five and has two teenage children who still attend public schools. They and all live in a little town in south-central Albania. Before the collapse of the regime she worked in the retail industry. As a young woman at that time, she enjoyed the job: matching accessories to clothes, clothes to clothes and serving clients. 

After the 1990’s she performed odd jobs because she had no other opportunities until five years ago when she opened her own boutique.

Pranvera has built a very good clientele and is content with the income she generates. Now she plans on adding more items to current inventory and this will help her generate more profit. This way, she will be able to send her children to university, should they fulfill the academic requirements.

loans.use: To add more inventory items for her boutique

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is married, is in her mid thirties and has two very young children. They all live in a little village in south-central Albania.

Mimoza has been involved in the livestock industry selling milk and other dairy products to locals for the past seven something years, and has also been operating a little grocery store in their neighborhood. Her husband has been helping her out as well, because he doesn’t have a job of his own.

Mimoza now wants to buy one more cow to increase the dairy production and this is why she is requesting a Kiva loan this time. She hopes that she will receive some financial help from lenders and she is thankful to all of them.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: El sr. Carlos de 32 años de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de el, la casa que habita pertenece a su esposa. El trabaja como policia municipal para la Alcaldia desde hace 5 años, del su salario depende toda su familia ya que el es el unico que trabaja y da la manutencion a su hogar. Solicita el nuevo credito para la construccion de un cuarto en la parte trasera de su casa, esto con la intencion de iniciar la construccion de su casa ya que en la que actualmente viven es de madera y sus intenciones son construir toda su vivienda de concreto en un futuro para contar con un lugar con mejores condiciones y mayor seguridad para vivir.
texts.en: Carlos is 32 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker.  They have 3 children who depend on him and the home where they live belongs to his wife.  He has worked as a municipal policeman for the local government for 5 years.  His family depends on his salary because he is the only one who works and supports the household.  He is requesting a new loan to construct a room in the rear part of his home.  This will be the beginning of construction on a new home. The house they currently live in is made of wood and their intention is to build a home entirely of concrete in the future so they will have a place to live in better conditions and with better security.

loans.use: to continue construction on a room.

loans.name: Avelina Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,pefumes,entre otros,la socia trabaja de forma independiente y a pedido a quienes le solicitan como amistades y clientes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como perfumes y colonias para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Avelina Margot is a member of the community bank Comuzone I. She continues with her business selling beauty products like creams, colognes and perfumes, to name a few. She works independently and on request for her friends and customers. She has been in this business for a good while, which has gone well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is a responsible and hard-working person, knowing that this is how she will get her family ahead in life. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes and colognes for her business. 

Avelina Margot is appreciative for the granted loan, and promises to comply with her established payment plan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as perfumes and colognes, for her business.

loans.name: Xhixhe

texts.en:
Xhixhe is in her mid fifties with six children and became widowed long ago. “Raising all the children on my own and taking care of them financially and otherwise, has been a real struggle. At times I thought I wouldn’t make it through, yet I made it, and am happy now,” she explains. “I was very patient and had unconditional love for them, and kept praying to God to give me strength to deal with all the hardship.”

Five years back, Xhixhe started to babysit and look after elders and has since been doing that. “It suits me--my caring and nurturing nature--and I just love it,” she said. At the moment, she is looking after an elderly couple and their grandchildren.

Xhixhe now wants to improve her family's living conditions and is requesting a loan. She keeps praying that lenders at Kiva will lend to her.

loans.use: To repair her old and damaged small family home

loans.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es: La socia es la señora Roxana, ella continua con su actividad como docente de educación inicial, pero paralelamente también continua con su negocio de cabinas de Internet. Roxana en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para realizar instalaciones y actualizaciones como software, filtros  y programas de antivirus en sus equipos de cómputo. Roxana está muy agradecida con la ayuda que le proporciona KIVA, para poder mantenerse en su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Roxana pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Roxana continues to work at her job as a school teacher. At the same time, she also continues to manage an Internet café. Roxana is taking this opportunity to request a loan for installations and upgrades. She will buy software, filters, and antivirus programs for her computer equipment.

Roxana is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her maintain her business, which enables her to provide a better quality of life for her family. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy software, filters, and antivirus programs for her computer equipment.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: Leopoldo, de 36 años; es un hombre trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Martha de 30 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes promete brindarles una buena educación. Leopoldo, es un hombre muy laborioso, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante; se dedica a la venta de productos de comestible (cereales, verduras, conservas, bebidas, etc.); el puesto de Leopoldo es muy concurrido por sus compradores, ya que sus ventas empieza desde muy temprano y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 12 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar a una hora y media de su comunidad para tener que abastecerse de mercadería. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así suministrarse de abarrotes. Este es su crédito número 07, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará cereales, verduras, bebidas, entre otros.
texts.en: Leopoldo, 36 years old, is a hardworking man.  He owns the home where he lives with his partner Martha, 30 years old, and their 3 dear children, to whom they promise to provide a good education.  Leopoldo works a lot.  He tries to be outstanding in his job. He sells groceries (grains, vegetables, canned goods, drinks, etc.).  His shop is well visited by his customers.  His sales begin very early and he is ready to receive his first customers.  What he likes best about his job is talking with his customers, and that is one of the skills he uses to attract more customers.  He has had his business for 12 years and feels that the hardest part of his job is traveling 1.5 hours from his community to stock up on merchandise.  With this loan he will purchase more products for his business so he will be stocked with groceries.  This is his 7th loan.  He feels like the loan will help him make progress with his business and he will make his payments as scheduled.  With the 2,000 new soles that he is requesting, he will purchase grains, vegetables, and drinks, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase grains, vegetables, and drinks.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn is 24 years old and a resident living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been doing farming business for nearly 10 years to support her family. Yorn was very happy with the previous loan help; she used it to rebuild her house to keep her family in good living conditions. She is very thankful to kind lenders. As of now, Yorn would like to have another loan to make improvements in her farming business. She will use it to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. It would provide her crop with good growth and she hopes to have better yields for the sake of her children. In the future, Yorn would like to further expand her farming project and make it a viable source of the family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is a 52-year-old married woman who is very conscientious in her rice farming as well as mortar and pestle making business. She works alongside her spouse accompanied by the support from some of her children to maintain a high productivity of her output. Chhay is the mother of five children, one of whom is already married. 

She has been a client with HKL for three times already; those loans completely offered great help to better her living situation and she has paid her debt back on time. Now, she is submitting a new request because she would like to link to the public electricity for home energy. Chhay is very happy because she will be able to use some tools run by electricity in order to make her mortar and pestle business more productive.

loans.use: to link to the public electricity for home energy.

loans.name: El Paraiso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal el Paraíso está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios desde hace 9 años, algunas socias se han mantenido todo este tiempo y otras han ido ingresando en el transcurso de estos años, viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar con una arquitectura antigua y moderna, sus calles son coloridas por la vestimenta de su gente que se enorgullece mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son mujeres que tienen un gran carisma y mantienen su buen humor a pesar de las adversidades de la vida, pero son luchadoras que día a día buscan la manera de sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Miriam, tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 8, 5  y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es aserrador, la casa en la que viven es propiedad conyugal siendo el fruto del trabajo en su matrimonio. 

Doña Miriam pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos quienes son pequeños, pero como es una mujer emprendedora cría animales como: cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y borregos a los que los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Paraíso” (Paradise) consists of 15 members, 13 women and 2 men. The group has been in existence for nine years. Some of the members have been with the group the entire time, while others have joined over the years. They live in the parish of Cumbe in the city of Cuenca, a place that has both ancient and modern architecture. The streets are colorful and the people are proud that they have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. These members possess great charisma and have maintained a good sense of humor despite the adversities they have face in life. Every day they strive to find ways to move their families forward.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Miriam. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children (ages 9, 8, 5, and 3). Her three older children attend school in the city. Miriam’s husband is an operator at a saw mill. They own the house in which they live and it was acquired after they got married.

Doña Miriam spends most of her time at home taking care of her children since they are young. However, this enterprising woman also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep and sells them in her community. Miriam also engages in farming, but what she harvests is only used for household consumption. She sells if there is a surplus. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs, guinea pigs, and feed for these animals.

Her goal is to have a vehicle of her own.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Ally, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three boys who are still in school. His business since 2000 has been a general store where he sells different items. He works from 6AM to 9PM daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

He is requesting a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy a freezer in his general store business and to cover household expenses--he has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to restock a variety items in his general store business to resell. His dream is to one day be able to buy his own nice car.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Reli" which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock a variety of items in his general store to resell.

loans.name: María Eufemia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, compran y venden adornos y cerámicas,   dos veces por semana ellos compran todo tipo de cerámicas para luego viajar a varias ciudades de la sierra, lugares donde ellos vende sus productos para lo cual se quedan una semana en estos lugares entregando y cobrando lo que llevan, luego regresan descansan una semana y vuelven a viajar. Llevan más de 22 años que se dedican a esta actividad y les ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que son los mejores.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para cumplir con sus clientes. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda y llegan cuando más lo necesita.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender  sin tener que estar viajando y un carro  ya viajan en transporte público.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

María lives here.  She is 49 years old, married, and has two adult children who are on their own.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband are merchants who buy and sell decorations and ceramics.  They buy all types of ceramics twice a week and then travel to various cities in the mountains, places where they sell their products.  They stay in these areas for a week, making deliveries and collecting.  Then they return home for a week and travel once more.  They’ve been doing this for 22 years and things have gone well for them.  They buy from artists in the zone because they’re the best.

She will use the money from this loan to buy artifacts of all types and styles so they can fill customer orders.  She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have been a great help and she gets them when she needs them the most.

She dreams of having a shop so that she can sell without traveling, and a car so that they no longer need to travel by public transportation.

loans.use: to buy artifacts.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: La Señora Idalia es Profesora desde hace 29 años, es casada, con 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como técnico en refrigeracion. Sus objetivos en la vida es mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia, es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para darle a su casa una mejor seguridad y sobre todo una mejor vista con la construccion del muro en su propiedad. Idalia pretende seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco junto con su familia aportan para que eso se haga realidad. Sus objetivos a largo plazo es cancelar el presente Fianaciamiento y continuar trabajando para ver cumplido el sueño de tener una casa comoda y segura para disfrutarla con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Idalia has been a teacher for 29 years. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a refrigeration technician. One of her goals is to improve her family’s quality of life. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that there will be better security around her home. The best way to do this is to build a wall on her property.

Idalia intends to continue making gradual improvements to her house. She and her family will do whatever it takes to make this a reality. Her long-term goals include repaying this current loan and continuing to work toward her dream of having a comfortable and safe home that she can enjoy with her family.

loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail;la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos naturales,la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia el cual se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de productos naturales para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Comuzone I".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, pertaining to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is named Josefina Abigail.  She continues working in the business of natural product sales.  She has been in this business for years, and it's going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it.  She has a store where she sells her merchandise, which is located in the center of the city.  She works from 8 am until approximately 6 pm.  She is a responsible and hardworking person, being that in this way she will get her family ahead.

She requests the loan to buy natural products for her business.

The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to complete the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Yu, 43, is a married woman living with her spouse and three single children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Her two older children have married and started their new families. 

Aside from the bustle of farming activities, Yu also pays attention to her hog raising business, which she has operated in a wooden pigpen in her backyard. Upon maturity, she usually sells them to traders and local butchers in her neighborhood. She has been raising piglets for almost five years.

Yu would like to add 10 more pigs to her pig farm, and she will separate the small ones to another place when they are a month old. Due to insufficient capital, Yu is asking for a loan of 1000000 KHR to make this purchase. Through her perseverance and hard work, she hopes to make her businesses a viable source of income for the family and achieve a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Jumanne, who was born in 1976, is married with four children who still go to school.  He has had a food shop business selling rice, beans of different kinds, maize and wheat flour, and sugar since 2002. He is currently needs to start a broiler chicken business. He works from 6am to 10pm daily and he is able to make a small monthly profit.

He request for a fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and a sofa set, to finish building his family house, to repair his vehicle, and to cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to start broiler chicken business.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a solar power since is cheaper to use than other power sources.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Munduli B" which totals 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a broiler chicken business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a thirty-five-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been providing internet and secreterial services for three years, and this business is located on a busy street. He is also a farmer who mainly grows bananas and beans. With the income earned he has been able to build a house for residence. He is challenged by an inefficient supply of electricity and high rental fees for the business premises. He desires educating his child in good schools and seeing him graduate with a master's degree. Edgar intends to use the money to buy a coloured printer and computer accessories for the internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy a coloured printer and computer accessories for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Nuru-Lumo Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 40's, is married with two children who go to school. She has been selling fish for ten years now. She works from 6AM to 10PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to make more bricks, which she expects to use to build her own house, to pay school fees, and to pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more business stock to resell to more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Nuru-Lumo," which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more business stock to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Ivan Ignacio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

El señor Iván, tiene 29 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Su esposa es artesana y comerciante. 

El es artesano y junto a su esposa elaboran todo tipo de cerámicas, las mismas que luego de darles el acabado las ponen a exhibición  en su local pues ellos también tienen un local en una vía principal donde muchas personas se dedican a este tipo de  comercio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, mientras el se dedica a elaborar sus obras su esposa es la encargada de realizar las ventas en el local y por las noches ella también le ayuda en su labor. Llevan más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y les va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica para la elaboración de estas obras. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son mucho más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde venden es de su papá.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

Ivan is 29 years old, married, and has an eight month old son.  His wife is an artist and a merchant.

He is an artist and makes all sorts of ceramics along with his wife.  They display them in their shop after putting the finishing touches on them.  Their shop is on a main street where there are many people who do this kind of business.  He works daily from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  His wife makes sales while he creates pieces.  She also helps him in the evenings.  They have been doing this for more than 12 years and things are going well for them.

He will use the money from this loan to buy ceramic to create more works.  This will be the third cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other lending institutions.

His dream is to have a shop of his own.  The one he has now belongs to his father.

loans.use: to buy ceramic.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar quien se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 12 años este negocio lo aprendió hace 30 años y luego él se independizo y creo su propio mercado en el norte del país.  El crédito lo invertirá en zapatos, sandalias…etc.
texts.en: Julio Cesar, who has been selling shoes for 12 years, learned this business 30 years ago.  He then began working on his own and created his own market in the northern part of the country.  He will use the money from this loan to buy shoes, sandals, etc…

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de costureria,la socia confecciona vestidos,camisas,sacos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia trabaja de forma independiente y a pedido de acuerdo a los distintos compromisos que puedan tener sus clientes,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de telas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Fany Monica belongs to the community bank Comuzone I. She continues in her sewing business; she makes dresses, shirts, and jackets, among other things. She has been in this business for years, which has gone well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She works independently and on request in agreement with different arrangements made with her customers. She is a responsible person and knows that this is how she will get her family ahead in life.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for her business. 

She is appreciative of the granted loan and promises to comply with her established payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in a rural area of Moung Russey district, located in Battambang province, Cambodia. Four of her children, two sons and two daughters, are dependent on her and are still in school while the other one is assisting in the family’s business. She struggles to make her daily living via rice cultivation and supplements her family income via working as a paid worker.

Mom and her husband earn their living through farming rice. Each day, she can earn around 24,000 KHR. She is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past successful loans, which she has fully paid back, have enabled her to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood progressively. She is now leading a group of two members to request a new loan--the other member is a sixth-cycle client with VisionFund. As a group leader, Mom will use her new loan portion to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and a small portion of it to cover her household expenses (food). She highly hopes that her rice field will provide her with a higher crop yields and a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Sator

texts.ru: Сатору 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 16 лет назад он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей продуктов питания.  Он продает рис, макарон, масло и т.п. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет много клиентов. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он должен купить товар для расширения ассортимента, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США  для покупки продуктовых товаров. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погашать займ во время.
texts.en:
Sator is 48 years old. He is married and raising two children.  

In order to support his family and to provide them with all the necessities, he started his own business 16 years ago, buying and selling food products.  He sells rice, pasta, oil etc. at the local market and has many customers.  

Thanks to his efficiency, Sator is successful in business.  He currently needs to buy some merchandise to expand his inventory.  However he does not have enough funding to do so.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD to buy food products.  

Sator is relying on your kindness and promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en: Ne’ma, a 27-year-old married woman, has two sons. To help her husband in paying the household bills, she started working with the help of her husband in the evenings making different types of cleaning products in a separate room in the house. They mix basic materials at home, then fill small gallons for sale. She has applied for this youth loan to increase her productivity by buying a larger amount of raw material.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of raw chemical material.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en:
Erdenchimeg, who is 27 years old, lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a modest and calm tempered woman. Her husband's name is Bumanbaatar; he operates his own retail computer business. Her husband has an apartment mortgage loan. Her son and daughter go to kindergarten. 

Previously, Erdenchimeg worked for a private company as a salesperson, and in 2010 she started her own business selling children's toys, neonatal clothes and perfume in a rented space. She lacks working capital, however, so she needs 4000000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Orgodol

texts.en: Orgodol is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife, Natsagnyam, is 35 years old. His son, Nyamdorj, is 13 years old, and is a secondary school student. Orgodol makes deels, the national clothing, and Mongolian yurt covers with his wife. His monthly business net profit is 350,000 - 550, 000 MNT. In his free time, he operates a taxi service. He is planning to expand his business and improve his profit. He is a hardworking and honest man. He needs 1 750 000 MNT to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Geovanie Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Geovanie es una persona que se dedica a la Agricultura desde hace muchos años, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador y luchador, pretende cultivar otro tipo de hortalizas por eso agradece desde ya el apoyo que le han brindado con este financiamiento. El y su esposa trabajan en conjunto, cuentan con una pulperia en la zona donde habitan, de los productos que cultiva los saca a vender todos los sabados al Mercadito que se lleva a cabo en Rama, sus proyectos es expandir sus cultivos en otros mercados fuera de la zona ya tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Geovanie has been farming since for many years.  He is known for being very hardworking and wants to raise another type of vegetable.  He appreciates the support he has gotten through this loan.  He and his wife work together and run a general store in the zone where they live.  He takes his harvest to sell in the small market they have every Saturday in Rama.  He plans to expand his harvests to other markets outside the zone and to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: A 31-year-old resident named Khoeun lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor district located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent children: one daughter and two sons. To feed her family, Khoeun farms rice on one and a half hectares of farmland, a business that she has been involved in for 11 years, and raises 600 heads of duck, a business which she has been involving for only 3 years. Her main challenge is having insufficient working capital to support her business. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 1,010 USD. This will be her first loan with VisionFund. Some portion of her first loan will be spending on covering the expenses on the rice field such as buying fertilizers and rice seeds, while the other portion will be spent on buying feed for her ducks. She hopes to see an improvement in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and duck feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Svetik

texts.en:
Svetik lives with her daughter in Banavan village of the Ararat region. Svetik is a nurse at a school in Ararat, and her daughter works in the school of Vanashen, a neighboring village. Svetik and her daughter also run a farm, where they cultivate tomatoes and grow peach, apricot and pear trees. 

Svetik wants to start autumn sowing, but she doesn't have sufficient means to do so. She has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation, and to pay for watering the land. Svetik will also hire workers to assist in the cultivation process. This will allow Svetik to gather a good harvest of tomatoes to sell in order to earn enough income to re-invest in her agriculture business next year.

loans.use: to pay for hired workers, fertilizer, seeds, and watering the land.
